She belongs to the communal bank “Los Claveles” (the Carnations) and this is her second loan with MFP.  She is a trustworthy and responsible member.  Ana has the economic support that she depends on for the purchase of the vegetables.  That is why she is requesting the loan so that can buy various produce, vegetables and legumes for her next sale.

loans.use: To buy wholesale produce and legumes to supply her business.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie U. is from the village of Wahigan, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 38 years old. Rosie is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Rosie owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling coconuts, bananas & firewood in the local community. Rosie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rosie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Rosie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like bananas and coconuts. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Rosie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Wahigan, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Orien

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: La señora Paula Martínez M. ella es originaria de la localidad del Chirimoyo ubicado en el estado de Michoacán, conocido porque muy cerca de ahí se encuentra el santuario de la mariposa monarca, las pirámides de Zirahuato, también es conocido por su artesanía y por la deliciosa gastronomía. Doña Paula tiene 22 años de edad, comenta que estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria porque muy jovencita se caso y por eso no pudo continuar con sus estudios y su esposo también no la dejo estudiar. Doña Paula se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, comenta que ella pidió el préstamo a Fundación Realidad para invertir en la compra frutas y verduras ella comprara naranjas, mandarinas, plátanos, manzanas, guayabas, jitomates, cebollas, papas, calabazas etc. Tiene trabajando con su negocio hace aproximadamente 5 años, comenta que empezó a vender sus frutas y legumbres para ayudarle a su esposo con el negocio ya que su esposo ya tenía su puesto ambulante. Ella surte en la central de abastos de Zitacuaro y Toluca, los días jueves y lunes desde muy tempranas horas ella y su esposo van a surtir los días jueves y sábados y toda la semana restante trabaja en su puesto, comenta que ella y su esposo tienen una camioneta y van a las localidades aledañas a su población a vender sus frutas. La meta que tiene para su negocio es más adelante abrir un local estable donde venda sus frutas y vender un poco de abarrotes ya que es uno de sus sueños. Doña Paula está casada con el señor Adrián el cual es comerciante de frutas y verduras, ellos tienen 3 hijos de nombres Isaac de 5 años estudiante de preescolar, Valeria de 2 años y Adriana de 1 año de edad. Ella está contenta porque Fundación Realidad le hizo el préstamo y además se le hace muy poco lo que pagara de intereses y está agradecida por la confianza que depositaron en ella.
texts.en:
Sra. Paula Martínez M. is originally from the town of Chirimoyo in the State of Michoacán, which is known for its proximity to a monarch butterfly sanctuary and the pyramids of Zirahuato. Chirimoyo is also known for its handicrafts and delicious cuisine.

Doña Paula is 22 years old. She says she dropped out after completing three years of high school because she got married and was not able to finish her education. Her husband did not finish his schooling as well. Doña Paula sells fruits and legumes. She requested a loan from Fundación Realidad to invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables such as oranges, tangerines, bananas, apples, guavas, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, pumpkins, and other types of produce. Paula has worked in this business for approximately five years. She started out selling fruits and legumes by helping her husband with his business since he has a mobile produce stand. Her merchandise comes from the central supply depots in Zitacuaro and Toluca. On Mondays and Thursdays, she and her husband wake up early to restock with more merchandise. On Fridays, Saturdays, and the remainder of the week they work at their stand. Paula says that she and her husband have a truck that they use for traveling to the neighboring towns to sell fruit. Her goal for her business is to open a stable location in the future where she can sell fruit as well as a few groceries.

Doña Paula is married to Sr. Adrián, who is also a fruit and vegetable merchant. They have three children named Isaac (age 5 and attends pre-school), Valeria (age 2), and Adriana (age 1). Paula is pleased because Fundación Realidad has given her this loan for which she will pay very little interest. She is also grateful for the trust that has been demonstrated to her.

loans.use: Purchase legumes & seasonal fruits

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 38 years old, married and with two children.  For five years, he has been doing tailoring for a living.  He has managed to grow his business through Faulu Kenya.  This has made him improve his standard of living.  He  aspires to become a major supplier of school uniforms.  He hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.  He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity N. K. is thirty four years old. She is married to a businessman and they have two children aged five years old and two years old whom they hope to give good education to the university level. Her business is located at the busy Gikomba market in Nairobi. She owns a mobile phone accessories shop in which she sells chargers, batteries and other accessories to the local people. She has been in this business for five years now and has managed to employ one person. 

Charity says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 45,000 Kenyan shillings to add stock of mobile phone accessories to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to grow her business and in the future become a wholesaler of mobile phone accessories. She describes herself as aggressive, honest and committed to her work.

loans.use: Mobile Phone accessories

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth N. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Lilibeth is widowed and has four school-aged children. Lilibeth owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling bananas & coconuts in the local community. Lilibeth has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2011, Lilibeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas & coconuts. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lilibeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas & coconuts

loans.name: Chuluunbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Chuluunbaatar is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He owns a plot of land and a house on it. His eldest daughter works as a salesperson and the youngest one is studying Law at the University. His wife Uranchimeg works as a cleaner in a sock-making textile factory. Chuluunbaatar works in a construction company as a plasterer. 

His family used to run a recycling business, collecting different recyclable materials like glasses, soft drink cans, metal and plastics, and then selling them to waste recycling companies for money. Now his children are grown up and everyone in the family is employed, so he decided to change the business profile. 

His eldest daughter had been working for a retail shop as a salesperson for a few years, and gathered quite a good knowledge about retail business. So she decided to run a clothes selling retail business on her own, and she needs some starting capital. He is supporting his daughter's idea, and he is asking for a loan to invest in his daughter's business. She has completed her business plan and at the moment she is looking for a suitable place to rent.

loans.use: to invest in his daughter's new clothes retail business by buying clothes at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is a married woman with five adult-aged children. She is 58 years old and has had a food selling business for seven years.

Visitacion sells fruits and vegetables like bananas, cabbage, tomatoes, carrots and potatoes to the people in her community. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 monthly.

Visitacion is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase bananas, cabbage, tomatoes and carrots.

In the future, Visitacion hopes that her business as well as the general living condition of her family will improve.

loans.use: To purchase bananas, cabbage, tomatoes and carrots to sell

loans.name: Nou

texts.en:
Nou, a 23-year-old fisherman, is from Siem Reap Province and the father of one child who is still young and lives under his care. 

Early every morning, Nou goes to the middle of the river to fish using a various tools. After he is done fishing, he quickly brings his fish by motorbike to the market for resale. For additional income, Nou’s wife works in a local hotel providing massage services for guests. 

Nou is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase fishing equipment, such as a new boat and nets, so he can continue fishing and catch more fish.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
This is Francisca, 52, a resident of Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Manolo, a Public Councilor. She has four children who all now have their own families. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business.

Francisca operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Francisca earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 37,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Francisca hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items for her variety store

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Rosalie has a retail shop that sells bananas and viands (food) like pancit bihon (a rice noodle dish). She has had this business for one year. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy bananas and additional raw ingredients for food preparation. Rosalie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and additional raw ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 47-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur. She has six children between the ages of 5 and 18 and they are all in school apart from the youngest. Her husband works in a secondary school as teacher.

For the past 17 years, Catherine has been running a bar selling beer. This business has helped her pay school fees for her children, feed her family, and meet their needs. She will use the requested loan to buy a variety of beers that will allow her meet the growing demand of her business. The profits from her business will allow her to continue to provide for her family and pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more beer for resale

loans.name: Benkola B Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes qui constituent le groupe BENKOLA B, ont en  moyenne 39 ans, en moyenne 4 enfants et sont toutes mariées dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz, le haricot, le sésame et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, SALIMATA SIDI, la première à droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,75 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions  des femmes du groupe BENKOLA B seront vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. SALIMATA SIDI compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60 000FCFA environs  en fin de campagne.
Les femmes du groupe BENKOLA B espèrent qu’avec cette collaboration de Soro Yiriwaso leurs capacités financières vont se renforcer  et la  productivité est garantie.
texts.en:
The 10 women who make up the BENKOLA B group have an average age of 39 and four children on average. They are all married and living in polygamous families in Baou, one of the villages of the rural community of Banco,  Dioïla prefecture,  Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali.

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops cultivated are, among others, rice, beans, sesame seeds, and peanuts. They are on their first collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso. 

With this loan, SALIMATA SIDI, first on the right in the row of seated women, intends to buy farm inputs, various small equipment, and pay for plowing to maintain about 0.75 hectares of rice and peanuts. 

The produce of the BENKOLA B group will be sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco and N’Golobougou, to a clientele composed of men and women. SALIMATA SIDI expects to make an average profit of 60,000 F CFA at the end of the season. 

The women of the BENKOLA B group hope that with this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso their financial capacity will be greater and that productivity is guaranteed.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seed, fertilizer, herbicide and various small tools.

loans.name: Juana's Group

texts.es:
Juana tiene 40 años vive en Guamote cerca de la ciudad de Ambato con su esposo y sus 7 hijos que tienen 21, 19, 16, 15, 11, 10 y año de edad; Juana se considera como una persona agricultora que es responsable con sus hijos.

Trabaja en la crianza de cerdos consu esposo y su familia, lo viene realizando desde que era soltera; trabaja con FODEMI por 1 año y medio, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de cerdos ya que es muy importante para ella que todos trabajen para que toda la familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida y sus hijos sean responsables y tengan una buena educación.

Su sueño es tener una microempresa de crianza de animales y así mejorar sus ingresos y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Juana, aged 40, lives in Guamote near the city of Ambato with her ​​husband and seven children aged 21, 19, 16, 15, 11, 10 and one year old.  Juana sees herself as a farmer who is responsible with her children.

She works raising pigs with her husband and family; she has been doing this since before she was married.  She has been working with FODEMI for a year and a half.  The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of pigs, as it is very important to her that they all work so that the whole family can have a better quality of life, and so that her children become responsible and have a good education.

Her dream is to have a micro-business raising animals, and so improve her income and thus improve her quality of life together with that of her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a posho mill business. Her potential customers are her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing fuel. She dreams of purchasing another posho mill in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase diesel fuel and service her posho mill machine. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase diesel fuel and service her posho mill machine.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
El señor Felipe, vive en un barrio donde se celebra una gran fiesta el 25 de abril. 
Él es casado con la señora  María Luisa  y con quien procero seis hijos quienes ya cinco ya están casados y una está a su responsabilidad.

    El es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo en fundación y es para invertirlo en la compra  y venta de ropas, para damas, cabellarlo, niños y niñas, para luego llevarlo  a vender en las comunidades cercanas de su localidad, en esta actividad lleva treinta años en la que cometa que le  va muy bien ya que con ellos a sacado adelante  a su familia.

  Su inspiración por esta actividad,  comenzó ya que  necesitaba un trabajo el cual le dejara  ingresos y así poder solventar algunos gastos que se generan en su  hogar y gracias adiós lo ha logrado.

     Lo que más desea es que con ello pueda  seguir trabajando ya si   seguirá delante hasta que dios le preste vida.
texts.en:
Señor Felipe lives in a neighbourhood which celebrates a great festival on 25 April. He is married to Señora María Luisa with whom he has 6 children, 5 of whom are already married, which leaves one under his care.

This is the first time that he asks the Fundación for a loan and he will invest it in buying and selling clothes for ladies, mens, boys and girls. He will sell the clothes later in the nearby communities of his area. He has been doing this work for 30 years and says that he is doing well as in doing so he has managed to raise his family.

He was inspired to get involved in this work as he needed a job that would give him an income with which he could cover some of his household expenses and which "gracias a dios" (thanks be to God) he suceeded in doing.

What he most wants is that he can continue in this line of work for he will continue to go forwards "hasta que dios le preste vida" (for as long as God gives him life).

loans.use: to buy clothes which he will later sell.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es:
zzLa señora Eleuteria es socia del banco comunal San Fernando del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 49 años de edad,  está casada y tiene cuatro hijos, 2 de ellos ya son independientes..
Hace muy poco tiempo que está trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la confección de ropas interiores solo para damas.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles comprará: 6 conos de elásticos blancos, 1 kilo de blondas, 5 paquetitos de cinta satinada.
Son las cosas que necesita para trabajar y tener su stock para la campaña navideña, ella se programa elaborar 800 ropas interiores, y los elásticos los comprará en la ciudad de Lima, allá los costos son menores.
Su trabajo lo realiza en su casa y lo hace por las tardes o noches, por las mañanas tiene que salir a vender al mercado.
Solo espera que en esta campaña todo su mercadería se venda y poder decir que tuvo una buena campaña y que todo su esfuerzo valió la pena.
texts.en:
Eleuteria is a member of the San Fernando communal bank of the Calleri district, departament of Ucayali. She is 49 years old, married and has four children. Two of them are grown. 

She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for a short time. She makes ladies underwear. With her new loan of  S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles she will buy: 6 cones of white elastic, 1 kilo of lace, and 5 packages of satin ribbon. These are the things that she needs to work and have stock for the Christmas season. She plans on making 800 pieces of underwear. She will buy the elastic in the city of Lima, where it costs less. 

She does her work at home during the afternoon or evening. Mornings she sells in the market. She hopes that this season she will sell all of her merchandise to have a good season and for all of her hard work to pay off.

loans.use: to buy elastic

loans.name: Tujinasue Group

texts.en:
Cecilia, who is in her early 30s, is married with three children who are still going to school.  She has had a pharmacy business for four years now.  She works from 8:30 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use the loan for buying more medicine.  Her dream is to one day be able to open another pharmacy in a different place.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Tujinasue", which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more medicines.

loans.name: Hok

texts.en:
From the Baray district of Kompong Tom province, Hok, age 47, is a conscientious villager and a lovely mother of three children. Hok and her husband have cooperated well in earning profits to raise their children. 

This couple owns a lake, which is used to grow lotuses and catch fish. After her husband catches fish and collects mature lotuses from the lake, he brings them home to his wife. Then Hok takes them to sell for money through the village. Together, they typically earn a proximately US$ 8.80 per day to provide the family with a better living. 

Hok is asking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy some fishing materials (machine boat, net, line and hook) and lotus seeds for growing. This loan will help Hok's family increase more profits, which she’ll use to expand her fish selling business.  She wants to buy a motorcycle to transport her fish to sell through the village in the future. Moreover, she wants to save for her children's education and future.

loans.use: buy fishing materials and lotus seeds

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is married with two children. She is twenty-five years old and resides at Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. Mary Jean operates a food vending business in their barangay (village) to make a living, and she has been operating this business for more than ten years. Each month, she earns about Php 10,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of Php 4,000 to purchase more food to sell. Mary Jean has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, her profits will be used for the educational plan of her two kids, and she is hoping that her small business will grow.

loans.use: to purchase more food to sell.

loans.name: Nancy Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora. Nancy es socia del banco comunal Hermano Miguel, vive por el sector de Las Orquídeas en la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde diciembre de 1999, su mezcla entre lo colonia y lo moderno le dan una belleza singular, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres, la variedad en su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.

La Señora. Nancy tiene 23 años, vive en unión libre y fruto de esa unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 2 años de edad y se encuentra muy feliz ya que está embarazada de 8 meses. Su esposo trabaja como comerciante, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Nancy es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa hace  4 años, vende recorriendo la ciudad  con su mercadería y trabaja de domingo a domingo.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños para surtir su mercadería. 

Su meta es tener un local de ropa y así tener un negocio más estable.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Hermano Miguel communal bank and lives in the Las Orquídes zone of the city of Cuenca. This city was declared a World Heritage Site in December, 1999. Its mixture of colonial and modern styles give it a singular beauty: its people maintain the culture and traditions of their parents and its gastronomical variety captivates the palate of both native-born and foreigners.

Nancy is 23 years old and lives with her common-law husband with whom she has conceived a son, who is now 2 years old. She is very happy because she is also 8 months pregnant. Her husband works as a merchant and they do not own their own home but are renters. 

Nancy is also a merchant who has been selling clothing for 4 years by traveling throughout the city with her merchandise and working from Sunday to Sunday.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 3 years and she will use her new loan to purchase pants, blouses, T-shirts and children’s clothing in order to stock her wares.

Her goal is to own a clothing store and have a more stable business.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.ru:
Ярослав женат, у нее трое детей. Он живет в селе Кошелево. Владеет собственным магазином «АВС», который находится около центральной дороги. В свое время жена Ярослава купила дом и перестроила его под бизнес проект. Магазин в этом помещении Ярослав открыл не так давно, всего год назад. Однако он уже успел завоевать отличную репутацию среди жителей городка, которые стали его постоянными покупателями. 

Ярославу необходим кредит в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить больше товара перед праздниками и пополнить свои оборотные средства. В преддверии Рождества и Нового года украинцы всегда не скупятся на продуктовые закупки, поэтому Ярослав хочет быть готов удовлетворить повышенный спрос на сладости, мясные изделия и т.п. Ярослав полон идей и планов на развитие своего бизнеса. Так как помещение магазина достаточно просторное и, более того, у него есть еще один отдельный вход, со временем Ярослав подумывает начать сдавать часть помещения в аренду, или, возможно, откроет что-то сам, когда раскрутит бизнес. Одной из таких идей по расширению является открытие ветеринарной аптеки, что актуально для этой части страны, где многие занимаются скотоводством и держат животных. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Yaroslav is married and has three children. He lives in the village of Koshelovo and owns a store called "ABC" located near the main road. 
Some time ago,Yaroslav's wife bought a house and restructured in for a business. Abut one year ago, Yaroslav opened his shop. Despite having a fledgling business, he has already achieved a great reputation among the townspeople and boasts regular customers. 
Yaroslav needs a loan of 15,000 grivnas in order to stock up on goods before the holidays. In advance of Christmas and New Year's Eve, Ukrainians begin to spend lavishly on grocieries, therefore Yaroslav wants to be ready to meet increased demand for sweets, meat products, etc. 
Yaroslav is full of ideas on how to expand his business. Because his store is spacious and has a separate entrance, he could rent out part of his building or, possibly, open something himself when his business allows it. One idea consists of opening a veterinary clinic, whose services would be in great demand since animal breeding is a common way to make a living for many people in that part of the country.

loans.use: to purchase more goods before the holidays and increase his operating budget.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Magbéfon est une femme âgé(e) de 40 ans. Elle est mariée å un  topographe et a 06 enfants.
Magbéfon travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes et divers depuis 2001. Elle vend à ses clients à domicile. Ses achats se font à Lomé.
Magbéfon a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes.
Dans les prochaines années, Magbéfon voudrait ouvrir une boutique afin de répondre plus à la demande de la clientèle.
texts.en: Magbéfon is a 40-year old woman who is married to a surveyor and has six children. She has been working as a retailer of "pagnes" (pieces of brightly coloured fabric) and other items since 2001. She sells to her customers from home and buys her goods in Lomé. Magbéfon has been granted her fourth loan from WAGES in order to be able to buy "pagnes". In the coming years, she would like to open a shop in order to be able to meet client demand more readily.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes" and other items

loans.name: Pavel

texts.en: Pavel is married and has two sons and a daughter. His family of five lives in Vodyanoye. Pavel owns a greenhouse where he grows tomatoes, radishes, parsley, etc. He’s had it for 10 years. Pavel wants to remodel his greenhouse for the upcoming farming season.  He has about 30,000 Grivnyas invested in this business. He spends 10,000 to 12,000 Grivnyas on seeds and polyethylene film every year. Pavel is requesting a 20,000 Grivnya loan to construct a bigger and more durable greenhouse to ensure better and richer harvests and additional income as a result.

loans.use: construct a new greenhouse

loans.name: Abibatou  Adjokè

texts.fr: Agée de 28 ans, Abibatou  Adjokè est mariée à Firmin un menuisier. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Abibatou  Adjokè vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Abibatou  Adjokè a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Abibatou  Adjokè prépare de la nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce aux poissons) qu’elle vend dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Abibatou  Adjokè vend  des vêtements et sous-vêtements. Abibatou  Adjokè exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d’année. Abibatou  Adjokè s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour élever le niveau de son activité, Abibatou  Adjokè sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
28 Years old, Abibatou Adjoké is married to Firmin, a carpenter. The couple has three children, all attending school and who are their dependents. Abibatou Adjoké lives together with her ​​husband and children.

Abibatou Adjoké left school at secondary level. To support herself and her children, she makes food preparations (corn dough accompanied by fish sauce) which she sells in her neighborhood. As a second source of income, she also sells clothes and under-garments.

Abibatou Adjoké has been carrying on her business for the past ten years. She resupplies in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers and raise the level of her business activities, she is now requesting a fourth credit loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Buy bags of corn and fish.

loans.name: Munguti

texts.en:
Munguti is 42 years old and is married to Mary.  They have three children.  He has been operating his butcher's shop for the last five years selling goat and sheep meat and earning a monthly income of KES 7,000.

He is applying for his third loan of KES 30,000, which he will use to buy more goats and sheep for slaughter.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.  He plans to save his profits to open up another butcher's shop.

His hopes and dreams are to start a hotel business and to educate his children to college level.

loans.use: To buy more goats and sheep to be slaughtered for sale in his butcher shop.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 43 years old, married to Elizabeth, and they have four children. He has been growing and selling vegetables for the last six years, earning a monthly income of about KES 10,000.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET ltd of KES 11,000. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his vegetable farm. With the anticipated profits he will educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to have a well managed business, to fully utilize the potential of the farm, and to have a stable family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.ru:
Хабиба  родилась  в кишлаке  Ниджани  города Истаравшана Согдийской области в семье дехкан. Ей  38 лет. Она имеет троих детей. Более двух лет она занимается  животноводством. Её  муж  по профессии столяр- плотник. Кроме этого он занимается дехканством. У них есть свой дом и хозяйство.
В дехканском  они имеют 2,0 гектара земли,  из них 0,5 га винограда, 1,0 гектар для выращивания корма для своего скота , 0,5 гектар выращивания сельхозкультуры.
 Хабиба сотрудничает с Арванд более двух лет. В настоящий момент она хочет  получить кредит для оплаты учебы своего сына. Она заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en:
Habiba was born into a family of farmers in the village of Nidzhani, near the town of Istravshan in the Sughd region. She is 38. She has three children. She has worked in animal husbandry for more than two years. Her husband is a carpenter by profession, a furniture maker. He also works on the farm. They have their own house and farm. 

On their farm, they have 2.0 hectares of land, of which 0.5 hectares is a vineyard, 1.0 hectares is for growing fodder for their cattle, and 0.5 hectares is for growing crops. 

Habiba has worked with Arvand for more than two years. At the moment, she wants to get a loan to pay for her son's schooling. She thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: pay for education

loans.name: Rex

texts.en: Rex is a farmer from the town of San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur. He is married with one child. He has been in the farming business for five years. This is the main source of his income. Rex is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for his rice production. With this loan, He will be able to improve the productivity of his farm and thus he can harvest as many as they can. In the future, Rex hopes to make his farming business more productive.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for rice production.

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lydia would like to buy laundry detergents, cereals, beverages in large quantity

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet O. is a young married lady living in one of the suburbs of Kampala. She comes from the northern part of Uganda, a place that has experienced war for over 20 years. She moved away from this area as a young girl, searching for security, safety and survival. She settled in Kampala.

Harriet is a lady with a passion to work hard for survival and sustenance. She has been a member of Life in Africa since 2006, and she is very active in the center. She is a supportive and responsible person who is also good at planning activities. Over time, she has developed the skill to face challenges and overcome them.

Before Harriet joined Life in Africa, life was not easy in terms of general welfare. In her efforts to sustain herself, she searched for work. The work she discovered was with the stone quarry, where she did the stone digging and cracking. She was paid for the work she did. After some time of working at the stone quarry and witnessing others' success, Harriet got the idea to start her own stone quarry business. The stone-selling business is doing very well because of the massive developments of construction taking place.

The stone quarry business involves digging stones, cracking them into the desired sizes depending on the client's order, and delivering the cracked stones to the customers. Currently, Harriet has been producing two deliveries of stones supplied, getting a monthly profit of 90,000 Uganda shillings (UGX). (1USD = 1,722 UGX). She has been making two deliveries only due to limited capital. In order to be able to expand her business, she decided to ask for the loan. She expects to get an 45,000 UGX per delivery of stones made on a monthly basis.

To be able to succeed in this business, Harriet is planning to employ people to do the work as it is explained below in the budget.

LOAN BUDGET

For one (1) trip

1)Digging stone 20,000 UGX

2)Transfer fee 7,000 UGX

3)Cracking fee 32,000 UGX

TOTAL 59,000 UGX

She plans to do 4 trips 59,000x4= 236,000 UGX

4)Extra balance/ emergency 14,000 UGX

Total 250,000/=

loans.use: Facilitating laborers - stone digging and cracking

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his bicycle repair business

loans.name: Zohre

texts.en: Zohre E. owns a household items store in the small town of Devechi located on the northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Zohre is married with one child and is looking for funding so that she can expand her inventory to cover a wider range of household goods. Zohre has already successfully paid back two loans with Norwegian Microcredit, proving that she is a reliable client.

loans.use: To expand her current inventory

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed K. is a twenty-four year old high school student. At the age of fourteen, he lost his father. It was then that Ahmed started petty trading to earn additional income to supplement his mother’s earnings. Ahmed raised his small working capital doing work as a casual laborer.

With his previous loan, Ahmed increased his stock and his profit. He is engaging in petty trade before attending school in the afternoons. He is determined to complete his education for a better future.

Ahmed now helps his two sisters with school expenses after the death of his mother two years ago. He is requesting a US$ 175 loan to purchase a small generator to provide mobile phone battery charge services to the community.

loans.use: Purchase a generator to start up a business

loans.name: Tiperia

texts.en: Tiperia is married, and 25 years old. She has run a vegetable garden business for the past few years. She grows cabbages, cucumbers, beans, and tomatoes, and in addition grows taro, taamu and bananas. Tiperia sells these foods at the Fugalei Market, and earns about 60 USD a day. This would be her first loan, and Tiperia is eager to join the business cycle and she is excited to become more active within her borrowing center.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and equipment for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 41 years old, married, and has 12 children. Since 2004, she has been earning money selling provisions, drinks and food. Gloria has been a member of LAPO for the last three years and now needs a loan of US$875 to buy more provision for her store.

loans.use: Purchase of provisions for a store

loans.name: Allah's Group

texts.en: I am Allah R. from a small town Pakpattan, Pakistan. I have three kids, my eldest daughter is eight and is in grade two, my son is five and currently does not attend school and the youngest daughter is two. My husband is a rickshaw driver. His rickshaw is not in very good condition and we need to replace it. I bought a piece of land for my house last year with the profits from our business. I have a couple of friends for many years, I want them to establish their business and earn for their families. Nasreen B. requests a loan to buy an additional motorbike. Naseem A. requests a loan for their grocery store to buy a stock of items such as sugar, flour and oil etc. Nazia R. will also invest the loan to expand their grocery store. Sughran B. requests a loan to buy a cow.

loans.use: To replace older rickshaw

loans.name: Buguwa Ii A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Deborah N.. She is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Deborah is 45 years old and is married. Her husband is a farmer. She has five children, whose ages range from age 10 to 20. Her children go to school. Each week, Deborah makes approximately UGX 15000 in profit. With the extra profits she will make with the help of a loan, she hopes to be able to repay the loan and pay the school fees for her children. Deborah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, to the amount of UGX 300000, in order to start a wholesale business. Tthe loan was paid back on time.

Deborah is joined in her small group by Suzan I., Margret K., Esther N., and Aidah K.. Suzan I. has a business selling new clothing and wants to increase her stock. Margret K. is currently operating a local brewing business and wants to buy a brewing machine. Esther N. operates a farming business and wants to start trading coffee. Aidah K. is operating a retail shop and is requesting a loan to buy more sacks of sugar.

loans.use: to expand her fish business

loans.name: Murodbek

texts.en:
Murodbek is 37 years old and is married with two children. He is a market vendor who sells oil and animal fat in the central local market. In traditional Tajik cuisine, the majority of foods are fried or cooked using much oil and animal fat. So the goods that Murodbek sells are of popular demand among the population. Six years ago Murodbek started his business with a rather small amount of money, and today the business is stable with a turnover of US$9,000.00.

Now Murodbek plans to purchase more oil and animal fat in order to increase the amount of his goods for sale. He requests US$1,000.00 for 9 months. Murodbek thanks all and, being a client with a positive credit history, he promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To diversify goods for sale

loans.name: Nghan

texts.en: Nghan S. is a 45 year old housewife living in Siem Reap. Her husband, Tan Sokhorn is 65 years old and is a local carpenter. He earns US $5 per day to support his wife and their two children. She wants to purchase a better set of carpentry tools for him to keep up with changing technology and protect their family's source of income.

loans.use: To buy better tools

loans.name: Nikolai

texts.en:
Nikolai is single. He lives in Novaya Kahovka, in the Kherson region of Ukraine and sells books in the local mall. Nikolai is the only entrepreneur who managed to open a vending department in this store recently. His business is growing, providing him and his parents with stable income.

Nikolai is a Christian. He has set up honest working policies which help him attract customers and keep his business running. Nikolai is also very hard-working and focused. He is planning to increase his working capital and expand assorted merchandise in his vending place. That is why he is currently requesting a loan of 5000 Grn ($US1050).

loans.use: To increase his book inventory.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia M. sells various foods, including beans and groundnuts. She is married and has two children, but her husband's income as a teacher is insufficient to support her family's living expenses.

Fortunately, the demand for her goods is high, so she is looking to capitalize on such demand by expanding her business and to, in turn, increase her profits. As such, she is requesting additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on high demand for her food products by expanding her business

loans.name: Tatupu

texts.en:
Tatupu M., 53, is married with 4 children. She has 3 years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the village people 4 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

SPBD loans are Tatupu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All the loan money will be used to start the business.

loans.use: Buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, and material

loans.name: Nivia

texts.es:
Nivia lives with her three male sons: Julio, Joaquin and Jorge whom she adores. For eight years she has dedicated herself to selling knitting machines and supplies which she sells from a stall in the city on Sundays and Mondays and from her home during the rest of the week. She has always liked being in business and like a good worker she likes what she does even though as a woman it is sometimes difficult to transport the machines to her small stall. The work is hard as she works all day so that she misses her children. She does not want her children to work but rather to go to school so that they can become honorable professionals so that they can care for her in her old age. She will invest the money she receives from this loan in purchasing merchandise to expand her business so that in the future she can import and export knitting machines.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Nivia vive con sus tres hijos varones Julio, Joaquín y Jorge los cuales son su adoración. Se ha dedicado durante ocho años a vender máquinas y repuestos de tejer los domingos y lunes en su puesto en una calle de su ciudad, los demás días desde su casa, siempre le ha gustado el comercio y como buena trabajadora le gusta lo que hace, aunque en su posición de mujer a veces le resulta difícil transportar sus máquinas hasta su pequeño puesto.El trabajo es duro ya que lo hace durante todo el día, lo cual la hace extrañar a sus hijos a los cuales no quiere verlos trabajar, si no estudiar, para ser profesionales íntegros y que velen por ella en su vejez. El dinero que se le facilite lo invertirá en comprar mercadería para expandir su negocio y en un futuro poder importar y exportar máquinas de tejer.

loans.use: Increase in the machines that she sells so that in the future she can export.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace O. started her local restaurant twenty years ago in Dunkwah, a suburb of Obuasi, where she lives. Since then, she has become one of the most popular food vendors in her neighborhood. She is now 53 years old, married with eight children, of whom four are currently in school.

Grace serves many kinds of local dishes like fufu, rice balls, and banku, among others. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. She is with the community group called Partners Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan and peer pressure to repay the loan. Grace is in the photograph taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantains, meat, fish and firewood

loans.name: Maauga

texts.en:
Maauga T., 34, is married with 3 children. She has many years of experience in the banana and taro business. She sells to the village people 3 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

SPBD loans are Maauga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to buy the equipment used in her business. Her husband and children help out.

loans.use: to assist her in buying materials and equipment used for her business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam H. prepares and sells food in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She works from 6:00am to 4:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately US$ 70 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more of the ingredients that she uses in the foods that she prepares and sells.

Mariam is 32 years old, married, and has 3 children.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to use to cook and sell food

loans.name: Hakibatu

texts.en:
Hakibatu, 29, is married with three children, two of whom are in school and the youngest is still breastfeeding. 

Hakibatu enjoys trading. She sells groundnut – fresh, roasted and in paste form in the local market. She has been selling for four years and through this, has been supporting her husband and their family. 

Groundnut is a seasonal commodity which falls in price when in season. Hakibatu says it is advisable to make bulk purchases during its season when the price is low, store the product and sell it later on when it gains in price. 

She wants a loan to help her realize this dream. Hakibatu belongs to the “Insha Alla” (God will do) group in her community. The group members guarantee one another as collateral to be able to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy fresh groundnuts in bulk.

loans.name: Kean

texts.en: Kean N. is a 46-year-old resident of the Kompong Tom province. He makes a living selling wood carvings from wood he has chopped from the forest himself, then he stores them in his home to sell. He is married to Im Phorn, age 51, a rice farmer who is a mother of seven children, five of whom are single and two of whom are married; two sons are employed as sellers of chopped wood and one daughter works in a garment factory. To help the farming business and alleviate hard physical labor, N. needs to request a loan of $500 for his wife to buy two buffalo to use for plowing the farmland. (Mr. N.'s wife is pictured because he was not available)

loans.use: To buy two buffalo to use for plowing farmland

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua A. sells groceries and firewood (a source of fuel) to the majority of fishmongers at Kawano paado in Cape Coast. She has been selling groceries and firewood for the past four years. Efua has received a primary level of education. She is a single parent with four dependents. She is responsible for paying her family's rent, utility bills and other expenses.

Efua will use this loan to buy more firewood to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba M. is a 54 year old woman. She is married and has four children. Two of her children are learning trades, and the others are in school. She lives with her husband in her matrimonial home, in Koforidua, a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. 
Abiba has sold fruits and vegetables like bananas, oranges, peas, and maize in the  Koforidua market for more than five years. She treks to surrounding villages in Abofour to purchase bulk stocks of these products from the farmers and then sells retail to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, Abiba is not able to buy enough stock from the farmers to make sufficient profit to support her family. She wants to use part of the profit to support her children's education.
  
With a loan of $500, Abiba wants to purchase bulk supplies of bananas, peas, oranges and plantains to enable her to increase her sales and her income. Abiba belongs to a village bank called ‘DaNyame ASE’ which means give "Thanks to God".

loans.use: To purchase bulk supplies of bananas, oranges, peas and maize.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Manuel Antonio R. tiene ya más de quince años dedicando se a la plomería y electricidad a domicilio esté negocio es la fuente de ingreso de su familia ya que tiene 4 hijos pequeños que actual mente están estudiando y quiere lo mejor para ellos. 
  Don Manuel está solicitando un préstamo para comprar herramienta más moderna y de mejor calidad para trabajar, porque la que tiene ya está en muy malas condiciones y tiene problemas para realizar los trabajos.
texts.en:
Señor Manuel Antonio R. already has more than fifteen years dedicated to household plumbing and electricity. This business is the source of his family income. He has four little children who are currently studying; Manuel wants the best for them.

Don Manuel is requesting a loan to buy more modern tools that do higher quality work, because the tools that he already has are in bad shape and have trouble doing the job.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more modern tools

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila tiene 50 años, es casada desD. hace 35 años y madre D. 6 hijos, D. los cuales uno D. ellos vive en su casa. Por más D. 35 años tiene una panadería, tiempo suficiente para ganar la experiencia necesaria para este oficio, ella y su esposo se levanta a las 2.00am para amasar 12 kilos D. la harina, luego trozar la masa mientras el horno se calienta a base D. leñas, una vez caliente el horno se hornean los panes a pulso. Por el alza del precio D. la harina, últimamente no les está resultado muy rentable, por ello quiere comprar una máquina amasadora, para que con ella puedan realizar mayor cantidad D. panes, ya que a mano se hacen bollos con más harina y mayor peso, pero las personas no pagan más, entonces con la máquina tendrán más panes con la misma cantidad D. harina.  Luzmila dice que su trabajo es muy pesado, sobre todo por tener pocas horas D. sueño, pero lo bueno es que tiene ganancias diarias y venden todos sus panes, además D. los pasteles, queques u otros bocaditos que hacen los fines D. semana, y durante los primeros días D. noviembre sus ganancias se triplican, debido a la festividad donD. se preparan unos biscochos típicos D. mucha demanda llamados “huahuas”. Luzmila, en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual en sus pagos, este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y no ha caído en morosidad. El dinero que solicita es para la máquina amasadora que tanto necesita, comprará sólo una D. segunda mano, porque no les alcanza para una nueva.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 50 years old, married for 35 years and the mother of 6 children. One of her children lives at home. For more than 35 years she has ran a bakery, which is more than enough time to gain necessary experience for this job. She and her husband get up at 2:00 am to knead 12 kilos of flour. While the oven is being heated by firewood, she separates the dough into pieces, then bakes the loaves of bread. Because of the high price of flour, her business has not been very profitable lately. She wants to buy a kneading machine so she can make more bread. When making bread by hand, she uses more flour, which weighs more, but the customers do not pay more. With a kneading machine she can make more bread with the same amount of flour. She can also make cakes and other baked items on the weekends. During the first few days in November her sales triple due to a holiday where she makes and sells a typical sweet bread called “huahuas.” This is her 3rd loan with MFP and Luzmila has always been on time with her payments—she has never procrastinated on making a payment. The money will be used for a kneading machine that she really needs. She will buy a used one since she can not afford a new one.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Kneading machine for bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a trailer to carry fruits and to buy fruits for resale.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a 30 year old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband and their two children. Alia has owned a fish shop for five years. She has requested a loan of 500 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her fish shop. This is the first time that Alia has requested a loan.

Alia is speciA. because she likes what she does. Alia decided on starting her business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her fish shop

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora María Cecilia T. O. tiene 31 años, vive en el distrito de Casa Grande, provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudios Superiores Concluidos, tiene 2 hijos.
Ruth tiene se dedica a la venta de comida rápida, su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Recién ha iniciado como socia en Manuela Ramos y miembro del Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II.
Este crédito de 300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de comida rápida y compra de platos descartables.
María tiene como sueño poner una tienda de abarrotes en un lugar céntrico de su distrito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Cecilia T. is 31 years old and lives in the Casa Grande district, province of Ascope, department of La Libertad in Peru. She finished secondary school and has two children. She makes a living selling fast food and runs her business from her home. She has recently become a member of Manuela Ramos and member of the community bank Romanas Luchadoras II. This loan of 300 soles will be invested in the purchase of raw materials for the making of fast food and disposable plates. Maria dreams of being able to establish a grocery store in a location in the center of the district

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for the preparation of fast food and purchase of disposable plates.

loans.name: 43-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Gái Lê Thị (128) is a 59 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Gái is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 43-Nam Ngạn (17-02-43).




Gái is married and has 4 adult-aged children.  To making a living, Gái owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling sweets & confectionaries such as cookies & cakes in the local community.  Gái has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,100,000 VND a month from these activities.




In 2007, Gái joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Gái has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,040,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Gái plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.




About the Other Borrowers in the Group:




1.  Ngô K. Nhật (21) is a 35 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store (she buys shoes and resells them).




2.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Kateba Group

texts.en:
This is John K., Kaday S. and Adamsay K.. They are business people based in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone.

John K. (middle) is the leader of this group. John is 46 years of age. He was born in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and they have five children. Some of the children are in secondary school and the others are in primary school. John is a tailor and has been in this business for over 30 years now. With this loan, he will be able to buy material, especially cotton, which he will sew.

This group is called Kateba. This will be the fourth loan these entrepreneurs are receiving from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have made a meaningful impact on the businesses and personal lives of these people. Their businesses have grown, both in size and in quality. They have been able to pay their children’s school fees and other school-related charges as well as feed their families and meet most of their daily financial needs.

loans.use: Invest in tailoring business

loans.name: Busena

texts.en: Busena A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Busena is 40 years old and is married with a husband that is a peasant. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motorbike for carrying charcoal to the market. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a shop

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee es socia del Bancomunal Siempre Juntas.
Haydee es  casada tiene 42 años, cinco hijos de 26, 25, 22,19 y 16 años, este último está en la escuela estatal.  
Haydee  se dedicaba a su casa hasta  que le propusieron trabajaba bordando par una empresa de exportación, en su casa por seis años bordando, decidió abrir una bodega no le fue bien tuvo que cerrarla, con sus ahorros compro un carro para hacer servicio de taxi,  y se dedico a vender menú en su casa, con las ganancias ha comprado otros dos carros, los cuales los da para hacer servicio de taxi. 
Desde que Haydee esta en Finca  aprendió a invertir en el negocio y le está yéndole  bien. 
Haydee necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de llantas y baterías para sus carros.
El sueño de Haydee es poner un salón de belleza porque ella estudio cosmetología.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of Bancomunal Siempre Juntas. She is 42 and married. Haydee has five children, ages 26, 25, 22, 19 and 16. Her youngest child goes to public school.

Haydee was a housewife until she was approached to embroider for an exporting company, which she did at home for 6 years. She opened a small food store, but it didn’t work out and she closed it. With her savings she bought a car and started a taxi business. She also started to serve meals at home. She has bought two additional cars with her earnings, which other people drive for the taxi service.

Through Finca Perú, Haydee has learned to invest in her business and it is going well. She has asked for a loan of 2,000 soles (US $675) to buy tires and batteries for her cars.

Haydee studied Cosmetology and her goal is to someday start a beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires and batteries for her taxis

loans.name: Matlida

texts.en:
Matlida is a member of the Bwawani borrower group  in Ilala,Iringa,she is 35 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 5 years.she also cares for other 1 dependent.


Matlida started her own business selling tomatoes 8 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Matlida first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more tomatos ,banan,onions.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Matlida hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes,banana

loans.name: Phlorng

texts.en: Phlorng M. is 51-year-old widowed woman. She is the mother of two children who are married but still live with her. She currently sells Khmer noodle for breakfast to her neighbors in the village. One of her daughters is making wooden furniture for a profit. She provides income to better meet the family’s financial crisis. Phlorng M.’s daughter purposes to build a new house in order to live independently. Her savings is not yet enough to begin building. Hence, Phlorng M. has decided to seek a loan from HKL that will be used to add to her daughter’s personal money to build a new wooden house on her own plot of land.

loans.use: To build a new wooden house on her own plot of land.

loans.name: Rita Georgina

texts.es: La Señora Rita Georgina R. C. tiene 67 años. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica  a la comercialización de mercadería en general. Tiene años de trabajar con la institución. Anteriormente se dedicaba a otras actividades, como es la elaboración de alimentos, ventas de frutas las que realizaba en su domicilio, por lo que siempre ha buscado como ganarse el alimento diario. Es una Señora con espíritu emprendedor y cada uno de sus clientes disfruta del buen humor de Rita. En la comercialización de ropa, es ayudada por una de sus hijas, la que entrega a domicilio la mercadería, tanto en la ciudad como en algunas comarcas.  Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de camisas, pantalones, faldas y calzado. El mayor sueño que ella tiene es satisfacer la demanda de cada uno de sus clientes.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Kombinat

texts.en: Kombinat is 63 years old and lives with his wife and five year old daughter in the Bayan-Ulgii province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Kombinat owns a raw material retail business in his town. He began selling raw materials such as sheep skins, wool and cashmere to local garment producers in 2004. Currently, Kombinat earns between 5,000 and 10,000 tugrug  (~3-7 USD) per day. He wants to grow his business in the future so that he can provide a good education for his daughter and a comfortable home for his family.  He is requesting a 600,000 tugrug (~420 USD) loan so that he can purchase a larger amount of raw materials in which to trade at the market.

loans.use: purchasing a larger amount of raw materials

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine S. is from the village of Calube, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Josephine is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine operates a business selling home products. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and other basic needs in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2007, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Josephine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 39 years old and she has managed a retail store in the village of Alinam, Cauayan City for almost ten years now. In addition, she has extra income from retail sales of rice and also electronic cellphone cards. She desires to increase her income, which has motivated her to request a loan of PHP 15,000.00 from the KIVA lenders. She will use the loan to buy additional items to sell in her store. She hopes that generous lenders will approve her requested loan, so that she will be able to help her husband pay for the education of their children.

Her husband is Ferdinand. He works as a farmer and also a tricycle driver. They have been blessed with four children: Diane, 17, Christian, 15, Jason, 11, and their youngest is Jesa Marie, three years old. The family resides in the village of Alinam, Cauayan City, Isabela, a rural area near the national highway.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Laurance

texts.en:
Laurance is a 29 year old man who lives in Beirut, the Capital of Lebanon. Laurance has been working as a taxi driver since 2006. Laurance requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car. This is the first time that Laurance has requested a loan.

Laurance is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and is punctual. His clients are his friends, neighbors and passers-by. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Laurance decided on doing this business because he used to work as a private driver. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by owning several cars and then renting them.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his car.

loans.name: Laura Mercedes

texts.es:
Laura  es una mujer trabajadora que lucha por sus ideales, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región Ucayali, tiene 25 años de edad, es  madre de un hijo menor de edad. Laura se dedica a la  venta de tablas y listones de madera, actividad que lo realiza junto con su esposo, este negocio funciona en su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres perseverantes II” desde hace dos años, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en prendas de vestir.
En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 800 soles que será utilizado para comprar madera y venderlo posteriormente a sus clientes. La meta de Laura es tener una tienda de calzados y prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros.
texts.en:
Laura is a hardworking woman who fights for her ideals. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 25 years old and the mother of a minor child. Laura sells wooden planks and strips for a living with her husband. The business operates in her house. She has been a member of the Communal Bank "Mujeres perserverantes II" for two years. The first loan she received was for 300 soles which allowed her to invest in clothing. At present she needs a loan of 800 soles which will be used to purchase wood and later sell it to her customers. Laura's goal is to have a men's and women's shoe and clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to purchase wood and sell it to her customers.

loans.name: Agahuseyn

texts.en: Agahuseyn Y. has made a living farming and raising cattle for the last 15 years. With two children and full responsibility for providing food for his family, he takes excellent care of his animals as a way to improve his family’s financial situation. Today, Agahuseyn needs to buy several calves so that he can raise them to sell when prices are good and he needs money. He is applying for this loan to make that purchase possible.

loans.use: to buy four calves

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Mimina is the coordinator of the "Mujeres Solidarias" (Women in Soldarity) loan group. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a northern port town that is economically based on tourism. Running water is not potable and electricity is unreliable. She is a widow and lives alone in a simple structure.

Mimina is excited to be taking her third loan from Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her clothing business by purchasing a dozen pairs of pants, t-shirts, and bedsheets. She will use the profits to continue investing in her business, which she hopes will provide her an easy life in her old age. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy pants, t-shirts and bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Mallay Nawed Group

texts.en:
Mallay is the group leader of Mallay Nawed group. There are three members in this group. Mallay is a married woman with three children. She lives in Kabul city and she wants to take a loan for her tailoring business in order to buy a new sewing machine because she had lots of problems with the old one.

Nabellah wants to take a loan for her husband's business. He has a general store. With the loan, he would buy more materials to expand his business. 

Nawed wants to take a loan for his business of selling gas. He wants to buy four new balloons for his shop. 

They requested a group loan of 30,000 Afghani. They all are happy and would like to extend their gratitude to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Teresa C. tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera, y tiene un niño de seis años de edad. Ella tiene un negocio de compra y venta de muebles encargados, además de que también vende productos de ropa, calzado, etc. La señora Teresa dio inicio a este negocio desde hace ocho años, vendiendo ropa nueva, joyas, bisuterías, y otras cosas, sin embargo con el tiempo fue ganando clientes y ahora vende muebles encargos. Cabe señalar, ella dio inicio con capital propio y poco a poco fue haciendo más grande su capital. Ella actualmente está solicitando un préstamo de Fundación León 2000 para realizar compras de muebles, ya que actualmente posee pedidos de clientes, que desea satisfacer lo más pronto posible. Este es el sexto crédito que le brinda Fundación León 2000, todos ellos le han ayudado a generar mayores ganancias y a mantenerse en el mercado, pese a que la competencia cada día es más dura. señora tiene el sueño de tener una tienda de ropa, muebles, y electrodomésticos, que este localizado en el mercado, esto con la finalidad de mejorar sus ganancias y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Teresa C., 28, is a single mother with a 6-year-old son. She has a business buying and selling office furniture. She also sells clothing, stockings, etc. Señora Teresa started this business over 8 years ago, selling new clothing, jewelry, costume jewelry, and other things. As her clientele increased, she began selling office furniture. She points out that she got started with her own capital, which she increased little by little. She is requesting a loan from Fundación León 2000 in order to buy furniture pieces, since she already has the client orders that she wants to fill as soon as possible. This is the sixth loan she will have through Fundación León 2000, all of which have helped her to improve her earnings and keep her place in the market, although the competition is stronger every day. She dreams of having a shop in the market selling clothing, furniture, and domestic appliances, so she can improve her earnings and her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Helyn

texts.en:
Helyn C. is from the village of Damulog , Bukidnon. She is 35 years old and married with three school-age children. Helyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Helyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Helyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI that she used to purchase additional products to sell. She requested a new loan of 11000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her store.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben  es un joven de 19 años de edad que vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el caserío Nueva Esperanza, una zona agrícola del distrito de Olmos, provincia de Lambayeque, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años se dedica a trabajar como chofer de mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros), el nos comenta que la unidad vehicular con la que cuenta es de su padre y que este se la ha brindado para que pueda ganar un poco de dinero y solventar sus gastos personales. Rubén cubre rutas dentro de su caserío y con los caseríos circundantes.

La naturaleza accidentada de los caminos de la zona y el continuo uso brindado a la unidad móvil, ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, por ello Rubén se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la reparación y mantenimiento de la mototaxi.

Rubén es un joven responsable y muy trabajador. Su mayor anhelo es poder reunir en dinero suficiente y poder empezar a estudiar alguna carrera técnica que le brinde la posibilidad de asegurarse un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
