Rubén, 19, lives with his parents and siblings in the Nueva Esperanza settlement, which is a farming area of Olmos district, Lambayeque province, located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo. For the last two years he has been a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) driver. He tells us that his vehicle belongs to his father but his father has offered it to him so that he can earn income to meet his personal expenses. Rubén covers routes both within and outside Nueva Esperanza. Because the roads in the area are in poor condition and his vehicle is in constant use, it needs service and repairs if it is to continue to run properly. For this reason, Rubén is asking for an 800 new sol loan, for the first time, to invest in service and repair of his mototaxi. Rubén is a responsible, very hard-working young man. His greatest wish is to save enough money to study a technical career that will provide him with the possibility of a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair

loans.name: Nasrin Khalid Group

texts.en: Khalid is the group leader of the Nasrin Khalid group. He lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with four children and all the family members benefit from the income he generates. He has a general store where he sells a variety of items. He needs the loan to purchase items which are not yet available in his shop. He wants to attract more clients and expand his business. He hopes to be one of the best businessmen in the future.

loans.use: To expand the variety of items he sells.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la foto es el esposo de María Isabel.
María Isabel es una mujer muy emprendedora ya que desde hace 8 años tiene una venta de gorditas junto con su esposo que la apoya en cada proyecto que ella tiene. En este momento ella necesita comprar piso cerámico para ponerlo en un cuarto que construyo con prestamos de esta institución en el que agradece por el apoyo otorgado.
texts.en:
The person who appears in the picture is María Isabel's husband. María Isabel is a very enterprising woman since she has been selling gorditas (small, thick, corn flour tortillas) for eight years alongside her husband who supports every project she has. Right now she needs to buy a ceramic floor to install in a room she built with loan money from this institution, that she thanks for the support they have given to her.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put in a ceramic floor

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su cuarto ciclo. Podemos hablar de la Sra.Gabriela A. con 23 años de edad , que se dedica a producir tortas, ella elabora las tortas de acuerdo a los pedidos que ella recibe de sus clientes, este trabajo lo realiza por la mañana y tarde es una persona muy trabajadora. Ella la mayor entre otros hermanos y gracias a su trabajo ella puede pagar sus estudios terciaR. y de los hermanos que van en la escuela, agradece por el apoyo que recibe de la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva.
solicita el préstamo para la compra de herramientas que ella utiliza para elaborar sus tortas.
texts.en:
This committee is in its fourth cycle. We can talk about Mrs.Gabriela A., who is 23 years old. She makes a living by selling made to order cakes. She works in the morning and the afternoon and is a very hard worker. She is the oldest of several siblings and thanks to her job can pay for their third-level studies and for her siblings who go to primary school. She is grateful for the support she receives from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva. She is asking for a loan to buy tools to use for making cakes.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools to make cakes like sleeves, coloring, and decorative accessories.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Vivo con mis padres ya que son personas de la tercera edad, por ello he quedado a cargo de ellos								
para cuidarlos y de alguna manera agradecerles todo lo que han hecho por mi.								
Tengamos una tiendita de abarrotes, sin embargo no habia podido tener tanta variedad								
como queria. Pero gracias a ustedes podre incrementar la variedad de mercancias y dar una mejor								
vida a mis padres.
texts.en:
I live with my parents - since they are elderly, I stay at home to take care of them and in a way thank them for all that they have done for me. We have a small grocery store. However, we have not been able to have as much variety as we would have liked. But thanks to you all I will be able to increase the variety of merchandise and give a better life to my parents.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his business

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, de 22 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo William de 24 años y sus 2 hijos Yesira de 3 y Jeferson de 6 meses,  quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. Los largos días de trabajo que tiene Karina en sus tierras, han hecho que se vuelva una gran conocedora de la agricultura, sus cultivos están muy bien cuidados y siempre consigue un buen precio por la venta de sus productos. Lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar la tierra, ya que es la actividad que realiza desde que era niña, sin embargo el tener que transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de Tarma le es muy difícil y pesado. Con el tiempo espera comprar más tierras y así incrementar su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su grupo comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono e insecticidas, para cuidar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Karina, who is 22 years old, is a very happy and hardworking mother of a family. She lives in her own house with her husband William, who is 24, and their two children, Yesira, who is 3, and Jeferson, who is 6 months old. They are the principal motivation for all her efforts. The long days of work that Karina puts in on her land have made her very knowledgeable about agriculture. Her crops are well cared for, and she always obtains a good price from the sale of her products. She has been doing this work for 5 years, and what she likes best about her work is cultivating the land, since it is an activity that she has carried out since she was a girl. Nevertheless, the need to transport her products to the market at Tarma is very difficult and wearisome for her. In time, she hopes to buy more land and thus increase her production. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is saving to make the payments on time, since she does not want to cause problems for the members of her community bank, where she feels very happy. With the 1000 PEN that she is applying for, she will buy fertilizer and insecticides to care for her lands.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Zorigtbaatar

texts.en:
Zorigtbaatar G. is 39 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Arhangai province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. The two oldest children go to a local middle school. Zorigtbaatar has been making traditional Mongolian shoes by hand since 1992 and started operating a transportation business in 2008. His working capital was 60,000 MNT in the very beginning of his shoemaking and now the working capital exceeds 800,000 MNT.

Zorigtbaatar would eventually like to expand his shoemaking business. The continued growth of both businesses - transportation and shoemaking - has enabled him to purchase a car and to improve his family's quality of life. Zorigtbaatar works hard and is a modest, easygoing person. He says, “I hope to operate a stable business so that I can continue to provide for my children's education.” He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase shoemaking materials such as glue, leather, rubber and tools as well as car repairing materials.

loans.use: To purchase shoemaking materials

loans.name: Lyna

texts.en: Lyna C. is a married woman who lives in Pader, Barangay Aguisan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: dried fish vending, fish vending, and selling Ready-to-Wear (RTW) clothes. Her husband, Zalde, who is 35 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 3 and 7 years old. Lyna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, thus uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 7th loan, Lyna is borrowing PHP 18,000 which she intends to use to expand her fish and dried fish businesses so that she can continue to save for the future education of her children. Lyna is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To expand her fish and dried fish businesses

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is a thirty-eight-year-old widow from Lebanon.  In order to raise her six orphans, Hanan developed her skills in handcrafts and made her own business since 2004. She works hard to improve her business and a stable business, for her children's sake, making sure they will have a secure future. Hanan requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to improve her work and buy the necessary merchandise for such industry. Hanan believes that the quality of her work is what keeps her strong in the market. Her hope is to help her children have their own strong businesses.

loans.use: To improve her work, and buy the necessary merchandise for handicrafts

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 32-year-old married lady who is blessed with an 8-year-old son who goes to school.

Jackline joined the Umoja B Group in 2008 so as to easily access loans. She was previously operating a cafeteria where she was mainly selling chips. Later, she took out a loan of 20, 000 KES which she used as capital to start her current business which is selling clothes.

This is Jackline’s sixth year operating the business and she now earns a better income and is able to educate her son. She has requested 40,000 KES to buy premises where she can store her business stock. With the money, she also wants to add stock.

Jackline hopes to expand her business into a wholesale operation in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a business premises and to add stock

loans.name: Nitu

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Nitu C..  She is married and has one child, aged 6.  In 2003, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 7 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid three loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to increase the store inventory.  In the future, Nitu plans to send her children to a good school.  She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: To increase the store inventory

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha U. lives in Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, five of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional relatives. Aisha lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and money for medications. 
She changed her business enterprise from selling crafts to a retail shop selling all merchandise like sugar, salt and soap e.t.c.
Aisha runs a small retail shop where she works seven days a week. She has been in business for less than a year. Aisha has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil, maize, flour and rice. The main challenges for Aisha’s business include seasonality and defaulters. Her goal is to see her business grow large enough to where she can start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more products for her shop nlike bags of suagr, cartons of salt and boxes of saop.

loans.name: Sixta Tulia

texts.es:
Sixta Tulia F. vive ene le barrio San Roque donde tiene su negocio de venta de medicamentos Llamado “Farmacia Sixta”. Su negocio se inició hace tres años como una forma de aumentar sus ingresos del hogar porque trabaja con su esposo que conoce perfectamente el área farmaceuta desde hace mas de 20 años, en su negocio se dedican a vender medicina al detal en su local y este se encuentra ubicado justamente en un costado de su casa, ambos, su esposo y ella, prestan sus servicios allí.  
Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización a la que vino referida por una vecina y en la que está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual comprará estantes, vitrinas y tambien adicionará mercancías variadas. Su sueño es ampliar su farmacia,  porque sueña con que sus dos hijos de 12 y 14 años lleguen a realizar estudios superiores de buena calidad, mediante el ingreso que le proporcione su negocio en la medida en que este crezca.
texts.en:
Sixta Tulia F. lives in the San Roque neighborhood, where she has a drug store called “Farmacia Sixta.” She started three years ago so that she could increase her household income, because she works with her husband, who knows the pharmacy business very well and has 20 years experience. They sell medicine at retail and their store is located in an area of their home. Both she and her husband provide services there. This will be her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization to which she was referred by a neighbor, and through which she has requested a Kiva loan to buy shelves, display cases, and additional merchandise. Her dream is to expand her pharmacy because she wants her children, ages 12 and 14, to complete a good quality higher education, through the income that the business brings through this expansion.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shelves and display cases

loans.name: Bertha Del Jesús

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne en la ciudadela San Alejo de la bellísima ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida por las hermosas playas que recorren todas sus costas y que son muy visitadas por los turistas nacionales e internacionales.

La señora Bertha tiene 52 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado tres hijos ya todos son mayores de edad, uno de ellos vive con ella. Su esposo trabaja en la cooperativa de transporte Coactur.

Tiene un pequeño kiosco cerca de su casa  donde vende bebidas alcohólicas, gaseosas, bolos, hielo y otros productos de picar, aquí trabaja los fines de semana,  de lunes a viernes en el día vende zapatillas y sandalias, su sistema de venta es puerta a puerta, vende a conocidos de su sector y a amistades en Portoviejo, deja a acredito y cobra por semanas. Su mercadería se la traen de Guayaquil.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar la mitad en zapatillas y el resto para surtir su negocio de bebidas. Está en el Banco Comunal hace dos ciclos y espera estar por muchos ciclos mas.

Su sueño es terminar su casa que aun está en construcción.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) communal bank meets in the San Alejo neighborhood in the very beautiful city of Portoviejo, Manabí province capital, famous for the beautiful beaches that line its coasts popular with national and international tourists alike.

Bertha, 52, has been in a common law relationship that has produced three children all of whom are now adults.  One of them lives with her and her husband works for the Coactur transportation cooperative.

She has a small kiosk near her house where she sells alcoholic beverages, soft drinks, frozen treats, ice and other snacks.  She works here on weekends.  From Monday through Friday she sells slippers and sandals door-to-door to acquaintances in her areas and to friends in Portoviejo.  She leaves the items on credit and collects weekly.  Her merchandise is brought to her from Guayaquil.

She will use half of this loan to buy slippers and the rest to stock her beverage stand.  She has been in the communal bank for two cycles and hopes to remain for several cycles more.

Her dream is to finish her house which is still under construction.

loans.use: To buy slippers, alcoholic beverages, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Chamshed

texts.ru: Бозоров Чамшед проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 28 лет. Холост. Образование высшее, бухгалтер. По профессии проработал 3 года. Сейчас он работает на рынке. Продает пирожное и печенье. Этим видом занимается уже год. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара. Чамшед хочет расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Chamshed B. lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 28 years old, single.  He has a higher education, as an accountant.  Chamshed worked 3 years in his field.  Currently, he works at a market, selling pastries and cookies.  He has been involved in this business for one year.  He is requesting this loan in order to expand product selection.  Chamshed wants to expand his business.

loans.use: Expanding product selection

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel M. is 21 years old, a single man from Kakamega town. He is a businessman and sells household items and gadgets. He has been running his current business for the past four years and gets good profit.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD  after completing repaying the first loan successfully. He intends to use the money to buy household items for resale e.g., flashlights, mirrors, combs, etc. The profits made will be used to pay school fees for his siblings.

His desire is to open up a retail shop and stop hawking in the future.

loans.use: Buy household items e.g., combs, mirrors, flashlights

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and rent bills. He operates a clothes-selling business, selling leso (also known as khangas, or traditional African cloth) and shoes. He sells from home to neighbors and passersby. Julius faces a major challenge in delayed payments by creditors. He hopes that someday he will establish a boutique shop. With the 15,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase a bale of lesos and shoes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of Lesos (also known as khangas, or traditional African cloth) and shoes for resale

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es: María Santos L. D. C. D. 43 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento oriental D. San Miguel, junto a cuatro hijos. Ella es una madre D. familia muy responsable y trabajadora, quien se gana la vida comercializando ropa para hombres y mujeres, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa D. habitación, así mismo hace algunas visitas a las casas D. sus clientes para poder mostrarles su productos. María es madre soltera, y su mayor deseo es el D. poder darle una vida mejor a sus hijos, brindándoles estudios, alimento, ropa y demás. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir su inventario y comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa, sobretodo para este fin D. año en que sus ventas se aumentan en gran manera.
texts.en: María Santos L. D. C. is 43 years old and lives in the Eastern department of San Miguel with her four children.  She is a very responsible and hardworking mother who earns a living selling men’s and women’s clothing.  She runs her business from her house and also makes some visits to her customers’ houses to show them her products.  María is a single mother and her biggest wish is to be able to give her children a better life, providing them with education, food, clothing, etc.  She is requesting a loan with which she can stock her inventory and buy more clothing, especially for the end of the year when her sales increase significantly.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita S. is a married woman who lives at 109, Brgy. Dancalan, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: general store and buying & selling charcoal businesses.  Her husband Danilo, who is 32 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have six children who are between 2 to 11 years old. 

Amelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Amelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 7th loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000, with which she intends to buy stock for the general store so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Amelita S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 	

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Grace Kadioli

texts.en:
Grace Kadioli O. is 29 years and married to Andrew Saina. Together they have two young children. They live in Eldoret where Grace has had her business for 10 years, making a monthy income of nine thousand shillings.

This will be Grace's first loan from  KADET LTD and she will use it to buy more clothes. She plans to use the profits to expand her business and make it more stable financially. In future she hopes to open a bigger shop and raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Yin Y. is a mother caring for four children, all are attending the local school and are dependent on her income. She is married to Roeurn, who earns his daily income by climbing the palm trees behind his house (to collect sap).  He has been in this business since 2000.  Palm-tree-climbing as an occupation is very common in the countryside for poor men.  

Because the equipment Yin Y.'s husband uses for climbing palm trees is getting old – some are broken down, it is hard for him to operate his business. Yin Y. wants to help her husband's business, so she decided to request a loan for him to buy ladders to climb the palm trees. Yin Y. and her husband are both in the picture.

loans.use: To buy ladders to climb palm trees

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su hijo de 19 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de comida y a atender una pequeña tienda, Inicio este negocio cuando su hijo era muy pequeño, la misma necesidad de cubrir los gastos le dio la idea de dedicarse a este negocio, su dificultad es la falta de recursos económicos para realzar el negocio y ser más eficiente.
Actualmente ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercadería para la tienda, pretende surtirla de productos como frijol, arroz, azúcar, pollo entre otros que le ayudan para la tienda y a la vez para preparar comida, este préstamo le será de mucha ayuda para mantener el negocio más fuerte y dar abasto a las demandas de los clientes.
Su sueño es crear un negocio fuerte, auto sostenible que le provea las ganancias suficientes para mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su hijo, manteniendo siempre el deseo de superación y mejora continua.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her 19 year old son in San Francisco Gotera, Morazán department.  She sells food and tends to a small store.  She started the business when her son was very little.  The need to cover expenses gave her the idea to go into this business.  Her difficulty is the lack of economic resources to carry out the business and be more efficient.

She is currently asking for a loan to buy merchandise for the store.  She intends to stock it with such items like: beans, rice, sugar and chicken, among others, that will be of help for the store and at the same time allow her to prepare meals.

This loan will be very useful to maintain the business strong and self sufficient that will provide sufficient profits to improve her and her son’s quality of life maintaining always her desire for improvement and continued success.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store like: beans, rice, sugar and chicken.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita C. is from the village of Bantay, Solana, Cagayan. She is 33 years old. Merlita is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Merlita owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. Merlita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 42,000 PHP per harvest. In 2011, Merlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlita is requesting a loan of 36,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Merlita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
La señora Mirna alegría estrada, es casada con el señor Humberto Manuel López, vive en Julián Grajales municipio de Copainala  estado de Chiapas México, tiene a su responsabilidad cuatro hijas y son: Marisol de veinticinco años, Sandra de veinticuatro,  Karen de veinte y Ariandi de diesi ocho.

     El préstamo lo invierte en la  compra de materiales para la elaboración de block, en donde cometa que le va bien ya que ha tenidos buenos resultados, en esto lleva dos años y lo trabaja su esposo.

     Para iniciar esta actividad le comento a su esposo que para ayudarse tenían que tener una actividad la cual le diera un mejor ingresos así lograr sacar adelante a sus hijas que están estudiando y logren tener una carrera.

     Con las ganancias que va obteniendo lo invierte en la misma actividad,  para comprar más material para tener los block suficiente y su clientela le compre lo que desea.

     Lo que desea es que dios le ponga la bendición para seguir trabajando  y los prestamistas la sigan apoyando para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mirna Alegría Estrada is married to Humberto Manuel López.  She lives in Julián Graja, in Copainalá, in the State of Chiapas, Mexico.  Mirna has four daughters in her care: 25 year-old Marisol, 24 year-old Sandra, 20 year-old Karen and 18 year-old Ariandi.

Mirna will invest her loan in buying materials for making bricks.  She says that her business is doing well and she is obtaining good results.  She has been in her business for two years and works with her husband.

Mirna tells us that she started out in this business because she told her husband that in order to help themselves they had to have a business that would make them more money so that they could get their daughters ahead in life.  Their daughters are studying and they want them to complete their higher education.

Mirna re-invests the profits that she makes back into her business.  She buys more materials so that she has enough bricks and so that her customers can buy what they want.

What Mirna would like is for God to bless her so that she can continue working and for lenders to continue supporting her so that she can get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy materials for making bricks

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en: Scovia, age 31, is a vendor of cassava flour, a business venture she has operated for seven years. She and her husband have four children, and the family lives in a house that they own in Kasese, Uganda. Scovia's primary business hardships are bad debtors and thieves. Her vision for the future is to set up a food store and to ensure the education of her children. Scovia has requested this loan in order to buy cassava flour to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to offer for sale

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael M. is a married man. His wife stays at home to take care of the household chores while Raphael goes out to run their milk sales business. They have three children aged between thirty and twenty-five years old. He owns a milk sales business in which he sells milk to the local people. His business is located at the busy Kongowea market in Mombasa. Mombasa is the coastal region in Kenya known for tourist attractions.

Raphael has been in this business for fifteen years now and has managed to give employment to two people. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more milk to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. He hopes that in future, he will own his farm with cows from where he will be able to get milk. He also plans to buy a van for transporting milk. He describes himself as a very ambitious man.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
María tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene una hija de edad escolar.  Reside en una zona urbana marginal de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

María se dedica a la compra y venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, una actividad que viene ejerciendo desde hace más de 2 años en forma continua. Su modalidad de trabajo es a pedidos.  María tiene a la fecha clientela fija que la apoya por el trato amable que les da.  Con los ingresos que percibe de este negocio apoya a su pareja con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

María desea comprar más productos de belleza, aumentar su stock y venderlos, de esta manera incrementar sus niveles de venta y por ende aumentar sus ingresos.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 400 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María is 34, married and has a daughter in school. She lives in the city outskirts of Chiclaya, the capital of Lambayeque. 

María buys and sells beauty products from a catalogue, something that she has been doing continuously for the past 2 years. She orders products for customers by request. To date, María has established a solid customer base that supports her business because of the way she treats them. With the income that she earns from her business, she helps her husband with their family expenses. 

María wants to buy more beauty products, increase her inventory and sell them, thus increasing her income. For this reason she is requesting a loan in the amount of 400 soles (USD150).

loans.use: To increase inventory of beauty products

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en:
Ma. Linda M. is from the city of Pallua Sur, Tuguegarao City. She is 38 years old. Ma. Linda is married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, Ma. Linda owns and operates a general store, selling food and daily use products in the local community. Ma. Linda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ma. Linda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Ma. Linda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Ma. Linda is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items such as rice to expand her product offering. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Ma. Linda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as rice to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Phyllis Nyambura

texts.en:
Phyllis has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last six years. She is 39 years old, married to Paul W., and has four children. 

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by her friend and this will be her second loan. She paid for her previous loan of 25,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) well and in good time. She plans to use the new loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. 

In the future, Phyllis hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mercy Wanjiru

texts.en: Mercy is a 28-year-old single woman who has been selling new clothes for about two years, earning a monthly income of KES 12,000. This is her first loan from KADET, after being introduced by group members. She wants to use it to buy shoes to sell in her shop. Mercy hopes to grow her business into a big boutique and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 25 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Roselyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Roselyn has been raising livestock for nine years and earns additional income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en: Consuelo, a 59-year-old mother of three children, is married to a farmer. A rice-grower for 25 years in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato, she works hard to support her family.  Consuelo will use the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers, and in the future she hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, 44 year old, is a cake seller.  Her husband is a pig feeder and their income is $6 per day.  They have 4 children and all of them are studying in school. 

Every month, she has to spend $80 on food, $40 on school fees and $5 on electricity.  She would like to request a loan for $500 to buy more pigs to raise.  She hopes to make more income from her career by extending her farm to make it a bit bigger than now and to get more animals to raise, not just pigs, because she needs to support all of her four children to study until they finish university.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise

loans.name: Hiền's Group

texts.en:
Hien is 45 years old. She lives in Thon Đong village. She is married with two children. She is a farmer who not only grows rice and wheat but raises chickens and pigs as well. She is part of the loan at the Center for SEDA 2011. This is her first loan and she wishes to borrow 5,152,000 VND to expand her business and buy feed for her chickens and pigs. 

 She is the leader of the five–member group loan. The other borrowers in her group are as follows:
 
 Nhi is 22 years old. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VNĐ to purchase scrap. 

 Thương is 24 years old. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VNĐ to buy feed for her chickens. 

 Hien is 32 years old. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VNĐ to buy to prepare breakfast foods to sell such as porridge.
 
 Hương is 26 years old. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VNĐ to buy food for her chickens and pigs

loans.use: to purchase feed & other supplies

loans.name: Benkola H Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe BENKOLA H sont tous des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, Y.,   la deuxième  assise à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000F CFA environs par campagne
texts.en:
The four members of Benkola H Group are married women who, on average, are 29 years old and have two children. They live in polygamous families in Baou, one of the villages in the rural municipality of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with the institution.

Y., the second woman sitting at the right-hand side of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing and weeding. She has around 0.5 hectares of farmland to grow rice and groundnuts. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Baou, Koula, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. The group members expect to make an average profit of around 25,000 CFA francs per season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Cecilia Carolina

texts.es:
La Señora. Cecilia es socia del banco comunal Espoir Mi Bankito, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene una hermosa arquitectura que se mezcla entre lo colonia y lo moderno, su gente es amable y mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Cecilia tiene 28 años, vive en unión libre y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 2 hijos de 9 y 5 años de edad quienes estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico industrial, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Cecilia se dedica a la venta de mariscos, labora 4 días a la semana desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Los días que pasa en casa se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su hermano, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de toda clase de  mariscos y pescado para crecer en el negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a member of the “Espoir Mi Bankito” communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a cold climate city that has beautiful architecture blending the colonial with the modern.  Its residents are kind and maintain their culture and traditions.

Cecilia, 28, is in a common law relationship and has two children who are 9 and 5 years old and go to a little local school in the city.  Her husband is an industrial mechanic.  They do not own a house and live as renters.

Cecilia sells seafood.  She works four days a week from 5am until 7pm.  The days she stays home she spends caring for her children.

This is her first loan with the communal bank which she was invited to join by her brother.  She will use the money from her loan to buy all sorts of seafood and fish to grow in business.  Her dream is to own a house.
.

loans.use: to buy seafood and fish.

loans.name: Ngor

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune garçon qui habite dans un village , non loin d'une grande ville dans laquelle il est employé comme chauffeur de taxi.Ne parvenant pas à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille, il décide d'hadérer à l'UIMCEC pour accéder au crédit afin d'acquérir son propre véhicule.Il se lance également dans l'élevage pour accroitre son épargne et rassembler les fonds nécessaires à un crédit consistant.C'est dans ce cadre qu'il sollicite un pret de 250000F pour acheter un boeuf et de l'aliment bétail concentré à 50000F. Les revenus tirés de la vente de ce boeuf lui permettront de participer à l'alimentation de la famille d'une part mais serviront en grande partie à obtenir un pret pour l'achat d'un véhicule.
texts.en: This borrower is a young man who lives in a village near a large city where he is employed as a taxi driver. Unable to improve his family’s living conditions, he decided to join the micro-finance institution U-IMCEC to access credit in order to acquire his own vehicle. He has also started raising livestock to increase his savings and to gather the funds necessary for a substantial loan. In this regard, he is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to buy a head of cattle and 50,000 francs of feed concentrate. The revenues from the sale of this livestock will enable him to help feed his family but also help to obtain a loan for buying a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle and some concentrated feed at 50,000 francs

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos actualmente trabaja y paga sus estudios, es por eso que solicita el préstamo para pagar el curso de finalización de estudios, ya que sin un crédito no podría pagarlo de una sola vez. Sus sueños son poder culminar su carrera y poder ser en un futuro un agente aduanero. Su inspiración es su madre, ya que debido a todas las dificultades que tiene, logró sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente trabaja en este campo, lo que le está permitiendo reforzar los conocimientos adquiridos en la universidad y tener experiencia para sus futuros trabajos.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is currently working and paying for his studies. That is why he is asking for a loan, in order to pay for the completion of his education, since without a loan he could not pay it all at once.

His dream is to be able to finish up his studies, and in the future be a customs agent. His inspiration is his mother. Throughout all the problems she had, she managed to provide for the family. Right now he is working in this field, and he is using all he learned in his studies at the university while gaining experience for work in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his university course

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar conocimos a Carmen,  ella tiene 55 años de edad, está soltera y vive en la  casa de su hermano, el cual es casado y tiene  tres hijos que nuestra amiga los quiere como si fueran de ella.

Nuestra amiga tiene un negocio de compra y venta de mariscos, tiene un local en su casa en el cual ofrece a sus clientes  pescado, camarón, conchas, pulpo entre otras variedades de mariscos, trabaja los cuatro últimos días de la semana ya que en estos  días es cuando más turistas llegan hasta las playas locales. Ella lleva ya 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad, sus productos los compra directamente de los pescadores lo cual es un beneficio ya que consigue más barato y un producto recién salido del mar.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado, camarón, pulpo, conchas y otros mariscos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que les ha brindado el banco. 

Sus sueños son tener un gran frigorífico.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank Crucita meet in the Crucita parish of the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for its beautiful beaches that surround the pretty town and that are visited by many tourists, both domestic and international. It is known by the name "Crucita la Bella" (Crucita The Beautiful).
This is where we met Carmen. She is 55 years old, single, and lives in her brother's house. He is married and has 3 children who our friend loves as though they were her own.
Our friend has a business buying and selling seafood. She has a store in her house where she sells fish, shrimp, conches, octopus, and other types of seafood. She works on the last 4 days of the week because the most tourists come to the local beaches on those days. She has been doing this for 20 years. She buys her goods directly from the fishermen, which is beneficial because she gets fish fresh from the sea and at a good price.
This loan is for buying fish, shrimp, octopus, conches, and other seafood. She has been with the community bank from its start and likes it because of the benefits it has offered her. 
Her dream is to have a big fridge.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, conches, and other seafood.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Luis Alonso de 27 años, las ganas de salir adelante que tiene cada día son las necesarias para proporcionar el alimento diario. Luis es una persona muy trabajadora, el se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos, lo inicio porque él tiene su finca y le resulta beneficioso este tipo de actividad porque además conoce muy bien las ventajas de este medio de vida. Pues esta es una oportunidad de generar su propio ingreso para el mejor bienestar de su  familia. Este crédito es para la compra de cerdos.
texts.en: Luis Alonso is 27 years old. The desire he has to succeed every day is necessary to provide food every day. Luis is a very hardworking person. He works buying and selling pigs. He started this business because he has his own farm and it is benefits him to do this kind of work as he well knows the advantages of this way of life. This way of life is an opportunity to generate his own income for the well-being of his family. This loan is for the purchase of pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy clothes, cosmetics and toys

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 40 years old, a married woman with two children.  Both her children are in school.  For five years, she has been running a business of selling maize grain and beans in Kator, South Sudan.
Victoria requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans for sale.  She will use the extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase maize grain and beans for sale.

loans.name: Vecinas Alegres Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Vecinas Alegres, se forma gracias a una de las miembros que se puso en contacto con una de las asesoras de la fundación, ya que ella deseaba un bien para sus vecinas del barrio, de allí surgió el grupo que  actualmente está integrado por 11 mujeres. Las señoras son muy unidas, responsables y solidarias, se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en equipo, con mucho esfuerzo y esmero, en forma conjunta  dentro del programa Comité de Mujeres.
Una de las miembros es la señora Teodolina, ella tiene una despensa bien surtida, con la cual da a sus vecinos los productos de primera necesidad. Ella se considera una mujer muy trabajadora, luchadora y muy emprendedora. Nos comenta que se levanta a muy tempranas horas a empezar a ordenar su despensa, ya que desde temprano tiene clientes. Ella quiere seguir aumentando su negocio por lo que solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras, harina, huevos, hortalizas y otros, los que le servirán para abastecer su local
texts.en:
The 'Vecinas Alegres' (Happy Neighbors) Women's Committee was created by one of its members who contacted one of the foundation's loan officers as she wanted to create a group for her neighbors.  As a result, this group was formed.  The group currently has 11 female members.  The ladies are very united, responsible and supportive.  They are working very happily together as a team, with a lot of effort and care, within the Women's Committee program.

One of the members is Teodolina who has a well-stocked grocery store where she offers her neighbors basic household products.  She considers herself to be a very hard-working, tenacious, entrepreneurial woman.  She tells us that she gets up very early in the morning to organize her store as her customers start arriving very early.  She would like to continue increasing her business and is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, flour, eggs and other products which will allow her to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, flour, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Bidii Group

texts.en:
Stephen is the facilitator of the Bidii group. Stephen and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Stephen takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund's low prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Stephen had an excellent maize yield harvesting 15 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Stephen was only able to harvest two bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Stephen and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Stephen will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Bidii group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Naseem Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Naseem Bibi is 41 years old and lives with her five children, four of whom are getting an education from a local school while the fifth works. Naseem’s days are focused on taking care of her family and raising her children.  
Naseem's husband runs a store where he sells basic household products. He has been in this business for over ten years. All his neighbors and friends from his area are customers. He earns a decent income every month from his business.   
Naseem is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy oil, lentils, rice, spices, etc. This will increase her husband's stock and will help him to improve his customer service. Naseem is hopeful that the financial condition of her husband’s business will be improved a lot after the loan investment.
In the photo, the lady holding the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Naseem Bibi.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her husband's grocery store business.

loans.name: Aracelle

texts.en:
Aracelle is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Aracelle is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Aracelle runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps, and many other things. Aracelle has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Aracelle is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. In 2010, Aracelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en: Fouad is a 25-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and one sibling.  His father is the one supporting the family and they all depend on him.  Despite his young age, Fouad took responsibility on his own and decided to start his own business.  He opened his own metal shop where he repairs mechanical generators.  Today he’s requesting to borrow $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase metal supplies and tools for his work.  He notes that this will facilitate his business operations and help him work in a proper way.  In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and renovate his shop.

loans.use: to purchase metal supplies and tools for his work.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru:
Валентина замужем. Ее супруга зовут Юрий. У них двое детей. Валентина имеет собственный бизнес.
Валентина занимается фермерством на протяжении 20 лет.  Она выращивает ранние овощи. У Валентины две большие теплицы и хороший участок. Она надежная и трудолюбивая. В будущем она планирует  развивать свой бизнес. 

Валентина просит предоставить ей кредит на сумму 10000 гривен на закупку семян и угля. В этом году ее дочь поступила учиться в другой город, и Валентина ей помогает деньгами.
texts.en: Valentina is married, and her husband's name is Yuriy.  They have two children.  Valentina has her own business.  She has been involved in farming for 20 years and grows early vegetables.  Valentina has two large greenhouses and a good plot of land.  She is a reliable and hardworking person.  In the future, she plans to develop this business further.  Valentina is requesting a loan in the sum of 10,000 hryvnia to purchase seeds and coal.  Her daughter was accepted to study in another city this year, and Valentina helps her financially.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for sowing and coal for heating greenhouses

loans.name: Bou

texts.en:
Bou is a 33-year-old married man and a good father of one child. He is married to his wife, who runs another business alongside him. Bou works hard to support his family’s daily expenditures. At present, Bou works as a farmer, which is a skill he learned from his parents. From this work, he earns a low income each day. To assist his income, Bou sells fishes at the market. He earns around US $3 per day. 

Being an older brother, Bou is raising a brother who is dependent on his income. His brother wants to work as a driver for a company, but he doesn’t know how to drive a car. So his brother would like to learn how to drive a car, but he doesn’t have enough money to learn. So he has asked his elder brother, Bou, to apply for a loan through HKL, a partner of Kiva. Bou and his brother hope that kind lenders will lend to him.

loans.use: to learn how to drive a car.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Es una señora sonriente y emprendedora de 50 años de edad, casada con 4 cuatro hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo trabaja como conductor. Desde hace 10 estableció una pequeña pulpería en su vivienda de minifalda (concreto y madera), de esta manera cuenta con su propia de ingresos, contribuye con los gastos del hogar. Solicita financiamiento para aumentar el inventario de sus productos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar: granos básicos, chivería, jabón de lavar ropa, agua purificada, papel higiénico, toallas sanitarias, entre otros productos. Su sueño es establecer una panadería, para diversificar su negocio.

loans.use: para comprar: granos básicos, chivería, jabón de lavar ropa, agua purificada, papel higiénico, toallas sanitarias, entre otros productos

loans.name: Aparichita Priyadarsini

texts.en:
Aparichita Priyadarsini  is a 30 years old married lady who hails from the capital of Odisha,Bhubaneswar.She is a lady with high aspirations and strong determination.Due to her father's ill health she got married in the middle of her studies.But she always had interest to continue her studies and become a successful manager in a reputed company.After getting married she got the support from her husband and her in laws to further pursue her higher studies.

Therefore,Aparichita Priyadarsini is requesting for a loan amount of 1,00,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum to pay her Master in Business Administration correspondence course fees,which she is pursuing from Corus Technosoft Pvt Ltd. After successfully completing her course she will be able to hold a high level management position in a good company with a higher salary.

Aparichita Priyadarsini is eagerly awaiting for your kind help to get closer to her dreams.

loans.use: to pay her Master in Business Administration correspondence course fees

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Madam Doris O. is a trader of vegetables including onions, tomatoes, carrots, cabbages, spices. Her market is vibrant since she sells to a large group of people. She is therefore seeking a loan of $800.00 from Kiva to enable her expand her business. Madam Doris O. is very hard working and capable of paying back because she has been with KSF and benefited from TEACH lending product. She therefore has knowledge in simple record keeping and accounting.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Verónica

texts.en:
Verónica has been selling used clothing for seven years. At first her mother helped her, but she became ill and Verónica continued on her own with the business. The income from this job has been very necessary for her because her husband drives a public transport bus and the money he receives is not sufficient to provide for their seven children. The youngest are 3 and 8 years old and their oldest children help with selling the clothing. Now Verónica requires a loan of $200, which she will use to buy more clothing in order offer more variety to her clients. In this way she will increase her sales.

It has not been easy for Verónica and her family to overcome all the obstacles, but by being a strong family they have been able to conquer all adversity. They also need your help. Your generosity is a great support for them—have no doubts, they appreciate it.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Verónica tiene siete años comercializando ropa usada, inicialmente su mamá le ayudaba pero después se enfermó y verónica se quedó sola con el negocio, y para ella ha sido muy necesario el ingreso que recibe por este trabajo, porque su esposo es chofer de trasporte urbano y el dinero que recibe es insuficiente para poder sustentar a sus siete hijos, los más pequeños son de 3 y 8 años de edad y sus hijos más grandes le ayudan en la venta. Ahora Verónica requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de más mercancía para poder ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes y de esta manera incrementar sus ventas.

No ha sido fácil para Verónica y su familia poder vencer todos los obstáculos, pero con la unión de la familia ha podido superar todas las adversidades. También necesitan de tu ayuda, tu generosidad es de gran apoyo para ellos, no lo dudes más, ellos te lo agradecen

loans.use: To buy inventory of clothing

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is a veteran in the market vending trade. She has been in business for fourteen years and has gained a wealth of experience serving her customers. She currently sells a selection of women’s clothing. To differentiate herself from her competitors, Svetlana offers higher quality clothing. She tries to keep a good variety on-hand for customers to choose from. 

Svetlana is married and has two children; a son and a daughter. Her business has helped her family afford new appliances for their apartment and do some remodeling work. It also will help provide necessary funds for the children to attend college.

Svetlana has requested a loan for $1000 to purchase new inventory for her business. She is grateful for the financial help she has received from “Nadiya Ukraine” in the past. We are happy for this opportunity to assist Svetlana further as she works to provide for her family.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Yagut

texts.en: Yagut R., with the help of her family, owns and operates a small clothing stand in the town of Devechi, which is located on the northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Yagut has re-paid two other loans from Norwegian Microcredit in the past, which shows that she has a low risk of default. Yagut is looking for further credit so that she can expand her inventory.

loans.use: To expand her current inventory

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Mrs. Edna I. is a 53 year old divorced woman with (8) children, and she acquired the formal knowledge of this business from her mother. She resides at Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. The amount she has requested is $175 to improve her business which she started in 2002. She has been with LAPO for 2 years.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & food items for sale

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is a determined lady who started her up her shop to support her family. She is a 42-year-old married mother of 8 children. Her small shop is located right in front of her house.  It earns her 300-400 Tala ($120-160 US) a day, which she uses to support her family and pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Amenan

texts.en: K. Amenan is 40 years old, and has six children. Her husband is a farm worker in Gagnoa, 160 miles from Abidjan. She sells spices, eggplants, okra and various vegetables in Yopougon market, in the north of the Abidjan district. Amenan is the main revenue provider for her family. She provides pays the main household and education expenses as her husband only receives seasonal incomes. Amenan heard about AE&I two years ago from her sister and has got different micro loans that she has reimbursed in a very good manner. She is requesting a loan of $1,100 so she can purchase more produce and supply more customers.

loans.use: To purchase produce and increase sales

loans.name: Mugema D(I) Group

texts.en: Irene is a single mother with two children. She runs a small hotel. She wants to go for a postgraduate diploma with the extra business profits.

loans.use: To buy more hotel equipment to expand her business

loans.name: Suwartini

texts.en: Suwartini is 32 and married. To support her family, she bakes and sells cakes, earning $8.00 a day. She sells her cakes door-to-door and also in neighborhood shops. She will use this loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Ergash

texts.en:
Ergash is 44 years old and is married with four children. He is a farmer who works a plot of 0.60 hectare where he grows potatoes and watermelons. He also breeds cattle. Ergash has been running this business for ten years and during that time it has become very stable and profitable. The farm generates the main income of the family, allowing Ergash to improve their living conditions. 

Ergash plans to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuel and cattle for breeding.  Ergash is aclient of IMON with a positive credit history and he promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To support a farm and cattle business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria O. sells food in a local market in her community. She hails from Volk, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 36 years of age, married, and has 4 children. She has been in business since 2006. She needs a loan of $450 to buy more food to sell. She said this will help her to serve her customers better.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell

loans.name: Juan Martin

texts.es:
I've just purchased a piece of land in which I would like to build a room I can inhabit soon. As you can see I have nothing built yet. For this reason I am requesting a loan in the amount of $700.00 to start building my home.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Acabo de obtener un terreno en el cual me gustaría empezar a levantar un cuarto y poder habitarlo pronto, como pueden ver no tengo nada hecho aun, por ello solicito el crédito de $ 700.00 dlls. Para poder iniciar la construcción de mi vivienda.

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama W. sells fish and owns a canoe. She is married and has two children, but her husband's income as a fisherman is insufficient to adequately cover her family's living expenses.

However, demand for her goods is high, so she is seeking to capitalize on such demand by expanding her business and, in turn, to increase her profits. For that reason, she is requesting additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on the high demand for her goods by expanding her business.

loans.name: Fitu

texts.en:
Fitu M., 33, is married with 3 children. She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells her produce to friends, relatives, and the local community. Also, during the harvest season she supplies the public market with bananas and taro 3 days per week.

Fitu has had 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Fitu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will support her kids at school and her church contribution. Her husband also helps to operate the business.

loans.use: To purchase gromozone chemicals, sting chemicals, a weedkiller sprayer machine, shovels, a bushknife, claves, and wire for a fence.

loans.name: Magda Rebeca

texts.es:
Magda is 37 years old and lives with her husband and her 4 year old son. She works growing fruit and also buys a large quantity of plots of cultivated land with fruit planted and grown by the previous owner. She then sells the harvest from the plots she has purchased. Her husband looks for the plots and she works selecting the marketable fruit, packaging it into boxes and taking care of the order contracts. She works all day, every day. She appreciates most the work that she is able to do inside her store because it is light work. The complicated part of her work is boxing the products. Since they will be shipped to many cities, she has to package them very carefully so that they do not spoil en route, and to ensure that they do not get destroyed on the way but arrrive at the client site in good condition.

Her small son is her greatest motivation; she wants to be able to offer him better quality of life.

Magda will invest the loan in the purchase of a large quantity of fruit and boxes, as way to increase her orders. In the near future she hopes to open a store in the center of her city in order to handle even more orders.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Magda tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo de cuatro años. Se dedica al cultivo de fruta, las cuales también produce, compra gran cantidad de chacras ya cultivadas para solo vender los productos que se cosecharán, para ello, su esposo busca las chacras y Magda se dedica a la selección de las frutas, encajonarlas y realizar los contratos de pedidos. Esta actividad la realiza todos los días, durante todo el día.A Magda le agrada más el trabajo dentro de su bodega, porque es liviano, la parte complicada es encajonar los productos, puesto que estos serán trasladados a diversas ciudades y para que no se malogren tiene que encajonarlos debidamente para evitar que se estropeen y quedar bien con sus compradores.

Su pequeño hijo es el gran motivo de su trabajo, poder ofrecerle una vida de calidad es su deseo.

Magda invertirá el dinero en la compra de mayor cantidad de fruta y cajones, así incrementar sus pedidos. En un futuro cercano desea abrir una bodega en el centro de su cuidad para tener mayores pedidos.

loans.use: Buy large quantities of fruit and fruit boxes for her business.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
La señora Flor D. María, D. especialidad técnica en enfermería y jubilada en ESSALUD, es socia del Banco Comunal “Nuestra señora D. la Paz”. Vive en la Región y provincia D. San Martín, distrito D. Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta D.  juanes y comidas, además complementa el negocio con la venta D. aves D. corral y aves silvestres. El negocio lo realiza en su domicilio, ubicado en el Jr. Leoncio Prado c-6, sus clientes principales son los estudiantes D. la universidad y turistas que visitan la ciudad. Ya tiene bastante tiempo en esta actividad y le va muy bien. 

Con el préstamo D. S/. 3,000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará  sacos D. arroz, azúcar, aceite en galones, verduras y carne del diario, también comprará alimentos para los animales menores que cría en su domicilio y tenerlos aptos par al venta cuando sus clientes lo requieran.

Flor D. María, tiene 69 años y 5 hijos todos ya independientes, ahora vive con su esposo, quien la apoya en el negocio. Se siente muy orgullosa D. lo que ha logrado porque es fruto D. su esfuerzo y dedicación constante. Su meta es terminar D. arreglar su casa y acondicionar un ambiente para dar mayor comodidad  a sus clientes y así obtener mayor ganancia y nuevamente invertir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flor D. Maria, a technical nursing specialist and retiree from ESSALUD, is a member of the Nuestra Senora D. la Paz (Our Holy Mother of Peace) village bank. She lives in Tarapoto, San Martin, Peru. She works selling juanes (a typical rice dish from the selva) and other prepared foods; on the siD., she also sells wild and domesticated chickens. She works out of her home located on Leoncio Prado Street; her customers are generally university students and tourists that visit the city. She has worked in this business for years and it is going very well for her. With this $1,025 loan which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase bags of rice, sugar, vegetable oil, vegetables, and meat; she will also purchase feed for the chickens that she raises in her home so that they are ready for sale when her customers want them. Flor D. Maria is 69 years old and has 5 adult children. She lives with her husband who helps her in her business. She is very proud of what she has achieved because it is the fruit of her effort and constant dedication. Her goal is to finish her home and create a better environment to attend to her customers in order to earn a greater income, and re-invest in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, oil, vegetables, and feed for small animals

loans.name: Galuega

texts.en:
Galuega T., 31, is married with one child. She has three years of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the village people and public three days per week. 

She has four previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~$187 USD). SPBD loans are Galuega's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

Part of her loan will be used for home improvement

loans.use: Purchase a spade, knives, fertilizer, coco wire, more vegetable seeds in different kinds and cement for home renovation.

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr: Abdou S. habite au quartier ndayane de Diourbel pres du lycéée.Il fait de l'embouche ovine depuis 17 ans. il est marié et a des enfants a charge.
texts.en:
Abdou S. lives in the Ndayane neighborhood of Diourbel close to Lycéée (Technical College). He has been raising sheep for seventeen years. He is married and is bringing up children.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising sheep

loans.name: Felipa Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora de nombre Felipa Esperanza Juárez quien tiene la edad de 62 años, su estado civil es acompañada, tiene dos hijos, el mayor de 35 años graduado en licenciado en ciencias y alimentos, el menor de 28 años que se desempeña como ingeniero civil y su cónyuge labora como conductor de un taxi, sus propósitos son de acondicionar su establecimiento, sus deseos son de mantener su negocio activo debido a la situación inestable por la que esta pasando el país actualmente.


El tiempo al que ha dedicado a su negocio es de 13 años, la actividad económica a la que ella se dedica es la venta de granos básicos como: arroz, azúcar, aceite y frijoles, ella inicia este negocio por cuenta por lo que inicia con la venta de galletas y golosinas y mas tarde decide realizar un financiamiento con la fundación León 2000 la cual le brinda la mano para que incrementara su negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y abastecer la demanda de clientes que a diario va creciendo, desea comprar productos como pan, huevo, azúcar y jugo ya que estos productos que mas vende a diarioa.
texts.en:
This is Felipa Esperanza Juárez. She is 62 años and lives with her partner. She has two children; the oldest is 35 and has a degree in food sciences; the youngest is 28 and works as a civil engineer. Her common-law husband works as a taxi driver. Her goal is to make improvements to her business and her wish is to keep the business going through the current uncertain economy in the country. She has been in business for 13 years selling basic goods such as rice, sugar, oil and beans. She started off just selling cookies and candy and later on got a loan from Fundación León 2000 which gave her a helping hand to increase her business. This loan is for working capital to meet the demand of customers, which grows daily. She would like to buy goods such as bread, eggs, sugar and juice since these are what sell the most.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Phann

texts.en:
Phann V., age 56, is a grocery seller who sells items such as ingredients for cooking at the local Prasat market. She currently lives in Kompong Tom Province. She is married with nine children, five of whom are single and four of whom are married. Two of her daughters are employed; one is a garment worker, and one helps with her mother's business.

Phann V.'s husband, Meung Peal, 53, is a palm climber. He has been doing his job for a long time, climbing palm trees to get palm juice and boiling it into palm sugar to sell, earning approximately US$ 4 each day. V. has requested a loan to buy more varied groceries for re-sale. She plans to use the rest for her daughter to decorate her house. (V.'s husband is pictured because she was not available.)

loans.use: To buy more varied sorts of groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 21-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. Ahmad has been working as a car mechanic for a year. He takes care of electrical systems and car batteries. Ahmad requests a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his garage. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.
His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. Ahmad’s garage is well positioned.  He decided to start his business because he has experience. In the future, he plans to expand his business and improve his working tools.

loans.use: Ahmad will use the loan to purchase tools for his garage.

loans.name: Ternura Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Ternura  inicia su tercer ciclo con  15 socias, las socias menciona que les gusta las capacitaciones que reciben con respecto a la familia y como administrar su negocio.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, papa, carnes, medicina natural, pan, ropa, cereales, también realiza tejidos en telar y tejido chompas.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles,  haciendo un total D. 8,450 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, papa, aceite, lanas, tintes, trigo, cebada, chompas, polos, pantalones

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios, construir su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Community Bank Ternura started their new cycle with 15 members, the members mentioned are liked for the family training that they received and for managing their business.

The members run different businesses that sell general groceries, such as potatoes, meat, natural medicine, bread, clothes and grain. They also make textiles in a loom and sweaters.

The members need different loan amounts: 300, 450 and 600 soles (Peruvian monetary unit), making a total of 8,450 soles of loans form the community bank.

Their loans will be used to buy rice, sugar, potatoes, oil, wool, dyes, wheat, barley, sweaters, polo shirts and pants.

Their dreams are to improve their businesses, build their homes and for their children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, azúcar, papa, aceite, lanas, tintes, trigo, cebada, chompas, polos, pantalones
