loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru:
Ахмадов Абдусалом мужчина 53 лет имеет одного сына , жжена пенсионерка. Абдусалом 
Полностью занимается уходом ,откормом и продажей скота. Он ветеринар и мастер по купле и продаже скота. Абдусалом каждую неделю выходит на рынок скота, и помогает своим друзьям купить породистый скот. Сейчас у  Абдусалома  30 баранов ,которые пасутся на пастбище вблизи гор. Соседи посоветовали попробовать закупить в кредит ещё десяток голов баранов, для чего и обратился Абдусалом  в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Abdusalom A. is 53 year old and is married with one son. His wife is retired. Abdusalom makes a living by tending to cattle, raising and selling it. He is a vet and a master of cattle trade. Every week he goes to the market to help his friends buy cattle of good breed. As of now Abdusalom owns 30 sheep which graze on mountain pastures. Abdusalom's neighbors advised him to get a loan and buy another ten sheep. For this reason Abdusalom came to Microinvest.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Aquina

texts.es:
AQUINA M. D. A., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Atenas Portillanas” con domicilio en el Jr. Miguel Grau N° 150 del AA.HH. Nuevo Paraíso del distrito D. Callería, tiene 60 años, 03 hijos, y su esposo tiene trabajo en hojalatería.

La primera vez obtuvo un préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, hace 3 años, con él, empezó a vender comida en pequeña cantidad, luego fue aumentando platos, hasta que hoy tiene ya una cantidad considerable D. comensales,  ye que sus clientes están aumentando día a día.

Con el préstamo es D. S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. vajilla, la que tiene ya no le alcanza, una congeladora D. segunda, que aun está en buenas condiciones, y también se va surtir D. insumos para sus menús diarios, si le sobra un poco D. dinero, también tiene planeado comprar unas mesas con sus respectivas sillas.

Está contenta con Manuela Ramos por la comprensión y ayuda que les otorga, por ello se encuentra con los ánimos para seguir siendo puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
AQUINA M. D. A. belongs to the “Atenas Portillanas” Communal Bank, she lives at Jr. Miguel Grau N° 150 del AA.HH. Nuevo Paraíso, Callería district. She is 60 years old, has 3 children and her husband works in a sheet metal shop. She received her first loan for S.300.00 Nuevos Soles three years ago, and she began to sell small quantities of food. She then expanded her dishes, until today, where now she has quite a variety of meals and her customers are growing daily. Today she seeks a loan for S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles to buy place settings, as she doesn’t have enough, a used freezer that is still in good condition, and she is also going to stock her ingredients for the meals she prepares daily. If she has any leftover money she also plans to buy some tables and chairs. She is content with Manuela Ramos for its understanding and help it has provided, and through it she finds the inspiration to continue being punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy place settings, a used freezer, ingredients to prepare food, table and chairs

loans.name: Abduvahob

texts.en:
K. Abduvahob is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He owns a minibus which generates the income necessary to support his family.

Abduvahob needs this loan to buy spare parts to keep the vehicle in good working condition, as this is how he makes his living. This will allow him to perform his work better, so as to save more money in order to provide for his family.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan’s independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts in order to repair his minibus

loans.name: Casiana

texts.en: Casiana D. is fifty-seven years old and a hard-working mother with two children. She lives at Looc Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Casiana started her business by putting up a very small amount of capital, with neighbors as her potential customers. Casiana is looking forward to expanding her snack-vending business which will enable her to produce greater profits. She needs $425 in additional capital in order to buy all the ingredients needed to make and market her goods. Casiana believes that through her business, she will be able to raise her children well and to ensure their education.

loans.use: To buy needed ingredients.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
"I am working very hard to provide all the needs of my family. I am a family man and I do have big dreams especially for my three children", says Mr. Ruben B., a farmer from Agusan Del Sur in Mindanao. 

He needs a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy herbicide and insecticide. These are very important to ensure a quality harvest from his farm. 

CEVI is helping small business grow. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicide and insecticide

loans.name: Ankabenkélenkan 2. 8 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Ankabenkélenkan 2. 8 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Fonfona de la ville de Koutiala  région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Elles cultivent principalement  du riz et de l’arachide comme activité  secondaire.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  Ankabenkélenkan 2.8 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre premiers   prêts, elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence de riz d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au marché de Fonfona, M’pessoba et Zansoni. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au marché de M’pessoba et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail et en gros, au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Ankabenkélenkan 2.8 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 80 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Ankabenkélenkan 2.8 is a group of married women of the village of Fonfona in Koutiala City, Sikasso region (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in large traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. They have an average age of 34 and at least 5 children. They grow mainly rice, and they grown peanuts as a secondary business. Concerned about making their farms profitable, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program five years ago. After having correctly repaid the first four loans, they are now on their fifth farm loan. The current loan will be used to buy a sufficient quantity of seeds for planting rice and peanuts; some minor supplies and equipment; and fertilizers and such, for farming. Supplies are gotten at the marketplaces of Fonfona, M’pessoba, and Zansoni. Following the off-season, the crops are stored for a certain time, so that they gain in value. Then the crops are sold retail and wholesale in cash transactions at the M’pessoba market and at surrounding markets. Their customers come generally from large cities. After selling their produce, the group members each intend to realize a profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to cover common family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and minor supplies and equipment

loans.name: Tamtaneh Group

texts.en:
Here are Amed K., Bakarr K. and Mabinty Koroma of the Tamtaneh group. They are local entrepreneurs in Makeni City, in northern Sierra Leone. This will be the fourth loan these entrepreneurs are receiving from SMT/Kiva. With previous loans, they were able to expand their businesses, make a better profit and improve on their standard of living. Having repaid the previous loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of Le 900,000 for each to further strengthen their businesses.

Amed K. is the leader of the Tamtaneh group. Amed, age 36, was born in Kambia town in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and they have four children. One of his children is in secondary school and the others are in primary school. Amed sells jewelry including locally made chains. He has been this business for seven years now.

loans.use: Improve the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 20 additional sheep for breeding

loans.name: Jane Jemaiyo

texts.en:
Jane K. is 37 years old and is married to a man named Philip.  They are blessed with three children.  Her business is located in the Iten suburb of Eldoret Town.

Jane has been in the clothing business for the past four years.  With this loan from KADET she intends to buy more clothing, a new sewing machine and other equipment for work.  Jane was introduced to KADET by a credit officer from the organization.

In future, Jane hopes to grow her business so that she and her husband will have enough income to be able to pay school fees for their children.  She also wants to be able to build a durable, permanent house for her family to live in.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more stock for a clothing shop and to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Grishon N.

texts.en:
Grishon K. is 46-years-old and married with two children. He stays in Zambezi near Kikuyu town where he has been operating a bread supplies shop for the last four years. He normally does his supplies to small traders in the shopping center. 

He got to know about KADET through a marketing done by the KADET staff and he had never taken a previous loan with any other institution. This will be his third loan with after accessing and fully repaying the previous loans well and on time. Grishon hopes to grow his business and eventually own a big store to supply bread.

In future he plans to open a bakery so that he can do both the baking and distribution of bread.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Adding more stock of bread so that he can supply to more traders.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Mrs. Lay N. is a villager in Doem Pour village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she faces a problem because she does not have enough money to hire labor with two oxen to plow the field and to buy fertilizer to support the field to make the crop more productive.

She is a widow with three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To hire two oxen to plow the field and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Etoile De Dieu : Group 2

texts.en:
The “Etoile de Dieu” or “Star of God” group 2 has five male and female business owners. After faithfully repaying both 1st and 2nd loans, the group is looking forward to continued growth on the third loan. The group has a variety of businesses from a multi service copy center to cosmetics, from sneakers to various seafood. Gulma G. is one of four representatives of the group. He is a 32yr single man.
Gulma has a multi service call, copy, and print center.  He has several computers where people can type and print documents as well as a copy machine.  He is thankful for the first two loans because he was able to buy a better printer. He plans on expanding to include more phone lines and internet services. He hopes to continue the expansion of his business to allow his community to be able to handle all their computer needs in the community and mainly at his business. On behalf of Gulma, Etoile de Dieu, and Esperanza we thank you for your support.

loans.use: telephones, printer/scanner/ copy machine

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 49 years old and married to Anastacio. They have eight children, four of them are already married. 

Wilma is selling cosmetics products within their village. She sells them house to house basis to earn a living.  Due to the demands of her customers, she is encouraged to seek of financial support from the KIVA lenders.  She hopes that she could avail a loan amounting PHP5,000 that she can use as additional capital that she can use to purchase more products that are needed by her customers.  Through her business, she was able to help her husband in meeting the needs of their family.  She is looking forward for the improvement of her business

loans.use: Additional capital for her vending activity

location.town: Rizal West, San Isidro, Santiago City

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia S., a resident of the village of Poblacion, Valencia City, is 43 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Hermenia owns and operates a specialized retail store whose main source of income comes from selling vegetables in their village. She is just starting this business.

In 2009, Hermenia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Requesting a loan, her first, of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es: La señora tiene una caseta en el Mercado Villa Sebastian Pagador, venD. variedad D. lanas y chinelas (zapatillas para el calor) desD. hace 10 años, el puesto D. venta es D. su propiedad, sus clientes son generalmente D. la zona, ella es muy trabajadora y la gente que la conoce le tienen mucha estima. Su esposo es albañil, viven en anticrético, tiene un hijo que depenD. directamente D. ellos, sus otros dos hijos ya son mayores y tienen sus propias familias.
texts.en:
Eleuteria has a booth in the Villa Sebastian Pagador Market. She sells a variety of wool and slippers (to keep your feet warm). For 10 years, she has been operating her trading post. Her customers are mostly from the area. She is a very hard worker and the people she knows hold her in high regard. Her husband works as a bricklayer. The couple lives in a rental property and has three children. One child is still a dependent, while the other two are adults and have their own families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool & slippers

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old and married with five children. All her children are currently in school. She supports her husband in taking care of the children through the sale of bush meats (any wild animal species). She has in stock deer, grass cutters (cane rats) and the likes. She takes delivery of meat from the surrounding villages and supplies to local restaurant operators. She wants the loan to buy a stock of meat in bulk.
 
She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Unity’. She is the one sitting second from the left in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bush meats in bulk for a supply to sell.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda A. is a 56-year-old general store owner from Iba, Silang, Cavite.  Her husband Merlito, 52, is a fisherman.  They have four children; one is in high school and three are in grade school.
 
Linda owns a general store which has been around for five years.  Through the years, her general store has grown steadily.  She now earns a net income of close to $110 a month.   She uses her profits to support her children’s education and to pay for their daily needs.   

She is now on her third loan cycle with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative.  She has recently applied for a new loan amounting to 9,000 PHP.  She will use the fund to purchase more items to sell at her general store.  Linda dreams of enlarging her general store into a big grocery store someday.  



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Idalia Maria

texts.es:
La señora  Idalia Maria tiene 38 años de edad, madre soltera de dos hijos
Uno esta casado y la de 17 años es la que le ayuda administrar el negocio, una pulpería, y una pequeña tienda de ropa, que ha mucho esfuerzo ha logrado tener, con dinero propio de ahorro de su trabajo ya que trabaja como cajera para poder mantener el equilibrio en su negocio ya que muchas veces están bajas las ventas, por gracias a Dios ha logrado invertir en muchos productos de necesidad del cliente, da al crédito pero los clientes los selecciona ya que mucha gente no paga y tiene que saber a quien le da crédito. Con este préstamo lo quiere para comprar granos básicos, leche de pote, productos de limpieza, ropa variada para dama y niños, a si como comprar cosméticos para atraer nuevos clientes y poder tener una variedad, para sus clientes. Todo esto lo  ha logrado con apoyo de la institución gracias a sus financiamientos y su trabajo ha logrado salir a delante con su familia y su negocio.
texts.en:
Idalia Maria is 38 years old and a single mother of 2 children. Her son is married and her 17-year old daughter administers the business, a local store and small clothing shop. It took Idalia a lot of work to set up the store, using her savings from her work. She works as a cashier to maintain her business when sales are low. By the grace of God she has been able to invest in many products her customers need. She offers store credit, but only to select customers because many people don't pay and she has to approve who she gives credit to. With this loan she wants to buy staple grains, canned milk, cleaning products, and various clothing for women and children, as well as cosmetics to attract new customers and to offer a variety of products to shoppers. She has achieved all this with the support of the institution, AFODENIC. Thanks to this financing and her work, Idalia has been able to advance her business and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, beans, sugar, oil, canned milk, cleaning products, and clothing for women and children.

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en: Kofi (which means "Friday born") is 56 years old, married and the father of six children. All of his children are in school, and he makes a living by running a grocery store where he sells items such as sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits. He buys his supplies in Accra and sometimes from the nearby town of Cape Coast. It has been his dream to expand his business by adding new items to his inventory, and he is applying for this loan to buy drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits and other items such as tomatoes, smoked fish, dried fish, onions, spices and groundnuts. His goal is to increase his income to support his children in school, and he is very grateful for the assistance he receives from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water and biscuits and other items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia B. is 44 years old and has five children. She said that her income from her refrigeration business has helped her a lot in managing their finances. 

She wishes to apply for a loan at Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to pay for needs in her shop and pay the laborers as well. She hopes she could have a good return on investment. 

What she likes about the CEVI program is that it has helped not just her, but other women in the community as well.

loans.use: To pay laborers in her refrigeration shop

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La Sra. Sonia vive en la localidad de la guardia, zona campo verdea 13 km. de la ciudad de santa cruz, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar su esposo trabaja como chofer profesional, su actividad es la venta de abarrote en su propio domicilio, la cual le ayuda en los ingresos a su esposo, ya que tienen muchos gastos con sus hijos en la escuela, por tal motivo tienen que trabajar los dos. El destino del crédito es para surtir su tienda comprar abarrotes, refrescos, dulces, etc. La Sra Sonia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que tiene deseos de superacion quiere mejorar su calidad de vida de toda su familia uno de sus sueños es ver a sus hijos profecionales y comprarse un autito para poder tranportar sus abarrotes del mercado a su tienda.

Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sonia lives in La Guardia, a green zone 13 km from the city of Santa Cruz. She is married and has two, school-age children. Her husband is a professional driver. She sells groceries in her home. This is added to her husband's earnings because they have many expenses with their children in school, so both parents must work. The funds will be used to stock the store with groceries, soft-drinks, candy, etc. Sonia is a responsible, hard-working woman who wishes to get ahead and improve the quality of life for her entire family. One of her dreams is to see her children become professionals and to buy herself a little car so that she can transport her groceries from the market to her store. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita T. is from the village of  Kadingilan, Bukidnon. She is a 50 year-old widow with one school-aged child. Charlita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She's been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Charlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI, which she used to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new and second loan of 8000 PHP to use for the same purpose. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gasoline in jerry cans to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna B. is from the village of Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, married, and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Myrna has a retail business, primarily selling household items. She generates a monthly net income of 2,500 PHP from this business.
In 2005, Myrna joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to credit services in order to expand her business. She is now on her third loan and has repaid her previous loans on time. With the proceeds from her business, she has been able to support her family's needs.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Marog

texts.en: Marog E. is from the village of Silucap, Liloy, Zamboanga Del Norte. He is 32 years old, is married, and has three infant children. Marog owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling rice products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Marog joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marog is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his 2nd from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Coumba M. est une femme de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TAMBACOUMBA depuis 08 ans et occupe le poste de trésorière. Elle a 16 fois de suite bénéficié de crédits qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté. Elle développe un petit commerce de jus de citron, d'huile de palme et d'huîtres. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et de prendre partiellement les frais scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Coumba M. is a 42-year old woman who is married and mother to five children, all of whom attend school. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in TAMBACOUMBA for eight years and is its treasurer. She has had 16 consecutive loans which she has always repaid without difficulty. She is developing a small business selling lemon juice, palm oil and oysters. Her aim is to contribute to the improvement in her family's living conditions and to cover part of her children's schooling expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote her small business

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en: Mrs. Sarom S. is 38 years old and is a villager who lives in Vihear village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow crops for a living. For this farm, Mrs. Sarom S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. Her husband, Mr. Thoa Chea, is employed in a garment factory where he can receive a little salary to support his family's living. This couple has five children; two are laborers and three are students who also support their mother with farming. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Carlos Bionis

texts.es:
Para Carlos F.  la fabricación de escritorios, mesas para  reuniones juegos de sala, y todo lo relacionado con la madera, es la manera en que genera  ingresos para sostener a su familia, conformada por su cónyuge   y sus 3 hijos  en las edades de 10, 11 y 13 años.  Desde el año 2007  vincularse al programa de crédito de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  le han representado incrementar su capital de trabajo, porque a través de él ha recibido tres créditos y con este último  por valor de $ 2.000.000 COP,   comprará al por mayor y de contado, madera pegante, pintura, clavos y lacas para su negocio. Cuando Carlos inició en el año 2002, le significaron muchos esfuerzos adaptarse a ser independiente, porque antes era empleado de oficios varios en el sector de la construcción, pero ahora ese es su diario vivir con autonomia y  se ha fijado su propio horario de trabajo  de 7: 30 A.M.  a 12:00 M  y de 2:00  a 6:00  P.M. y desde los lunes hasta los  sábados, y como sus clientes conocen su cultura de trabajo y tiene muy  poca competencia en el sector,  registra en su mercado un importante número de ellos.
Carlos tiene un sueño y es el de venderle a cadenas de almacenes y usar la tecnología para hacer mercadeo electrónico, pero tambien tien  un gran desafío personal y es el de ver convertidos a sus hijos en profesionales trabajando en  empresas multinacionales. Ellos ahora Viven cerca de supermercados y al escenario de futbol mas importante de Barranquilla : “El estadio Metropolitano” donde se divierten en familia.
texts.en:
Carlos F. has a wife and three children (ages 10, 11, and 13). He generates income to support his family by making desks, tables for parlor games, and everything else made of wood. Since 2007, Carlos has participated in the credit program with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and it has helped to increase his working capital. He has received three loans, with the current one valued at 2,000,000 COP to be used for buying supplies in bulk such as wood, glue, paint, nails, and varnish for his business. When Carlos started his business in 2002, he had worked very hard to become independent. He previously held different jobs in the construction sector, but he now makes his daily living with autonomy and works a fixed schedule from 7:30am to 12pm and from 2pm to 6pm, Monday through Saturday. Carlos has a significant number of customers because they are familiar with his work ethic and there is very little competition in this sector.

Carlos dreams of selling his products through chain stores and utilizing technology for online marketing. His greatest personal challenge is seeing his children become professionals who work for multinational companies. He and his family live near the supermarkets and the largest soccer field in Barranquilla, the Metropolitan Stadium, where they go to have fun.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood, glue, paint, nails, and varnish

loans.name: Noor Jahan's Group

texts.en:
Noor Jahan lives in Multan with her family. They own a small house of two rooms and have been living in it for the past ten years. She is involved in the boutique business, selling embroidered and stitched dresses. Her variety of clothes attracts customers to her boutique. She has been doing this work for over six years. Her client base is purely women. She prepares women's wear such as embroidered shalwar kamiz and stitched kurtas. These two garments are famous in Pakistan because women love to wear these dresses, not just for special occasions but also as everyday wear.

She sells her goods within her neighborhood and also to the clothing shops, delivering the finished products to the designated places. She also sells bangles to earn extra income, but that is not her primary business.

Noor Jahan has applied for a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). With the loan amount she will buy materials like clothes, threads, and beads in bulk. She will also hire a worker to help her fulfill the larger orders in time.

She is hopeful that she will be able to bring positive financial changes to her family.

loans.use: To purchase required materials for a boutique business.

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.es: Kimberly, de 18 años, es una joven madre de familia muy emprendedora, tienen un hijo de 4 meses y vive en casa de su abuela. La  actividad a la que se dedica, es la venta de cuadernos, laminas, cartulinas y demás accesorios de librería. Desde su niñez apoyó en forjar el negocio de su abuela, en gratitud a ello, le propuso hacerla su socia, desde entonces invierte su capital en este negocio. Anhela   convertirla en un puesto  muy proveída de juguetes, lanas y loza en general.  El puesto de la abuela, se ubica  a 5 cuadras de su casa, siendo sus clientes, los alumnos de la escuela aledaña al mercado de su distrito. Hace dos años que trabaja en esta actividad y se siente muy feliz con el trabajo que realiza. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y sabe que esté aporte le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por lo que se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente. Con éste crédito que solicita, desea comprar lencería, para abastecer su establecimiento, además cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Kimberly is 18 years old, she is a young and very hard-working mother: she has a 4 months old son and lives in her grandmother’s house. She sells notebooks, plates, cards and other bookshop items. She helped her grandmother building up this activity since she was a child; in exchange, and to thank her, her grandmother has offered her to be her business partner, and since then she has been investing her money in this activity. She wishes to transform it into a well-furnished shop selling toys, clamps and pottery in general. Her grandmother’s stand is 5 blocks from her house, and her customers are students of the school located close to the her district’s market. She has been working in this field for 2 years and she is very happy with the job she is doing. This is her first loan with MFP, and she knows she will greatly benefit from this service as it will help her increase her working capital. This is why she committs to correctly repaying all her dues. The loans she is requesting will be used to buy linen to furnish her shop and also to fulfill her customers’ requests.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy linen to fulfill her customer's request.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more things to sell.

loans.name: Better Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Better” group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, also a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions.

Abibatu S. is the leader of this group. The 34-year-old is married to a businessman and they have five children – three in primary school and two in secondary school.

Abibatu has been a businesswoman for five years now; she sells palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), rice, beans, groundnuts (peanuts), etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy more of these items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy more palm-oil, rice, beans, groundnuts, etc.

loans.name: Unurbat

texts.en:
Mr. Unurbat is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children, ages 9 and 12. Until 2000, he ran a farming business growing livestock in the Dundgovi province of Mongolia. Winter 2000 was one of the coldest in past decade. During that winter, Mr. Unurbat lost most of his livestock and had to move to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city. Then he bought a second-hand minivan and started running a transportation business quite successfully. 

His wife Altantsetseg works with him as a cashier. Every three years, they have to renew the van because of the transportation authority's safety requirements. 

In 2009, they built a 56-square-meter wooden house using their savings. The reason they are asking for this loan is to buy some insulation materials to make the house warmer during the winter. They also want to make a separate room for their kids.

loans.use: To buy some insulation materials to make the house warmer during the winter

loans.name: Nancy Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer comerciante que ha venido creciendo gracias a su tenacidad de empeño en su negocio un comedor de venta de comida desde once años. El cual inicio con pocos ahorros.
Atreves de los prestamos en Afodenic ha venido dando mantenimiento a su negocio, como las mejoras de vivienda, pues lleva cinco ciclos trabajando el cual está contenta porque ha logrado el objetivo.
Con el crédito anterior era  para la construcción de un baño e inodoro el cual logro mejorar las paredes pero no concluyo por falta de materiales y que lograra terminar con este financiamiento. 
En donde cerrará completamente, y la compra de una puerta.
Su objetivo es seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, aunque las ventas estén bajas en días y eso implica perdidas. El cual tiene que equilibrarse para lograr mantenerse estable y así poder salir adelante para lograr sus pagos y necesidades personales.
texts.en:
Nancy is a saleswoman who, over the past 11 years, has achieved success thanks to her tenacity and work-ethic in her business selling food. She began her business with the small amount she had saved. Through loans from Afodenic she has been able to improve her business and also her home. She has already completed 5 loan cycles and is happy because she is meeting her goals.

Her last loan was to build a bathroom with a toilet, and with the money she was able to improve the walls but she could not finish because she lacked supplies. This loan is to finish the job by completely enclosing the bathroom and buying a door. Her goal is to keep investing in her business even though sales have been down lately and she is not earning as much money. She knows she needs to find balance in her business to be able to get ahead and make her payments and also have money for personal needs.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials to finish the bathroom

loans.name: Maricela Del Rocio

texts.es:
Maricela de 35 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona caracterizada por la cantidad de habitantes comerciantes llamada Guasmo.

Comenzó con su tienda de vivieres para ayudar con los gastos familiares también debido a la demanda de los víveres ella comenzó a comprar enlatados, arroz y aceite poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo surtirla y darle una mejor economía a sus tres hijos. Ahora trabaja con ayuda de sus hijos mayores desde las 06h30am todos los días. 

Para surtir mejor su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, enlatados etc. En el futuro quiere surtir mejor su tienda y poder así ampliarla.
texts.en:
Maricela, 35, has a grocery store in the front part of her house. She lives in an area called Guasmo that is notable for the large number of informal merchants that reside there. She opened her store to help meet family expenses. In response to demand she started to buy canned goods, rice and cooking oil. Gradually, with much effort, she was able to stock more items and provide a better economy for her three children. Now her two older children help her from 6:30am on every day. To better stock her store she wants to use the loan to buy rice, canned goods, etc. In the future she’d like to stock the store still more in order to enlarge it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For rice, beverages, canned goods.

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky C. is 38 years old, married and has four school-aged children. He is from the village of Mibantang in the municipality of Quezon, Bukidnon province on the Mindanao islands. Ricky runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which he sells both food and daily use products to the local community. While his wife manages the store, he also works on a sugarcane farm. Ricky has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Ricky joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Ricky is requesting a loan, his first, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Philip Kibet

texts.en:
Philip C. is 35 years old and married to Christine Chelangat. They have two children: Brian (four years old) and Janeth (two years old). 

Philip is a tailor in Serem town and has been in this business for the past six years. He is applying for his fourth loan from KADET LTD. He has a good credit history with us through the years. He is in need of fabrics to have on hand. His tailoring shop is in a rural village market and he specializes in school uniforms and women's dresses. 

He hopes to expand his tailoring business and establish a tailoring training center.

loans.use: To purchase fabric

loans.name: Bricsio

texts.en:
Bricsio R. is from the village of Barangay 22, in Gingoog City. He is 59 years old, married, and has 3 grown children. To make a living, Bricsio owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling coconuts and bananas in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Bricsio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bananas and coconuts to buy and sell. This will be Bricsio’s 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas and coconuts to buy and sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet N. lives in the  Kawempe Bubajwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 3 children, all of whom are in school.  Janethas a business of charcoal selling.  She has been in this business for 3 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Janet sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Janet has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.    .

The main business challenges for Janet include transport and the rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van.  Janetlives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family , rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia F.'s main source of income comes from fattening pigs for sale. She is 48 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Esperanza West. Leticia has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) when she sells one of her animals. In 2010, Leticia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Leticia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. Leticia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her second loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Nizarina

texts.en:
Nizarina T. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 27 years old. Nizarina is single and has one infant child. To make a living, Nizarina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Nizarina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nizarina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nizarina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Nizarina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages & biscuits. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nizarina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as beverages & biscuits

loans.name: Henrry Israel

texts.es:
Henrry Israel R. C. tiene 32 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre unto a su compañera y a sus hijos en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TRES DE NOVIEMBRE, Esta compuesta por 28 socios y esta a 90 minutos de  la oficina se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Henrry Israel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en Mata de cacao y sus ventas se realizan en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  mejorar la calidad de vida.

Le gusta compartir su tiempo libre con sus hijos.
texts.en: Henrry Israel R. C. is 32. He is in a common-law marriage and lives with his partner and children in the Chillanes Canton, Bolivar province. He has 2 children. The V.R.C. Tres de Noviembre group has 28 members and is 90 minutes from the office, within the limits of the Chillanes Canton. This region is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour; the sowing of rice, bananas, corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. They spend a lot of time doing this work. Lourdes Rosaura works in agriculture, sowing rice, bananas, corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. He purchases his products in Mata de Cacao and sells in the Matilde Esther Market and in Bucay. He is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of rice, bananas, corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to improve his quality of life. He enjoys sharing his free time with his children.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella L. is from the village of Tumbao, Banisilan, South Cotabato.  She is 45 years old.  Anabella is married and has 6 school-aged children.  To make a living, Anabella owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, canned goods, instant noodles, soap and toothpaste in the local community.  Anabella has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Anabella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anabella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI.  This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital.  Anabella is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and junk food.  This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Anabella from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and junk food.

loans.name: Mariano De Jesus

texts.es:
Don Mariano, tiene 50 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, vive solamente con su esposa, él trabajó como empleado 10 años en un taller de enderezado y pintura, luego decidió instalar su propio taller que hoy tiene ya 3 años de existir, trabaja todos los días de 7:00am a 6:00pm, a la fecha no presenta ningún problema.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar un compresor, esta herramienta la está necesitando para realizar su trabajo, con este préstamo tendrá la posibilidad de adquirir esta herramienta y agilizar sus trabajos, esperando realizar con calidad y mucho empeño cada trabajo realizado.
Sus objetivos en cuanto al negocio es cada vez que exista la posibilidad de adquirir herramientas que enriquezcan el taller hacer todo lo que este a su alcance para realizarlo, además de velar por las condiciones de su familia y cubrir los gastos mensuales.
texts.en:
Mariano is 50 years old and he lives in San Miguel, alone with his wife. He worked in an automotive body shop for 10 years but he later decided to set up his own shop. And he has now been in business for 3 years. He works every day from 7am to 6pm, and to date he has not faced any difficulties. 

He requests a loan to purchase a compressor. He needs this tool to carry out his work. With the help of this loan he will be able to acquire this tool which will facilitate doing quality work. 

As for his business, the goal is to acquire more tools whenever there is an opportunity in order to better equip his shop with everything that he needs to work. He also wants to improve his family's living conditions and to provide for their monthly expenses.

loans.use: To purchase a compressor.

loans.name: Matea

texts.en:
Matea T. is from the village of Becor, Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Matea is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Matea owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Matea has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Matea joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Matea is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Matea from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Denis Antonio

texts.es: Don Denis Antonio, vive en el barrio San José junto a su hijo y su esposa, el tiene 31 años de edad. Su actividad es la venta de madera hace más de 5 años, realiza su trabajo durante toda la semana de 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la noche. El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de madera necesaria para su negocio como cedro, caoba, pochote entre otras. Este préstamo le ayudara a solventar esta situación ya que él no tiene los fondos suficientes para cubrir los pedidos necesarios que sus clientes le realizan. La aspiración de Denis es continuar trabajando para sacar adelante a su familia y poder preparar académicamente a su hijo.
texts.en: Denis Antonio lives in the San José neighborhood with his son and wife.  He is 31 years old and he has worked selling wood for more than five years.  He works throughout the entire week from 7:00am to 6:00pm.  He is requesting a loan for the purchase of wood necessary for his business, such as cedar, mahogany and pochote, among others.  This loan will help him to cover this expense since he doesn’t have sufficient funds to cover the cost of the orders made by his customers.  Denis hopes to continue working to get his family ahead in life and educate his son.

loans.use: to buy cedar, mahogany, and pochote

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 32 years old, and her children are between the ages of 9 months and 11 years. She sells food stuffs, including fruit. She is requesting a loan to buy more food stuffs in order to make more profits. With the profits she plans to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs.

loans.name: Gulira's Group

texts.en:
Gulira K., the 28-year-old leader of this group, is a divorced mother who resides in the northern town of Karabalta with her one-year-old son. Responsible for meeting his needs, she began her entrepreneurial career sewing and selling dolls as souvenirs and distributing cosmetics for a local beauty company one year ago.

Very successful at face-to-face marketing, Gulira has increased the goods' circulation and receives 4,000 soms of monthly income. She is now requesting a loan to purchase a greater variety of cosmetics in order to expand her operation. Gulira's chief goal is to build a better future for her son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics

loans.name: Malvar

texts.en:
Malvar T. is married and is 45 years old. He has two grown-up children who help him together with his wife in managing their retail shop where he sells various commodities such canned and bottled goods, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, spices and many more. Malvar also manages a drugstore in their place where he gets their major source of income. He has been in the business for more than six years. 

Malvar is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to use in purchasing a stock of medicines for sale and also goods to retail in his store like soft drinks. Each month, he earns a monthly net income of PHP 20,000 doing this type of work. 

In the future, Malvar hopes to further  improve his business and meet his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur by simply working hard and staying humble. 

About ASKI: 

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of medicines and various other goods for sale.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander comes from the village of Rodinauli, West Georgia. He is 40 years old and married. Alexander lives with his wife Vera, his parents and their two sons – 12 and 10 years old. Both of children go to school. 

Alexander works in a local asphalt factory. Also he is actively involved in the family's agricultural activities, which are led by Vera. The family has a small dairy farm, consisting of two cows. Vera produces cheese and sells it locally. Also, they own 1.25 ha of agricultural land where greens and vegetables are grown. Harvested products are sold to retailers of greens and vegetables. 

Alexander requested the credit for installation of the irrigation system in his farm. When the system is in place, the harvest of the family will increase and this will positively impact the income of the family. Alexander and Vera hope that they will have a good harvest and will be able to reinvest a part of the profit in farming activities.

loans.use: to purchase materials for irrigation system installation.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child, who is currently in school.  Harriet has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Harriet hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself.  In the future, Harriet hopes to expand her business.  Harriet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her get capital to start a business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en: Lyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a welding shop business in the Philippines for 6 years. She also earns income from pig fattening. Lyn, who  has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF, is now borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy more materials and tools for her welding shop. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials and tools for her welding shop.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. She has been in the farming business for 10 years now and employs four farmhands. Her mixed farm produces bananas, maize and nappier grass which are all sold locally. She mainly depends on the income from her farm to cater for the basic needs of her family.

Hellen has made a loan request of 45,000 Kes to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable her to pay school fees for her four children who are in college. Her major challenges have been poor market prices for farm produce and fluctuating weather patterns which affect her production.

She plans to acquire more dairy cows in the next five years and also build some rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ramish

texts.en:
Ramish is a very serious man. He is the father of two children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need. 

He can manage tough jobs like raising sheep. He started the business in 2008. He usually purchases lambs for a low price, raises them and sells them in the local central bazaar for a profit. His monthly income is 250 USD.  

His greatest goal nowadays is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. It is for this reason that Ramish applied for an 800 AZN loan to purchase more sheep for breeding.

loans.use: to purchase eight sheep and fodder.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is from the village of Zanati, West Georgia. He is 46 years old and lives with his wife, Irma. Raul works as a construction worker in the village, when there are orders. Also, he is involved in the family agricultural business. They have two milk cows and three calves, and produce and sell 35 kg of cheese per month at a local open market. Also, Raul and Irma have a pig and sell 12-16 piglets per year. Along with the above, Raul grows bamboo trees on a family-owned 0.5 hectare plot. He sells 500-600 bamboo poles per year, which are used for furniture production. The average total monthly income of the family is 550 laris. 

With the requested loan, Raul plans to purchase a car. He will use it for transportation of the family farm products (cheese and bamboos) to nearby towns, where he can sell them for a higher price than locally in the village. It will positively impact the income of the family. Raul and Irma will use the increase in income for house renovation.

loans.use: to purchase a car for farm products transportation.

loans.name: Francisco Enrique

texts.es: Francisco  tiene 56 años, es casado y reside junto a su esposa. Se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de soldadura, el tiene varios clientes que llegan a solicitarle los diferentes servicios que ofrece, la ubicación de su negocio es en el barrio san Agustín este negocio le brinda los ingresos que necesita para sacar adelante la economía de su familia. En esta oportunidad él se encuentra trabajando arduamente para tener éxito en su actividad. Francisco se encuentra solicitando un crédito que planea invertir en la compra de hierro, aluminio, estaño, plomo entre otros.
texts.en: Francisco is 56 years old, married and lives with his wife. He provides a welding service and has several clients who come to him for the different services offered. His business is located in the neighborhood of San Agustín.  This business provides the income needed to improve his family's economical situation.  On this occasion, he is working hard to succeed in business.  Francisco is requesting a loan that he plans to invest in the purchase of iron, aluminum, tin, lead etc.

loans.use: to buy iron, aluminum, tin, and lead.

loans.name: Sokna

texts.en:
Sokna, 44, is a farmer. Her husband is a construction worker making $5 per day. She has three children: two are studying and one is working in a factory. 

Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $10 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for her son to commute to work. 

She expects to send the rest of her children to study in the university after they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to commute to work

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune menuisier métallique.En association avec un ami, il a ouvert un atelier dans sa localité.Pour augmenter ses revenus et mieux participer à la prise en charge alimentaire de sa famille, il investit  dans l'élevage de poulets. Il pratique ainsi l'aviculture et l'embouche ovine.Aujourd'hui, il sollicite un pret de 75000F auprès de l'UIMCEC pour acheter 30 poulets et 1 mouton.Son ambition est de construire un poulailler.
texts.en: The borrrower is a young metalworker. In collaboration with a friend, he opened a workshop in his village. To increase his revenue and to better support his family's food requirements, he has begun farming chickens. He is involved in both aviculture and sheep fattening. Today he is requesting a loan of 75000F from the UIMCEC to buy 30 chickens and 1 sheep. His aim is to construct a henhouse.

loans.use: to buy 30 chickens and one sheep

loans.name: Mónica Del Rocío

texts.es:
La Señora. Mónica es socia del banco comunal Damas Responsables, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad de clima frió, su belleza arquitectónica la hace una ciudad muy admirada y visitada, su gente es de un corazón cálido, amable y mantienen la cultura y las tradiciones de sus pueblos.
 
La Señora. Mónica tiene 30 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijas de 13 y 11 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Mónica pasa al cuidado de sus hijas pero en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogos, esta actividad la realiza hace 2 años.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una vecina. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños para surtir su negocio.

Su meta es tener un vehículo.
texts.en:
Mónica Carmen is a member of the communal bank Damas Responsables (Responsible Women).  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city with a cold climate.  The city's beautiful architecture makes it a much admired and visited city.  Its people have a warm heart, are friendly, and maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.  

Monica is 30 years old.  She is married and has 2 daughters ages 13 and 11.  Her older daughter attends high school and her younger daughter attends school in the city.  Her husband works in construction as a carpenter.  They own their home.

Monica takes care of her children and in her spare time she sells clothes by catalog, a business she has had for 2 years.  This is her second loan through the communal bank. She was invited to join by a neighbor.  The new loan will be used to purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes to stock her business. 

Her goal is to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bernardina; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es conviviente; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrótesela vende arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos y también la socia tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maíz y papa y después lo vende al por mayor, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos y también para comprar semillas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bernardina, 50, belongs to the “Amanecer Anteña” (Anta Dawn) communal bank located in Anta District belonging to Anta Province, Cusco Department.

She has a spouse.  She alternates her daily activities with running a grocery store.  She sells rice, sugar, milk and noodles.  She also has a field where she grows corn and potatoes that she then sells at wholesale.  She wants to expand the grocery store and the farming business.  She is asking for the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and noodles and also to buy seeds at wholesale.

She is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and noodles and also to buy seeds at wholesale.

loans.name: Majorie

texts.es: Marjorie, tiene la edad 30 de años, está soltero y vive con su hijo que es su mayor prioridad. Ella pretende con el crédito comprar productos de belleza para su salón. Ella cuenta con el local donde realiza su trabajo y necesita surtir aun más su salón con productos para la clientela. Ella con esto que hará pretende darles a sus clientes una mejor asistencia y mejores resultados tanto en calidad de productos como diversidad. Ella pretende obtener de esto los mejores resultados para así poder ofrecerle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida para su futuro.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marjorie, 30, is single and lives with her son, who is her biggest priority.

With the loan she wants to buy beauty products for her salon.  She has a place where she works and needs to stock her salon even more with products for her customers.  With this she will be able to give them better service and results in both quality and variety of products.  From this she hopes for better results to be able to give her son a better quality of life for his future.

This is the first loan that Marjorie has received from FUDECOSUR.  Previously, she had not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 33 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. She’s married, and her husband is a businessman; they have three children between 3 and 13 years old who are in school and live at home. 

For the past five years, she has been selling fish in the local market. She likes her business because it helps her to send her children to school. She is requesting a loan to purchase more Bonnie fish for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more Bonnie fish for her business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 32-year-old married man and father of two children. He owns a pickle factory since 20 years ago. Ahmad is well known in the region because of his good quality of products he makes. He is a man with a good reputation. Ahmad is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary pickles barrels that are needed to preserve more quantities to increase income. 
Ahmad is a hard working man he works his best to provide his family with the best living and education ever. Most of Ahmad's customers are retail food shops. Ahmad works on producing new kinds of pickles from time to time such as eggplants,almonds and many other vegetables.
Ahmad hopes to expand his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To buy necessary pickles barrels

loans.name: Derlis

texts.es:
Derlis tiene 27 años de edad, está casado hace 6 años con la señora Laura de 24 años de edad,  tienen una hija de 4 años.
Derlis se dedica a la venta de motorepuestos y mecánica de motos desde hace 6 años. Nos cuenta que desde los 12 años empezó a trabajar como mecánico de motos, primero fue ayudante y con el correr del tiempo se volvió un profesional. Dice que trabajaba mucho y ganaba muy poco dinero por lo que salió de su trabajo y decidió montar su propio taller mecánico con un ahorro juntando. Pudo comprar las herramientas mínimas y con el correr del tiempo  mejoró todas las herramientas y también incorporó repuestos para motos.
Debido a la calidad del servicio que presta, una empresa dedicada a la venta de motos le designo como mecánico oficial para que los motos que la empresa representa pueda entrar en su taller para reparaciones y mantenimientos normales.
El solicita la ayuda de la fundación para la compra de repuestos en general para motos, con lo que podrá abastecerse.
texts.en:
Derlis is 27 years old, married for six years to Ms. Laura, 24, and has a four-year-old daughter. Derlis earns a living selling motorcycle spare parts and servicing bikes, which he has done for six years. He tells us he began to work as a motorcycle mechanic at the age of 12. First he was an assistant and then as time went by he became a professional. He says he was working a lot and earning very little money, and so he left his job and decided to open up his own mechanic's shop with some savings. He was able to buy the essential tools and, as time went by, he improved all the tools and also began carrying spare parts for the bikes. 

Owing to the quality of service he provides, a motorcycle dealership designated him as their official mechanic so that the bikes the company represents can go to his shop for routine maintenance and repairs. 

He is seeking the foundation's help for the purchase of motorcycle parts in general with which to stock up.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: La señora Reyna Isabel, tiene 53 años, es una mujer casada y tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad. Ella tiene 6 años que se dedica a brindar el servicio de molino, que está ubicado en su vivienda. Ella quiere realizar mejoras en su vivienda como es el techo que se encuentra muy mal estado, pues cuando tiene que  atender a sus clientes ellos se mojan, es por eso que solicita este crédito con el fin de zinc, clavos, pega, pvc entre otros productos que son necesarios para estos cambios. Sueña con mantener su negocio y seguir ayudando a sus hijos.
