texts.en: Señora Reyna Isabel,is 53 years old. She is married and has 2 adult children. She has been milling in her house for the last 6 years. She wants to make some home improvements such as to the roof which is in a bad condition and lets in the rain when she attends to her clients so that they get wet This is why she is asking for a loan to buy zinc sheets, nails, glue, pvc and other products which are necessary to make the repairs. She dreams of maintaining her business and continuing to help her children.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets, nails, glue, pvc and other things.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a married man, aged 26. He operates a van transport business to make a living. He also sells used clothes to earn an extra income. He works hard in his business, in order to provide for his family.   
Since Gabriel joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business. He has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to add to his stock of clothes for resale.

loans.use: To add to his stock of clothes.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman who has five children. Evangeline is 48 years old and resides at Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. 

Evangeline owns and operate a business venture planting & harvesting bananas to sell to earn a living and she's been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Evangeline has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna lives in Yerevan with her pensioner mother and two little babies. She earns her living by selling flowers and gifts from her little shop. Anna has been running the business for a year already. Now she would like to expand her business and increase the variety of goods. With the requested loan, Anna plans to purchase toys to sell. This loan will help Anna to increase sales and make her business more stable and profitable.

loans.use: to pay for toys

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort cooks rice and beans into stew which she sells at Asebu Brebia. She has completed Junior High School.  Comfort is married and has four children.  Her husband is a carpenter. Comfort has been selling rice and beans for three years. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and beans to cook stew to sell. With the new profit, Comfort plans to expand her business

loans.use: purchase bags of rice and beans to cook.

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en:
Khitam is a 28-year-old married female from Al Bayader in Jordan.   She has two children. She has requested a loan of 600 JOD in order to buy materials for sewing such as fabric, beads, silk she wants to making a clothes to resell.  Khitam is looking forward to improving her family’s living conditions.

Since Khitam is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 35-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife and three children, all of whom attend school. Since 2004, he has been a painter and is well-known among people. Kassem provides the only source of income for his family and he therefore works hard to earn higher returns. 

Kassem is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase new painting equipment to expand his business. His loan will enable him to start a new project on time. Kassem is sure that his loan will push him to take on more and bigger projects in the near future to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to purchase new painting equipment

loans.name: Shirley Maria

texts.es: Ella es Shirley una joven autodidacta, practica y emprendedora que se dedica a elaborar artesanías como lo son sombreros, canasta, incluso asientos, ella inicio su negocio pro gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente pero al falta de apoyo, de oportunidades y de capital le han impedido crecer, por ello acude hoy a la maravillosa comunidad Kiva, buscando un aliento económico para invertir en la compra del insumo principal que es la cañaflecha, con la cual elabora todos los productos, con este préstamo lo que busca e fabricarse ella misma las oportunidades y llevar sus artesanías a los hogares colombianos.
texts.en:
This is Shirley, a self-taught, practical, and proactive young woman who makes hand-made crafts such as hats, baskets, and even chairs. 

She began her business out of pleasure and a vocation for independent work, but a lack of support, opportunities, and capital kept her business from growing. 

For this reason, she is now approaching the marvelous Kiva community, seeking the economic boost that will allow her to buy her main raw material: cañaflecha, a type of wild cane used in the region. All her crafts are made from this material. 

With this loan she hopes to create her own opportunities and take her crafts to Colombian homes.

loans.use: to buy her main raw material: cañaflecha, which is used to make all her products.

loans.name: Jojie

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Jojie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle passenger. Jojie is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Jojie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en:
Alexandra is a single mother of a one child. Her husband left her only a few months after her 10 year old son was born. Since then she has been hard at work trying to make ends meet. She started a small business out of the home she and her mother live in. They sell sodas and juices to the local community. Her mother tends to the business during the day, while Alexandra travels around the community selling clothing and shoes. Alexandra will invest the money from the loan for the purchase of shoes at wholesale quantities.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Alexandra will invest the money from the loan for the purchase of shoes at wholesale quantities

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando has a small store wher he sells groceries and makes and sells bread. He started out with a small amount of savings from the salary he earned working at a shop. He learned how to make bread from the previous renter who had this business in this same location. With time and given the demand, he began to sell groceries, drinks, and various other articles.

Armando needs this loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise for his business, because demand will soon be increasing, when school classes begin. He is sure that with this investment he will obtain good earnings, which will enable him to provide economic security for his family.

Armando is married and 34 years old. He has 3 children who are in school. His wife helps him with the business, and they depend on it to support the family. Armando hopes that with this investment he will earn more and can give economic security to the family.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Armando tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende víveres y elabora y vende pan. El empezo con un pequeño capital producto de ahorros del salario de una empresa donde trabajaba. El aprendió la elaboración del pan de un inquilino que tenia ese negocio antes en el mismo local. Con el tiempo y dada la demanda comenzó a vender víveres, colas y artículos de bazar.

Armando necesita el préstamo para invertir en compra de mercadería para su negocio dado a que pronto se inician las clases y la demanda crece. El esta seguro que con esta inversión obtendrá buenas ganancias que le permitirá tener una seguridad económica para su familia.

Armando esta casado y tiene 34 años. Tiene 3 hijos que estudian. Su esposa le ayuda con el negocio y depende del mismo para apoyar a su familia. Armando espera con esta inversión obtener mejores ganancias que le permitan darle una seguridad económica a su familia.

loans.use: Armando needs this loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna Agolla is a 59-year old widow who supports four children in her household. Her husband died in 1972. Despite the loss of husband Anna has raised and educated her four children. She started her charcoal selling business in 1972. Over the last 35 years she has seen her business grow. She purchases in bulk quantity and sells coal at wholesale to retailers. She also sells small quantities to consumers who cannot afford to buy in bulk.   With her small savings and two previous KMET loans, Anna was able to build 10 semi-permanent housing units, which she rents out at Kshs 500 (US $80) a month to supplement her coal business.  Her hard work, years of experience, and well-established clientele base ensure that her business will continue to succeed.  She plans to use the next loan of US $750 to purchase more coal stock.

loans.use: Purchase bulk charcoal stock

loans.name: Tahire

texts.en: Tahire G. has a beauty salon in the town of Devechi, which is located on the northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Tahire is married with one child and is looking for funding in order to invest in her business. Tahire has already successfully repaid three other loans from Norwegian Microcredit, which shows that she is a trustworthy customer.

loans.use: To invest in her beauty salon business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Boost and Diversify Stock

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. has owned the Josephine Mini Shop for the past twenty years. When she was asked who Josephine is, she smiled and said that was her first-born daughter. Mary is married with two children, and she also cares for 2 orphans. Mary sells sugar, soap, cooking oil, and salt, along with personal hygiene items, at the mini shop in her village of Kikajjo on the outskirts of Kampala. Many of the retail stores sell very similar products. There are at least two reasons. First, the needs of people with little means are not varied; they are buying essentials, not luxuries. And second, one does not want to take a risk and fail at a business, as there is no safety net. So, you stock what you know will sell. Currently, Mary's inventory of products is low, so she plans to use her loan to replenish her stock of cooking goods.

Mary is also the treasurer for the Nyikira Okole Women’s Lending Group. Lending groups are quite common in villages. They act as a kind of peer pressure to encourage members to make sure they make their repayments on time. There also tends to be a strong bond among the members, and they are often strong members in their communities.

loans.use: Mary plans to use her loan to buy cooking supplies, i.e. cooking oil, salt, soap, sugar, etc. for her retail shop.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German lives in his own house with his wife on Antofagasta Street in the Tacagua zone of the city of La Paz. He is 63 years old and since he was young, he has been making sweaters. He works together with his wife, who is in charge of sales.

The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of yarn and other materials needed for the finished product. This business supports both of them; they can cover the loan payments and also their personal needs.

Their credit history makes them eligible for a new loan. They are considered preferred customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

German vive en casa propia con su esposa en la calle Antofagasta de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene 63 años de edad y desde muy joven se dedica a la confección de chompas, trabaja junto con su esposa que es la encargada de las ventas.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar lana y otros materiales que son necesarios para el acabado final. Con esta actividad se mantienen ambos y pueden cubrir las cuotas del préstamo así como también sus necesidades personales.

Por su antecedente Histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito, ya que se considera cliente preferencial.

loans.use: Purchase of yarn and materials

loans.name: Mugema D (Iv) Group

texts.en: Fatuma has a retail shop and mainly sells household products and a few foodstuffs. She wants to use the extra profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more shop items in order to expand current business

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru:
Akmal has sufficient experience and is a scholar at his trade. He has been in the animal husbandry business for the past six years. His family helps him take care of the livestock. The cow house is located on a wide farm-yard near his house.

His current business is very stable and has a good capital turnover. His business consists of buying, feeding and growing and then selling of cattle. The profits grow more with each month and he uses part of the profits to support his family and the rest to reinvest into his business to buy fodder for the cattle. As you can see on the photo, the cow house is a bit small and Akmal wants to build a new one. In the future, he wants to increase the number of livestock, but there's a small problem with the premises. A credit counselor advised him to apply for a loan with Kiva. He hopes to receive a loan soon and promises that he will pay it off within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Акмал,достаточно опытный знаток своего дела.Животноводством он занимается уже 6 лет и семья помогает ему ухаживать за скотом.Его коровник расположен дома, широкий двор и уютный коровник.

Его текущий бизнес достаточно стабилен и он имеет хороший оборот капитала.Его бизнес это купля,откорм и продажа скота. Его активы возрастают ежемесячно и часть прибыли он тратит на семейные нужды, а другую часть тратит на покупку корма быкам.Как видно на фото его коровник немного маловат и он хочет построить новый коровник. В будущем он хочет увеличить количество скота, но проблема в помещении.Кредитный эксперт посоветовал ему участвовать в КИВА программе и он очень надеется на получение займа с КИВА и обязуется оплатить его в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To repair the cow house and to build an additional premise.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en:
N. Mavzuna is 21 years old. Mavzuna lives with her parents and supports them. Mavzuna is a market vendor. She sells dried fruits and grains. Mavzuna travels to the neighboring country, Uzbekistan to purchase the goods for sale. Mavzuna is trading in the local market of her home city as well as in the market of the neighboring city. Mavzuna has been working in this business trying to make it successful generating a stable income for her parents and her self.

There is a strong trend for further development of the business. She's requesting $675 for the term of 12 months. The loan will be spent to increase the range of goods for sale and thus generate more income. Having proved herself as a reliable client Mavzuna promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase dried fruits and grains to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Fadila

texts.en:
Fadila was born in 1957 and she is married. Her husband is a pensioner and he also does agriculture work. He can earn about 400 KM monthly. His monthly pension is 280 KM. They have two children, 22 and 30 years old.

This is her first loan of 1000 KM. Fadila will use it to expand her barn. She hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: For expanding the barn.

loans.name: Patricia Ernilda

texts.es:
Patricia realized that in her community many people work at selling clothing and other common items. She decided to offer a periodic transportation service so that people in her community who work in sales could have the opportunity to go the free trade zone in Santa Elena, since there is a greater assortment of clothing and other items at a good price. In this way she can help her people and at the same time have a business that will earn her a good profit.

She needs a loan of $250.00, which she will pay back over 6 months, in order to make a trip to Santa Elena for this season. The town fair is coming up, and people are able to make a lot of sales. So, they want to take advantage of the opportunity to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Patricia al darse cuenta que por su comunidad, mucha gente se dedicaba a la venta de ropa y otros artículos de uso común, decidió ofrecer una excursión para que la gente de su comunidad que se dedica al comercio tuviera la oportunidad de ir de compras a la zona libre (Santa Elena), ya que ahí hay mayor surtido de ropa y artículos, a un mejor precio, y así ayuda a su gente y al mismo tiempo iniciar un negocio para ella y que le dejaría buenas ganancias.

Ella necesita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para poder hacer una excursión para esta temporada ya que en estas fechas es la feria del pueblo y hay muchas ventas, por lo que sus clientes quieren aprovechar para ir a comprar mercancía..

loans.use: To make a trip to transport people from her community so tht they can get better prices for merchandize in a free trade zone.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia lives on the street Mario Mercado Vaca Guzmán of the zone Bautista Saavedra in the town of El Alto. She lives with her husband and her four children; 16, 12, 10, and 2 years of age. She owns a carpenter workshop where she and her husband mainly manufacture suitcases and trunks which they sell to middlemen at different markets in the town. The loan will be spent on buying a sewing machine to improve the time of production and thus the volume produced. This is the third loan with Impro, and the second through the KIVA program. The evaluation shows notable progress in the increase of her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Julia vive en la calle Mario Mercado Vaca Guzmán de la zona Bautista Saavedra en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de 16, 12, 10 y 2 años respectivamente. Posee un taller de carpintería de madera donde junto a su esposo, elaboran principalmente maletas y baúles que venden a los intermediarios en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de maquina de coser, para mejorar el tiempo de producción y por consiguiente el volumen de producción. Es el tercer crédito con Impro, y el segundo que va por el programa KIVA; en la evaluación realizada se pudo constatar que tiene un progreso notable en cuanto al incremento de su mercadería.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine to manufacture parts of suitcases and trunks.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino is father of 4 children who attend school. For them, Marcelo has to keep moving forward despite the loss of his truck, which he had to give up after having been assaulted last month when he was working in transport. Marcelo has showed his courage and integrity and that he has the ability to keep going and not become discouraged, on the contrary, he will continue working as a famer, and help his family solve and recuperate from their present financial crisis. For these reasons, Marcelo is requesting a loan to invest in his land and to purchase a new truck to continue farming and with your help return to working in public transportation.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva volunteer.

Marcelino es padre de 4 hijos quienes aún son escolares, por ellos, don Marcelo tiene que salir adelante a pesar de la perdida de su motocarro, que tuvo que sobrellevar al haber sido asaltado el mes pasado, él se dedicaba al transporte en moto. Pero don Marcelo nos mostró su valor y entereza que tuvo al poder salir adelante y no desanimarse, sino todo lo contrario, seguir adelante en su labor como agricultor, el cual le ayudará a poder solventar a su familia y recuperarse de la crisis económica que está pasando. Es por estas razones que solicita un préstamo de dinero que invertirá en sus cultivos y en la compra de un motocarro nuevo para seguir adelante trabajando en la agricultura y con su ayuda podría nuevamente también trabajar en el transporte público.

loans.use: To invest in his farmland and to buy a car to continue public transport in addition to farming.

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es:
"I own a small plot of land on which I have a partially constructed home. I want to complete the construction since the house in which I am currently living was loaned to me for one year. I need to finish the construction in order to settle in the home with my family. The people who loaned me the house where we now live are asking me to leave it. I am requesting a loan of 1000 dollars to complete the construction."

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Cuento con un pequeño terreno semiconstruido, el cual quiero terminar D. construir ya que la casa en la que vivo es una vivienda que me han prestado durante 1 año. Tengo la necesidad D. terminar la construcción, para al término D. ella establecerme con mi familia, pues como comento la casa en la que resido es prestada y me la están pidiendo. La cantidad que Solicito es D. 1,000.00 dlls.

loans.use: Finish construction if his home

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
La señora Juanita, socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen del Pilar”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Lamas, distrito de Zapatero y caserío de Nuevo Celendin. Se dedica a la venta de pollos vivos y eviscerados y para ello tiene un pequeño galpón en su domicilio desde donde sale a vender en los poblados mas cercanos y a los clientes que acuden a su casa.

Se inició en el negocio con la venta de juanes y parrilladas y tuvo que cambiar porque la nueva actividad le generaría mucha ganancia y vio que en el lugar donde vive no hay quien venda esta carne que es muy requerida a diario y es por eso que ahora se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos 

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual pagará en 6 meses que lo invertirá en la compra de pollitos BB, alimento de inicio, engorde, acabado y vitaminas, para  lograr vender un buen pollo y satisfacer las exigencias de sus clientes.

Juanita, tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo y su hija quienes la apoyan en todo momento. Es una mujer que poco a poco está creciendo en este negocio. Su meta es poner un galpón propio en su chacra y abastecer con pollos a los caseríos mas cercanos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juanita, member of the "Virgen de Pilar" Community Bank, lives in the region of San Martin, in the province of Lamas, in the district of Zapatero. She sells live and dead chickens, which she stores in a small shed. She sells her chickens in the heavily populated areas, and to clients living close to her. She began the business by selling "juanes," a typical Peruvian food, and grilled food, but she had to change because her current product offers her a higher income, and she struggled to find a market for her meat.

With this loan of 1,500 soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase, small chicken, chicken feed, fatteners, and vitamins, so that she can sell good chicken and satisfy her clients' demands. Juanita is 51 years old, and lives with her husband and daughter, whom always support her. She is little by little expanding her business. Juanita's goal is to have her own chicken shed, and get her supply from the local farmhouses.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase small chickens and food for them

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila M. is 50 years old and comes from Doboj. She is divorced and lives alone. She has incomes from two jobs. One is that she daily takes care of one sick person, and the other is that she sells health products from a regional supplier. She wants to expand her reselling by buying more products and she needs a loan for that. Mila is taking her first loan through WWI. She hopes to have enough income for her needs.

loans.use: To by products for reselling

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti J. has been selling firewood and coconuts in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year. She works from 8:00am to 8:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $125 each month. She has previously taken out one loan through BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan so that she can buy more inventory.

Siti is 30 years old, married, and has seven children.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Iris Azucena

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Iris C. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, soy casada y tengo 3 hijos, cuento con un pequeño negocio propio tambien vendo golosinas en mi pulperia, como ser baleadas, enchiladas, tacos, ya que la gente que viene a comprar siempre se queda comiendo algo, mi negocio esta en mi casa de habitacion asi no descuido mi hogar ni mi familia, en estos momentos necesito un credito para salir adelante con mi negocio ya que por problemas personales tuvo una caida y deseo inyectarle capital para volver a tenerlo como antes. gracias.
texts.en:
Hi, my name is Iris C.. I am dedicated to selling popular consumer products. I am married and have three children. I rely on my own small business. Also, I sell candy from my shop, as well as baleadas (a Honduran dish), enchiladas, and tacos since the people who come to shop also stay to eat something. My business is in my home so that I do not have to neglect my house or my family. Currently, I need a loan to get ahead with my business since, due to personal problems, it experienced a downturn, and I wish to inject capital to return the business to its former state. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Mrs. Lang Khum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people who live in Kdey Thnot village in Kampong Chhnang province participate in the village bank loan and the members in this village bank will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Lang K. is a village bank president and is a stove maker in the local village. Since she now has a lot of customers, she decided to request a loan to buy clay and hay to make stoves in order to meet her customers’ demand. Her husband, Mr. H. Horn, is an ice-cream seller in the local village. Mrs. Lang K. is 48 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom helps in her stove-making business while the remaining four are attending the local school.

All the members' loans are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-Term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Bbuy clay and hay to make stoves

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: Née en 1972, dame A. Josephine s'est mariée à monsieur Antoine HOUNSAMONNOU et de cette union est issue  04 enfants dont  03 sont scolarisés. Elle a une boutique de vente de divers devant son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, elle vend de l'akassa et des poissons frits aux ouvriers et aux passants. La qualité de sa nourriture a faire accoitre sa clientèle et pour ce faire elle a sollicité un  pret aupres de notre institution.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josephine A. was born in 1972 and is married to Mr. Antoine HOUNSAMONNOU. They have four children, out of which three attend school. She runs a shop selling various items in front of her house. In parallel, she sells "akassa" (a traditional beninese food, made out of corn flour) and fried fish to workers and passersby. The quality of her food caused her clientele to increase, and to meet customer demand, she's seeking this loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 sacks of corn, 3 baskets of fish, and other items.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Juanito.
Rosa es casada, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Rosa vende golosinas en un pequeño puesto ubicado en un centro comercial concurrido de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Además Rosa es concesionaria de los servicios higiénicos del centro comercial, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo y hermana.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en el arreglo de los servicios higiénicos.
Rosa sueña con tener casa propia y tener un negocio grande.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “Juanito” Communal Bank. Rosa is married, is 28 years old, and has 2 children. Rosa sells candy in a stand located in a commercial mall in Ayacucho city. In addition Rosa sells hygienic (bathroom) services in the commercial mall, an activity she does with the help of her husband and sister. Rosa needs a loan for 1000 soles to invest in repairing her hygienic services facilities. Rosa dreams of having her own home and having a large business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair hygenic (bathroom) service facilities.

loans.name: Sabra Sagheer Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Sabra baji is the wife of S. A. and has resided in a city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Sabra baji’s husband has had a dairy business for the past 10 years. He has a buffalo at his house and Sabra baji helps him in getting milk from the buffalo.

Sabra baji is a very supportive and caring lady. She shares the financial burden of her husband by preparing embroidered clothes. She takes orders from her relatives and neighbors and charges US$ 3 per embroidered dress. She is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her husband’s dairy business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Raheela baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Nazri baji wants a loan to buy meat to sell. Mussarat baji wants a loan to buy an ox cart for transport. Aflan baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (tea, sugar, and milk) for her tea stall. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for their dairy business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
ELVIRA P. D. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Rosas”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Túpac Amaru N° 202 del Distrito D. Callería, tiene 67 años D. edad, tiene 5 hijos,  es viuda.
Esta dedicada al alquiler D. maquinaria pesada y D. transporte, el primer préstamo que obtuvo D. S/.300 nuevo soles, le sirvió para refaccionar un vehículo, y ponerlo en alquiler, su condición D. mujer no la detiene para dedicarse al rubro D. maquinaria pesada.

El préstamo D. S/.1,000 Nuevos Soles, con el que va realizar el mantenimiento D. sus unidades, y estos estén listos para su alquiler.

Esta agradecida con Manuela Ramos, la ayuda que les da le ha  ayudado a no depender D. un esposo, como algunas mujeres, por el contrario a podido salir adelante sola.
texts.en:
ELVIRA P. D. V. is an associate of the Communal Bank "Las Rosas" and lives at 202 Jr. Túpac Amaru in the Callao District. She is a 76-year-old, widowed mother of 5.

She rents out heavy machinery and transportation. The first loan she received of 300 Soles (3 Soles = $1USD, approx.), she used to refurbish her truck in order to put it up for rent. Being a woman has not stopped her from being in the business of heavy machinery.

With this loan of 1,000 soles, she will tune up and upgraD. her machines in order to rent them.

She's very thankful for the help she has received from Manuela Ramos; it has enabled her to move ahead on her own, instead of depending on her husband, like other women.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To tune up and upgrade her machines in order to rent them

loans.name: Toshtemir

texts.ru: Тоштемир Байниязов - мужчина 48 лет. Вдовец. Отец 5-х детей. Тоштемир воспитывает их в одиночку а также занимается откормом и продажей скота. Его жена умерла несколько лет назад, о чем он не хотел вспоминать, так как ему грустно. Тоштемир единственный человек в семье, который зарабатывает деньги, чтобы выдать замуж двоих дочерей. Он закупает скот на рынке и откармливая 2-3 месяца продает на том же рынке. Этим он зарабатывает на жизнь, чтобы прокормить своих детей. Он очень рад, что есть такие организации, поддерживающие низшее общества.
texts.en:
Toshtemir B. is a 48 year old man. He is a widower and the father of 5 children. Toshtemir raises them on his own and also raises and sells livestock. His wife passed away several years ago, something he does not like to think about because it makes him sad. Toshtemir is the only person in his family who earns money in order to marry off his two daughters. He purchases livestock at the market and fattens them for 2-3 months after which he sells them at the same market. This way he earns a living and feeds his children. He is very happy that there are organizations such as this that support the lower class.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raise livestock

loans.name: María Catalina

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León la señora María J. se dedica a su negocio de pulpería que posee en su propia casa de habitación que a pesar que no presta las condiciones necesarias para el negocio ella busca la manera de cómo desarrollarse.

Actualmente la señora María ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los productos de la pulpería y de esta manera continuar con su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión inmediata.
texts.en:
In Telica, an area of Leon city, Señora María J. runs a business out of her home selling natural juices. It is difficult, because her home is not ideally suited to running a business, but Maria manages well enough. Currently, Maria is asking for a loan so that she can buy juicing equipment - her business badly needs an investment.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy equipment

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza seeks a loan from Kiva lenders of PHP 6,000.00. This amount will assist her in improving her duck-raising business, which is their source of income. She also sell duck eggs on a retail and wholesale basis. She believes that the business is good and really generates income for her family. She hopes for her business to become progressive and somehow produce more eggs. Her business also provides her children with their school allowance and provides for the daily needs of their family.

Flordeliza said that “patience is the key to success,” and this is what she always keeps in mind.

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty is 43 years old and married with six children. She makes a living selling women's clothing and underwear. She is applying for a loan to buy more garments to sell to her customers, and wishes to express her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more garments to sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul K. is a 45-year-old man. He is married and has five children. All his kids are in school. He lives with his wife in his matrimonial home, at Sefwi in the western region of Ghana. He is an achiever and a resourceful young man. He loves selling goods, the business through which he makes a living. 

Paul has been trading in crates of eggs in the community market for eight years now. He treks to surrounding villages in the Ashanti region of Ghana to purchase bulk stock of eggs from the farmers and retails to his customers. For lack of adequate working capital, he is not able to pick enough stock to make enough profit to support his family. He wants to use part of the profit to support his kid’s education. He would be grateful for your assistance because with the loan, he wants to purchase bulk supplies of crates of eggs to enable him to scale up his sales. He believes the loan would enable him to save more income to support his business growth also. He belongs to a village bank called ‘Prayer is the key’.

loans.use: To purchase bulk crates of eggs.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto tiene 32 años, vive con su pareja Celia de 28 años y sus dos hijos Mariela de 11 y Adrián de 9 meses de nacido. Desde muy joven, en su natal Chanchamayo (selva del departamento de Huancayo) empezó a brindar el servicio de transporte en motocarro, posteriormente migró a la ciudad de Lima donde obtiene mejores ganancias debido a que se asoció con un grupo de transportistas de motocarros donde trabaja con mayor seguridad y estabilidad. A él le gusta mucho su  trabajo y lo realiza con alegría aunque sus planes a futuro son mayores, ya que también aprendió el oficio de mecánico y siempre le ha gustado esta actividad, por ello quiere implementar su propio taller, mientras alquila el motocarro que actualmente conduce. “Todo trabajo es sacrificado” dice Roberto, pero sabe que tras mucho esfuerzo y dedicación vendrá el progreso que espera alcanzar para el bienestar de su familia. Este es su segundo préstamo individual con MFP, siempre fue muy puntual en todos sus pagos, además está muy contento de seguir trabajando con esta institución. Con el dinero que solicita comprará un motor y refaccionará su motocarro, además también invertirá en la tramitación de los documentos que necesita para la libre circulación de su vehículo.
texts.en:
32-year old Roberto lives with his wife Celia, aged 28, and their two children Mariela aged 11 and Adrián who was born 9 months ago. As a young man in his native Chanchamayo (in the jungle, in the department of Huancayo), he began a motorcycle taxi service. He then moved to Lima where he earned more money as he joined a group of motorcycle taxi drivers, allowing him to get more regular work. He really likes his work and he does it with pleasure even though he has very big plans for the future. He also trained to be a mechanic, work which he has always enjoyed. He wants to open his own workshop while renting out the motorcycle taxi which he currently drives. “All work requires sacrifice,” says Roberto, but he knows that after much effort and hard work he will achieve a better future for his family. This is his second individual loan with Kiva partner MFP. He has always been very punctual with his repayments, and he is very happy to continue working with this institution. With the money he plans to buy an engine and repair his motorcycle. He will also buy the documentation necessary to allow his taxi to travel around the city without problems.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his motorcyle and obtain documentation

loans.name: Omar

texts.es: El señor Omar  C. C. tiene  31 años de edad, es casado y actualmente tiene un hijo de  8 años. El señor C. C. es dueño de un taxi, el ofrece el servicio de transporte. Don Omar C. comenzó su negocio de de transporte hace  5 años, por lo que anteriormente laboraba para plastinic, hubo un recorte de personal, y a él lo despidieron entonces, con su liquidación decidió comprar un vehículo para obtener ingresos para su familia porque como hombre responsable de su familia, tenía que encontrar un medio de vida. El crédito será invertido en la compra de repuestos para el vehículo, además que quiere darle una retocada a la pintura y una enderezada al mismo vehículo. Su sueño es condicionar su unidad y con el tiempo adquirir otra para obtener más utilidad y ser un microempresario y por  y ayudar más a su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Omar C. C. is 31 years old, married, and has an 8 year old son. Sr. C. C. is the owner of a taxi, and he offers transportation services. Don Omar C. began his transportation business 5 years ago. He previously worked for Plastinic, which had a down-sizing and therefore they let him go. With his severance pay, he decided to buy a vehicle in order to earn income for his family. As he is the responsible man of his family, he had to find a way to earn a living.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of spare parts for the vehicle, and furthermore, he wants to give it a touch up of paint and to repair the vehicle. His dream is to condition his unit, and with time to buy another to earn more profits, and to be a micro-businessman in order to help his family more.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Hường Thị T. Nguyễn was born in 1980. She lives in Loc Ha hamlet, in Mai Lam, Dong Anh province, Hanoi, with her husband and her son. Her family runs a store where they sell irons, but Hường’s main job is farming. She also sells refreshers from home. Together they have a monthly income of about 4 million VND.

Hường is the leader of a five-member group that is applying for a loan from SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Hường wants to borrow VND 5,886,000 (approx. USD 345) to expand her store.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Ngân T. Thủy Nguyễn was born in 1982. She sells wooden furniture. She wants to borrow VND 5,450,000 (approx. USD 320) to buy wood.

Nguyện Thị P. was born in 1960. She wants to borrow VND 4,578,000 (approx. USD 265) to sell refreshers.

Hà Thị T. Trịnh was born in 1971. She wants to borrow VND 5,450,000 to buy goods to sell.

Mai Thúy Ngô was born in 1970. She is a hairdresser. She wants to borrow VND 5,886,000 to invest in her hairdressing shop.

loans.use: to expand store

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is 34 years old and married with two children. She has a retail business selling second-hand clothes. Her business needs a greater variety of merchandise as her customers are asking her to sell more clothes. This is why she is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to stock her business. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Maritza Natividad

texts.es:
La señora Maritza Natividad se ha destacado por vender verduras en el Mercado central de León donde a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor ofreciendo las verduras a los clientes y de esta manera busca como llevar el sustento a su humilde hogar.

Ella es madre de dos hijos los que tiene que alimentar ya que dependen de ella. La razón por la que acudió a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las verduras ya que lo requiere a lo inmediato y de esta manera logrará continuar vendiendo las verduras en su localidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Maritza Natividad sells vegetables daily at the central market of León. Her day begins very early in the morning and she works hard to provide her customers with the vegetables they need so that she can bring home income for her modest household.

She is the mother of two dependent children that she has to feed. Sra. Maritza has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan to purchase more vegetables because her need is immediate and she needs to continue succeeding in the sale of vegetables in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Mrs. Thavy Meng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people who live in Angk village in Kandal province made up the village bank loan and they will use the loan which they obtained in different purposes. Mrs. Thavy M. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns 0,6-hectar to cultivate rice for a living. In this farming, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy more fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers for her purpose. Her husband, Mr. Arn Seourn, also helps her in the farming. Mrs. Thavy M. is 27 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study because that child is on the age of four years old. A man who is presented in the photo is a group guarantee; he also shown in the picture with the village bank loan.

Two members in this village bank loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Metchelie

texts.en:
Metchelie D. P. is from the village of Tabuan, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 25 years old. Metchelie is married and has 1 infant. To make a living, Metchelie runs a transportation service. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a motorcycle in the community. Metchelie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Metchelie joined GDMPC in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Metchelie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to buy tires and accessories. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Metchelie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing tires and accessories

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, tiene 35 años, vive con su pareja (Andrés) de 42 años, y con sus 3 hijos: Michael de 16, Yubitza de 13 y Didier de 2 añitos de edad. Todos ellos comparten sus días muy contentos en su casa propia.

Desde muy temprana edad ha trabajado en varios oficios ayudando a doña Clara, su madre, que fue quien le enseñó a ser empeñosa, ya que en su juventud también fue tan dinámica como Liliana, vendía comida y también era comerciante para generar ingresos extras al sueldo de su esposo, y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 
En la actualidad Liliana tiene un negocio más estable, una bodega, a la cual se dedica toda la semana de 6 de la mañana a 9 de la noche, siendo un trabajo muy agotador, pues debe dividirse entre el trabajo de su hogar y el de su negocio, ya que teniendo hijos en edad escolar debe preparar los alimentos antes de mandarlos al colegio.
Pero a pesar de todo, Liliana se encuentra contenta, ya que puede dedicarse a ellos y también a su negocio, por lo cual piensa seguir haciéndolo crecer para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.  

Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad productos para implementar su tienda, y en esta temporada comprará panetones (especie de bizcochos con pasas y frutas confitadas) típicos de las fiestas navideñas.
texts.en:
Liliana is a very hard-working and responsible woman. She is 35, and she lives with her 42 year old life partner (Andrés) and their three children. Michael is 16, Yubitza is 13, and Didier is 2. They all share their days very happily in their own house. From a very early age she has worked at various jobs helping her mother, Clara. Her mother is the one that taught her to be hard-working. In her youth, her mother was as dynamic as Liliana. She sold food and was also a business person in order to generate extra income to add to her husband’s salary. That way she improved the family’s quality of life. Liliana currently has a more stable business, a mini market. She works there the whole week from six in the morning until nine at night. As it is a very tiring job, she must divide herself between her chores at home and her business. Because she has school aged children, she must prepare their food before sending them to school. In spite of everything, Liliana is very happy. She can devote herself to them and also to her business. She plans to keep growing the business to improve her income. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She has always been very punctual in all of her payments. She will use the money that she is now asking for to buy a larger quantity of products to put in her store. This season she will buy “panetones” (a type of biscuit with raisins and candied fruit), a typical item for the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur n’a pas fait de grandes études, très tôt il a appris la menuiserie, après sa formation, il a ouvert en 2001 son propre atelier dans son quartier. Il fabrique lui-même des meubles qu’il vend à ses clients. Il expose les meubles devant son atelier pour attirer le regard des passants.  Il a reçu des commandes de ses clients qu’il ne peut exécuter parce que ne disposant pas suffisamment de planches, il sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 30 planches et divers matériaux.
Il est marié et père de 02 enfants, c’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’il subvient aux charges des sa famille.
texts.en:
This gentleman did not have an extensive education; very early on he learned to be a carpenter. In 2001, after his training, he opened his own workshop in his area. He makes furniture himself that he sells to his customers. He displays his furniture in front of his workshop to attract the attention of passersby. He has received orders from his customers that he cannot execute because he does not have enough planks of wood; he is thus seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 30 planks and various other materials. He is married and has two children. It is with the income from his business that he provides for his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy planks of wood and accessories

loans.name: Seth

texts.en: Seth O., 51 years old, has built a shop in front of her home where she operates and sells various cooking ingredients. She sells her items to people who live near her house and typically makes around $4 of profit each day to meet what her family needs. Beside her grocery business, she owns a few rooms that she uses for a karaoke service. She is married to Doul Seng, 61, who assists with her in selling inventory. Seth O. has five kids, two of whom are working as cleaners for a small firm and the rest of them are students in the local school. In the past, Seth O. hired a taxi at high cost to deliver her merchandise and right now she hopes to reduce the fee by using a loan to purchase a new motorcycle, which she will use to supply her business.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle, which she will use to supply her business

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou G. est une femme de 62 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de MANKOLICOUNDA depuis 06 ans et demi où elle occupe le poste d'assistante dans le comité de gestion. Elle vend des patates et du "nététou" (produit alimentaire locale) Elle s'approvisionne en grande quantité dans les villages environnants et revend dans la capital à Dakar. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Fatou G. is a 62 year old woman who is married and the mother of 10 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Mankolicounda for six and a half years, where she has served as an assistant in the management committee. She sells potatoes and "nététou" (a local food product). She buys them in large quantities in the surrounding villages and resells them in the Dakar, the capital. She is working to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Jarred Taylor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell essential commodities

loans.name: Sonida

texts.en: Mrs. Sonida S. (in the photo) and her husband are silk weavers. They have been married since 2009 and live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 km. from Phnom Penh City. The couple sells the finished products to a middleman who, in turn, sells it in Phnom Penh market. Sonida is applying for a loan of $300 to purchase cotton thread for the business she and her husband have.

loans.use: To purchase cotton thread for her weaving business.

loans.name: María Nubia

texts.es:
María Nubia M. D. T. tiene 57 años y vive en el barrio Marchuela en Usme, una localidad meridional D. Bogotá, la capital D. Colombia. Está casada y tiene doce hijos entre 12 y 39 años y trabaja con su esposo. Tiene una comercializadora donD. venD. tanto herramientas, mecánica, artículos automotrices, elementos para la construcción y partes eléctricas, como juguetes inflables. Este es su cuarto crédito con la Fundación y cree que sus créditos anteriores le han permitido crecer y aumentar su capital D. trabajo y han contribuido tanto a más estabilidad económica, como a un mejor estilo D. vida. Solicita un crédito por valor D. $1.200.000 pues quiere comprar seis docenas D. herramientas, D. serruchos, atornilladores y también un surtido D. juguetes inflables.
María Nubia es proveniente del departamento D. Caldas en el Eje Cafetero, llevó más D. veinte años viajando por toda Colombia a raíz del oficio D.  su esposo que trabajaba en un parque D. juegos mecánicos que se trasladaba D. un lugar a otro vendiendo diversión.  Pero al iniciar los años 90, la familia se estableció en Barranquilla, donD. compró una vivienda y abrió una panadería, pues  por razones D. salud D. su esposo, se vio obligada a radicarse en Bogotá en el año 2008 y ahora está agradecida  con Dios porque su estado D. salud está mejor. Su meta actual es comprar una vivienda en la capital, ya que tuvieron que vender su casa en Barranquilla, ella desea que sea en el mismo  sector donD. esta ubicado su negocio, porque es una zona  muy comercial, acogedora y la gente es muy amable.
texts.en:
Maria Nubia M. D. T., 57, lives in the Marchuela area of Usme, a neighborhood on the outskirts of the Colombian capital of Bogota. She is married and has twelve children who range in age from 12 to 39. She works with her husband selling hardware, tools, car parts, construction supplies, electrical parts and even inflatable toys. This is her fourth Fundacion loan and the previous loans have allowed her to increase her working capital, something that she thinks has greatly contributed to her financial situation and her way of living. She is applying for a 1,200,000-peso loan that she will use to buy tools--saws, screwdrivers, etc.--and more inflatible toys for her business.

Maria Nubia is a native of the "departamento" of Caldas in the Eje Cafetero region of western Colombia. She spent twenty years traveling around Colombia with her husband who worked for a carnival, both of them going from place to place, selling fun. At the beginning of the 1990s, the family settled in Barranquilla where they bought a house and opened a shop. For the sake of her husband's health, the family resettled in Bogota in 2008 and, happily, his health is now better. Maria Nubia's goal is to buy a house in the capital because they had to sell their Barranquilla house. She wants to live in the same neighborhood as the shop because there are lots of businesses nearby, it's convenient and the people are friendly.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Zafardjon

texts.ru: Донияров Зафарджон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 25 лет. Женат, не имеет детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Зафарджон занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает крупно- рогатый скот. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 8 лет. В этом ему помогает жена. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота. Зафарджон хочет увеличить количество скот. Он намерен разводит крупно- рогатый скот для перепродажи их на мясо.
texts.en:
Zafardjon D. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 25 years old, married and has no children. His wife is a homemaker. Zafardjon is involved in animal husbandry. He raises and sells cattle. Zafardjon has been involved in this business for over 8 years. His wife helps him with it. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle. Zafardjon wants to increase his livestock quantity. He intends to raise cattle in order to resell it for meat.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
La Sra. Nimia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 54 años, 02 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella. 
Su esfuerzo emprendedor de sacar adelante a sus hijos, por idea propia le motivo a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes en general, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa en un local amplio y acondicionado. 
Nos cuenta que tiene clientela fija que a diario acuden a su casa a comprar porque ella tiene todo los productos que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza, las ganancias que genera ayuda al ingreso económico de su familia. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 
Nimia, se siente con muchas fuerzas aun para continuar trabajando y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. Nimia is a member of the Communal Bank “Nuestra Señora de la Paz” (Our Lady of Peace), which is in the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martín. She is 54 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is a dependent.

She strives as an entrepreneur so that her children can get ahead. This motivated her to start her business of selling groceries out of her home, which is a spacious and suitable location. Nimia says that she has established customers who come to her house every day to shop because she has all the products that a housewife needs. Nimia personally welcomes her customers with her charismatic personality. The revenue she generates helps her with the family finances.

With this loan of 1000 PEN, she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packets of noodles, milk, cases of canned fish of different brands, crates of eggs, and personal hygiene products so that she can continue providing good service to her customers. Nimia feels strongly about continuing her work and thanks Manuela Ramos for helping women like her to have opportunities to develop in the communities where they operate.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock her store

loans.name: Balibaseka Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Christine, shown at the top left in the small photo, also appears in the big group photo as the group leader. She is a 43-year-old single mother of six and is, on the face of it, a happy-go-lucky woman. With the kind of business she is engaged in (selling produce), this trait presumably works in her favor.

In Seeta where Christine has been operating from for the last twenty years, her reputation has gained currency. This is on the grounds of her impressive business line of operation. Her customer base has grown by leaps and bounds over the years as a result of her exemplary customer relationship skills. Her only let down has been customers who pay her in kind and in installments.

In a month, Christine calculates she makes 100,000 shillings. By her own account, this is not enough for her to achieve her dreams of expansion. She is very optimistic that, with a loan, there will be a favorable turn in her circumstances.

loans.use: To buy more beans and maize to sell

loans.name: Chanara's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanara M. is a vegetable seller who earns a small income to support her family. She is a widow with a child who is 5 years old. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her standard of living. 

Mrs. Chanara M. is 30 years old and she is the leader of this group which consists of five members located in Chan Lork village in Kandal province. The members will use their loan for different purposes.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables

loans.name: Magdalena Soledad

texts.es: Doña Magdalena García cuenta con un pequeño taller de 2 telares para elaborar Cortes típicos para mujeres ya que su clientela a crecido por lo que solicita su prestamos para poder cubrir su demanda como también darles educación a sus hijos ya que en ello lleva 8 años de laborar en dicha artesanía por lo que desea incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Magdalena García has a small workshop with 2 looms where she makes traditional garments for women. Since her customer base has grown, she requests a loan so that she can meet her demand. In addition, she wants to provide her children with an education. For this reason she has worked for 8 years making these types of handicrafts, and she wants to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica D. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 34 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jessica owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. She currently has a half-hectare rice field and also raises two pigs. She hopes to expand her business to earn a better income. She also dreams that all her children will be able to finish college.
In 2008, Jessica joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jessica is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and feed for her pigs. This loan will be her sixth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

About CEVI
Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers (such as manure) and pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce M. M. is 34 years old. She is married and has two children, one is age 12 and the other is 11 years old. Her business is located at Kamukunji in a very busy market in Nairobi. She has a business in which she has been selling metal boxes to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is the high prices of raw materials. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more materials to make the boxes to sell. In the future, she hopes to buy a plot and expand her business. She describes herself as hardworking, focused and ambitious.

loans.use: Scrap metal

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de su hermana. Hace mas de 10 años se dedica en la venta de cosméticos, actividad que le permite visitar continuamente al domicilio de sus clientes y amistades ofreciendo la variedad de productos de belleza que posee. Es así que cada mañana sus ventas lo realizan a crédito, siendo estas elegidas por catálogo, o también le compran de los productos que tiene como stock. Paralelamente también ofrece lencería, ya que algunas de sus clientas le han solicitado este producto. Para ella es muy importante tener un control adecuado de sus ventas ya que esto le permitirá saber cuanto esta ganado y por ser disciplinada en sus cuentas, ha logrado acumular rentas considerables, por tanto desea tener más capital para invertir. Esta es la séptima vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, todo este tiempo de experiencia en su grupo comunal le ha servido para fortalecer su economía, además es muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más mercadería en cosméticos y tener así mayor variedad de productos para su clientela.
texts.en:
Carmen is 38 years old. She lives with her husband and two children at her sister's place. She has been selling cosmetics for 10 years, a business that allows her to continuously visit her customers and friends to offer them the assortment of beauty products she carries. Every morning she sells on credit, the products being picked through a catalogue or from her current stock. In parallel she also offers lingerie, a product some of her customers have requested. For her it's very important to adequately monitor sales so as to know how much she is earning. Her accounting discipline has enabled her to make a considerable income and now she would like to have more capital to invest. This is the seventh time she gets a loan through MFP. The time spent and experience gained in her loan group has helped her to strengthen her finances. She is very responsible when it comes to making payments and is grateful to those individuals contributing to the loan, which will be very useful in the development of her business. With the loan she is requesting she will buy more cosmetics merchandise in order to have a greater variety of products for her customer base.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Térence

texts.fr:
Térence N.  est âgée 60 ans, née en exil en RDC. Elle est mariée et possèdent onze enfants, le moins âgée a 17 ans et le plus âgée à 33 ans, tous sont allés a l’école. Térence avec sa famille habite à Kigali.
Concernant son activité, il est commerçant des boissons non alcooliques(Fanta), il a une expérience de 20 ans dans ce domaine de commerce et il a fait des épargnes qui lui ont aidé d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille en payant le minerval pour ses enfants. Il épargne dans ACB avec laquelle il est client il y a 3ans. Le prêt qu’il vient de contracter, c’est pour acheter des 50 caisses de Fanta, Il les vend en détaille et en tirer les bénéfices et rembourser son prêt. 

Le prêt contracté avec ACB est  le treizième, les intérêts  tirés de son business, il les utilise pour payer les minervaux des ses enfants et augmenter son chiffre d’affaires.

Dans l’avenir, après avoir terminé de rembourser le prêt, il pourra augmenter un niveau de prêt, et il deviendra distributeur agréé de la Bralirwa.
texts.en:
Térence N. is 60 years old and was born in exile in the Democratic Republic of Congo. He is married and the father of 11 children, the youngest 17 years old and the oldest 33. All of them attended school. Térence and his family live in Kigali. His business is the sale of soft drinks (Fanta); he has 20 years of experience in this business and his savings have allowed him to improve living conditions for his family by paying his children’s school fees. He saves with ACB, where he has been a client for three years. The loan that he is requesting is to buy 50 cases of Fanta, which he will sell at retail to make a profit and repay his loan. The loan contracted with ACB is his 13th, the interest paid with his business income. He uses them to pay school fees and increase his sales figures. In the future, after paying back the loan, he will be able to take out a bigger loan and become a certified distributor for Bralirwa (a large brewer and soft drink company in Rwanda).

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 50 cases of Fanta

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Alberto participa como presidente en EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD en la alcancía comunal “Nuevo Amanecer”, microempresario en artesanía, carpintería y eventualmente realiza otros trabajos. Comenzó la artesanía a raíz D. que su padre lo inculcaba e influía mucho y para poder darle mejor solvencia a su hogar; esto le generó pequeñas ganancias pero el tuvo la idea D. generar sus propios ingresos, Alberto ha logrado educar a sus hijos, no cuenta con ningún ahorro porque todo lo que gana lo invierte en su familia y su negocio, el comparte los gastos D. su familia con su esposa.
Alberto quiere seguir creciendo, para ello le es necesario contar con un capital el cual no lo tenía. Por tal motivo acudió a EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD a fin D. obtener el crédito actualmente tiene un pequeño taller D. carpintería que piensa seguir implementando en los siguientes préstamos que recibirá D. EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, además darle una mejor calidad D. vida a sus hijos e implementar su taller D. repostería D. su señora esposa
texts.en:
Alberto participates as the president of EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD in the community bank "Nuevo Amanecer" ("New Dawn"). He is a microentrepreneur pursuing artisanry, carpentry, and eventually other projects. Owing to his father's influence, Alberto pursued artisanry, which also allows him to proviD. for his home by generating a small income. Alberto has been successful in educating his children. He does not have any savings because everything he earns he invests in his family and his business. He shares family expenses with his wife. Alberto wants to continue growing, but to do so he needs financial capital, which he does not have. For this reason, he turned to EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD to obtain a loan. He currently has a small carpentry workshop, which he plans to continue to grow with loans from EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD. Additionally, he will use the loan to proviD. his children with a better quality of life and set up a bakery for his wife

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood and tools

loans.name: Bunleng

texts.en:
Mr. Bunleng R., is 36 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sayun Ket, is 36 years old, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, have been married since 1989 and have four children-two sons and two daughters. One of them has full-time employment and other three are in school. His wife sells fish. 

Bunleng sells mangoes and tomatoes; he buys them on contract before harvesting for the future season from the fellow villagers. He has to prevent the mangoes from the insect bite by using pesticide when they are small and when the mangoes grow big enough, he takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. He does not have enough capital to purchase mangoes on contract for resale so he is asking for a loan of $1,000 help his capital. 
Photo: is Bunleng with pesticide applicator not pumping or spraying apparatus.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes on contract

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: El señor Jaime vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, quedo viudo hace un año y no tiene hijos, es carpintero y trabaja en una carpintería donde percibe un sueldo mínimo. En la casa de sus padres utilizó una habitación para instalar una tienda de abarrotes. El crédito que solicita es para abastecer la tienda, debido a  que es la única del barrio tiene mucha demanda de clientes, de esta manera el mejorará sus ingresos y mejorará su nivel de vida. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito y por el carácter social se sugiere otorgárselo.
texts.en:
Jaime lives in his parents’ house in La Paz’s Tembladerani neighborhood. He was widowed a year ago and has no children. He’s a carpenter employed at a carpentry shop where he is paid the minimum wage. He set up a grocery store in one of the rooms in his parents’ house. The loan he is asking for is to stock the store. Because it’s the only one in the neighborhood customer demand is high. He hopes thus to increase income and improve his standard of living. This is the first time he’s requested a loan and his social characteristics suggest it be granted.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
el grupo Genesis esta ubicado en el Barrio San Antonio de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, esta integrado por 5 mujeres luchadoras y con muchos deseos de superacion, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la señora Lourdes Yanina O. A. es casada y tiene una hija que depende de ella, junto con su esposo se ayudan economicamente para salir adelante. Lourdes se dedica a la venta de golosinas como ser tacos, enchiladas, tortillas con quesillo y jugos naturales de piña y naranja. el credito lo utilizara para comprar los materiales para fabricar las golosinas.

la sra. Marta Marina V. B. se dedica a elaboracion y venta de tortillas desde hace 2 años, su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitacion, tiene dos personas que le ayudan a la elaboracion de las tortillas.
Marta entrega las tortillas a un restaurante de la zona. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de
leña, y maiz.

la sra. Ada Martiza G. C. tiene 33 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos. junto con su esposo se ayudan economicamente.
Ada se dedica a la compra y venta de cosmeticos marca AVON este negocio consiste en compras de perfumes, desodorantes, talcos, cremas, shampo, y muchos articulos mas, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 9 años.
su producto lo vende con los empleados de las empacadoras de camaron.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de cosmeticos.

la sra. Carmen P. tiene 63 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos nietos de los que ella se ha hecho cargo ya que
sus padres no estan en el pais, Carmen se dedica desde hace 3 años a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas,
sus clientes son sus vecinos y personas a los que les da crédito de quince dias.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz y leña.

la sra. Jessica Jisela G. tiene 29 años de edad,  tiene un hijo, Jessica se dedica al comercializacion de peluches, plasticos, cameras, ropa de segunda, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años, sus clientes son de los lugares aledaños a San Lorenzo, vende el producto de puerta en puerta ya que dice que se vende mas que tener un puesto en algun lugar.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar plasticos, peluches, ropa de cama y ropa usada.
texts.en:
The Genesis group is located in San Lorenzo’s San Antonio neighborhood. It is composed of five tenacious women with strong drives for self improvement. Following are details of their various activities: Mrs. Lourdes Yanina O. A. is married and has a dependent daughter. Together with her husband they help each other get ahead economically. Lourdes sells snacks like: tacos, enchiladas, tortillas with cheese and natural pineapple and orange juice. She will use the loan to buy ingredients to make these snacks. Mrs. Marta Marina V. B. has made and sold tortillas for the last two years. Her tortilla shop is located in her home. She has two helpers that help her make tortillas. Marta sells the tortillas to a local restaurant. She will use the loan to buy firewood and corn. Mrs. Ada Martiza García C., 33, is the mother of two children. She and her husband work together to help each other economically. Ada is an AVON saleswoman. She buys perfumes, deodorants, talcs, creams, shampoos and many other items. She has been in this line of work for 9 years. She sells her items to employees of a shrimp packing firm. She will use the funds to buy cosmetics. Mrs. Carmen P., 63, is single but has two grandchildren in her care because their parents are abroad. Carmen has made tortillas for sale for the last 3 years. Her customers are neighbors and people to whom she extends credit for fifteen days. She will use the funds to buy firewood and corn. Mrs. Jessica Jisela G., 29, has a son. She sells stuffed toys, plastic items, cameras, used clothing. She has been in this line of work for 2 years. Her customers are from areas neighboring San Lorenzo. She sells her products door-to-door and says she sells more this way than if she had a fixed stand someplace. She will use the loan to buy plastic items, stuffed toys, bed linens and used clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, vegetables, chicken, cooking oil, clothes, plastic items, tortillas, lard, pork, beef and chicken, cheese, pineapples, oranges, firewood, cosmetics, stuffed toys, cameras and used clothes.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita L. is from the village of Poblacion, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 51 years old and is widowed. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling home products such as utensil sponges, sewing thread, etc. in the local community. She also makes and sells food like jack fruit salad. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Carmelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.
