She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and to provide capital for her business. This will be the first loan that Carmelita has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell and to provide capital for her business

loans.name: Asucena Group

texts.es:
El comité  Asucena ” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Yryvukua.
 Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas, cría de animales etc. 
Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. 
Este comité ya están en su tercer ciclo, todo este tiempo demostraron puntualidad, solidaridad y  unión entres las compañeras.
	La  Sra. Angela A. es una de las integrantes de la ciudad de Yryvukua, del Barrio centro tiene 60 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Osvaldo  con 68 años de edad, Actualmente tiene 8 Hijos, todos  mayores de edad.
 
       Posee una despensa en su domicilio, señora muy trabajadora.

             La Sra. con este crédito está pensando comprar más mercaderías como fideos, arroz, azúcar, panificados para la venta y así tener mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
The Asucena committee was formed by a union of various neighbors in the city of Yrkvukua.

All of the members of the committee have developed independent jobs; some are vendors, others prepare fast food, others raise animals, etc. The members form a very united group and are able to carry out joint activities to improve their partnership.

This committee is in their third loan cycle and all have shown themselves to be punctual and show solidarity and unity between members.

Angela A. is one of the members from the city of Yryvukua, from the central neighborhood. She is 60 years old and married to Mr. Osvaldo who is 68 years old. They have eight children, all grown.

She runs a store out of her home and is a very hardworking woman.

With this loan Angela is thinking about buying more products like noodles, rice, sugar, and baked goods to sell and make more income.

loans.use: Buying noodles, sugar, rice, baked goods, and other products

loans.name: Balemayadjourou Group

texts.fr:
Balemayadjourou est un regroupement de quatre femmes de l’ex arrondissement de Kimparana, préfecture de San, qui ont en moyenne 43 ans,  sont mariées et mères d’au moins 6 enfants.  
Elles  font la vente de poisson frais, de la restauration et l’achat vente de  diverses marchandises. 
Le groupe a intégré le programme de  crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis cinq ans. Il est à son huitième  prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les sept précédents. 
Djeneba D. est la restauratrice du groupe qui est installée  au bord du goudron passant devant la gendarmerie. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 sacs de farine de blé, 5 bidons d’huile de 20 litres et 25000 FCFA de condiments alimentaires pour la préparation de son beignet. 
Elle espère sur un  bénéfice de 49.000FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Balemayadjourou is a group of four women from the borough surrounding Kimparana in the San prefecture. On average they are 43 years old, married, and have at least six children.

They sell fresh fish and prepared foods and buy and sell diverse products. The group joined Soro Yiriwaso's loan program five years ago. They are on their eighth group loan, having fully repaid the other seven.

Djeneba D. is the restaurant operator of the group whose business is located on the edge of the paved road running in front of the police station. She plans to use her loan to buy ten bags of wheat flour, five 20-liter cans of oil, and 25,000 FCFA's worth of condiments for the preparation of her fritters.

She hopes to make a monthly profit of 49,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan and meet family needs.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for restaurant

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima M. K. is a 38-year-old widow and a mother of four children. She has been operating a clothing business for the last 10 years and from this business she has been able to provide for the basic needs for herself and her family.

This is her second loan with KADET after successfully servicing her first loan well. She plans to use this money to purchase ladies accessories (belts, shoes, earrings). The anticipated profits will be used to re-stock her business.

She hopes to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase ladies accessories for resale

loans.name: Norng

texts.en: Norng S., 46, is married and lives with her four children in Takeo province. She works as a farmer and raises cows, making approximately US$1.50 each day and her husband works in construction. Her family is also supported by her husband’s US$4 income each day. Norng S. is asking for a loan of US$1200 to raise more cows.

loans.use: To raise cows

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene J. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 44 years old and sells fish to earn a living. Rene owns a motorcycle that he uses to go around his town and sell fish. He buys directly from fishermen and therefore can get a lower price. 

Rene wants to improve his business and increase his earnings. He has applied for a loan of 6,000 PHP from CEVI to buy more fish to sell. Rene is still paying for his motorcycle and he hopes to earn enough money to pay it off in full.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Angela Nelly

texts.es:
Angela Nelly R. R. tiene 34 años de edad Es casada vive con su esposo y junto a sus hijos en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos


Los miembros de la V.R.C. TRES DE NOVIEMBRE, Esta compuesta por 28 socios y esta a 90 minutos de  la oficina se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Angela Nelly se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en Mata de cacao y sus ventas se realizan en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño seria  mejorar la calidad de vida.

Le gusta salir de paseo.
texts.en: Angela Nelly R. R. is 34. She is married and lives with her husband and children in the Chillanes Canton, Bolivar province. She has 4 children. The V.R.C. Tres de Noviembre group has 28 members and is 90 minutes from the office, within the limits of the Chillanes Canton. This region is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour; the sowing of rice, bananas, corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. They spend a lot of time doing this work. Angela Nelly works in agriculture, sowing rice, bananas, corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. She purchases her products in Mata de Cacao and sells in the Matilde Esther Market and in Bucay. She is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of rice, bananas, corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. The support of this loan will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to improve her quality of life. She enjoys going out for walks.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma C. is from the village of Kabatangan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 33 years old. Emma is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a business venture in the services sector.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing habal-habal services (transporting more than one person by motorcycle).  Her husband is the driver for local community members. She also runs a sari-sari (retail, variety) store. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Emma is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
María, resiD. en Berlín, departamento D. Usulután, tiene 33 años D. edad, administra una tienda, ella vive con su esposo y dos hijos D. 16 años y un año D. edad, poseen casa propia. El negocio es una tienda que inicio hace 10 años, esta instalada en su propia casa, no tiene un horario fijo.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería como aceite, azúcar, jabón, entre otros, que los clientes le solicitan, con esta compra espera tener para los clientes lo necesario para los hogares, además D. contar con su preferencia.
Sus aspiraciones es que su negocio sea más rentable, con ganancias abundantes, para mejorar su sistema D. vida.
texts.en:
33 year-old María lives in her own home in Berlín, in Usulután department, with her husband and two children aged 16 and 1.  She runs a store that she set up 10 years ago.  The store is located in her home and she doesn't work regular hours.

María is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as oil, sugar, soap, etc. that her customers are requesting from her.  By making this purchase, she hopes to have available everything her customers need for their households.  She also hopes to gain their loyalty.  Maria's goals are for her business to become more profitable, to make good profits and to improve her way of life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as oil, sugar, soap, etc.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea T. lives in the village of Mialen Clarin, Miasmis Occidental. She is 44 years old, married and has one school-aged child. For the last three years, she has made a living by raising livestock and now earns about 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2010, Lea joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a loan from GDMPC and is applying for a new one, for 10,000 PHP, to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation for Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand a small livestock business

loans.name: Zhadrash Miguel

texts.es: El Sr E.  labora como gestor colector  es  casado,  tiene un  persona a su cargo,  es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, da gracia la oportunidad de  este  desembolso, para pago universitario de mi hijo, para compra de utiles,matricula y mensualiades atrasada para una mejor  superacion en el futuro y para tener un mejor ingreso en cualquier trabajo que llegue a tener.
texts.en: Sr. E. works as a collections manager.  He is married and has one dependent.  This is the first loan he has received from CEPRODEL.  He is grateful for this opportunity so that he can purchase supplies and pay the tuition and monthly fees that are overdue so that his son can succeed in the future.  This will give him the chance to earn a good income because he can get any job that he wants.

loans.use: Pay for his son's educational expenses

loans.name: Nakaggwa

texts.en:
B. Nakaggwa has owned and operated a tailoring business for seven years, and she works six days a week. She also sells medicines as an additional source of income. B. has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more cloth and materials to make school uniforms for several local schools. Her primary business challenge is seasonality.

B. is the single mother of three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. Hes goal is to improve the quality of life for herself and her children. She owns her own home in Kampala, Uganda, but the family does not have access to electricity or to piped water. Her primary monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and materials to make school uniforms for several local schools

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 27 years old and single. She runs a salon to earn a living. Her business is only one year old and she has two employees. She has really benefited from the training offered by Faulu Kenya, and has learned how to keep business records, hence improving her business. Her future dream is to build rental apartments. She has requested a loan of 30,000 Kes to buy hair chemicals and hair driers.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals and hair driers

loans.name: Maria Del Milagro

texts.es:
María tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos.  Reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial ubicado a 2 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

María se dedica desde hace 8 años a la comercialización de leche. Este tiempo que le ha servido para adquirir experiencia en el rubro, así como también tener una clientela fidelizada.  Los ingresos que percibe de la venta de la leche le sirve para solventar los gastos de su familia y darle mejor calidad de vida. María desea aumentar su mercadería con la compra de más leche que pueda vender. Por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old, married, and has five children.  She lives together with her family in Olmos district, an agricultural area with quite a lot of commercial activity which is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque department.

María has been selling milk for 8 years.  Over the years she has gained experience in her business and a loyal customer base.  She uses the income that she makes from selling milk to cover her family's expenses and provide them with a better quality of life.  María would like to increase her stock by purchasing more milk to sell.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to increase her stock of milk to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Monica  Waithira

texts.en:
Monicah has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 10 years. She is 42 years old, married to Boniface Mungai and they have six children.  

Monicah was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Monicah hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rebbecca

texts.en: Rebbecca is 28 years old.  She is married and has 4 children, 2 of them go to school.  Rebbecca sells alcohol.  She has borrowed a loan to stock more alcohol to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more alcohol to sell

loans.name: Duc Tu-1-6 Group

texts.en:
Hang is 29 years old, married, and has two children. They live in Duc Tu village.  Her husband is a truck driver. He has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). Hang sells beef in the market, which she has been doing for eight years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She previously borrowed 5,014,000 VND frlom SEDA and repaid punctually. She is the leader of a five-member loan group. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy cows to resell.
 
Phuong is 30 years old. She is a hairdresser. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her barber shop.

Van is 35 years old. She sells eggs in the market. She wants to borrow 5,014.000 VND.

Lien is 58 years old. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy bananas to sell in the market.
 
Viet is 48 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for her chickens.

loans.use: to purchase cows to resell.

loans.name: Edito

texts.en:
Edito is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines.  He is married with 3 children. 

Edito has a shop that sells bananas & coconuts.  He  had this business for 5 years.  He requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy green bananas & coconuts for copra.

Edito has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Edito hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy green bananas & coconuts for copra.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 35 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, Mary Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Jane runs a business of buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth de 50 años vive en la ciudad de Cartagena donde se dedica a la venta  de mercancías como cosméticos y fantasía, actividad con la cual ha logrado generar ingresos para su hogar, que conforma con sus 4 hijos en las edades de 22 a 30 años.  Ruth compra calzado, perfumes,  fantasías y las  distribuye entre sus clientes mediante créditos que otorga a plazos pactados. En la actualidad ha incursionado en una nueva línea de productos cosméticos y los exhibe en su vitrina, además de promocionarlos constantemente entre sus clientes reales y potenciales. Su sueño es tener su casa propia y aumentar su infraestructura hasta convertirla en un almacén ubicado en un punto de mucha movilidad comercial. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace Ruth a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará productos cosméticos que vienen por paquetes y por descuentos y que ya han sido encargados por sus clientes, de aquí a que su inversión sería exitosa porque la hace sobre pedidos que ampliarían su oferta a nuevos clientes, a los cuales quiere impactar con tal de tener una mayor cobertura.
texts.en:
Ruth is 50 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena where she sells merchandise such as cosmetics and costume jewelry.  This business activity has enabled her to make income for her household which consists of her four children aged 22 to 30.  Ruth buys footwear, perfume and costume jewelry and distributes them to her customers through a credit system.  She is repaid according to a pre-arranged schedule.  Ruth has currently started making inroads into selling a new line of cosmetics which she displays in her display cabinet and constantly promotes amongst her existing and potential customers.

Ruth's dream is to own her own home and increase her infrastructure until she has a store which is located in a very busy commercial area.  This Kiva loan is Ruth's first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy cosmetics that come in packets, on special offer.  These products have been ordered by her customers.  Her investment will be successful because she works to order.  She will be able to expand her offerings to new customers.  She would like to make an impact on these customers so that she can achieve better coverage.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics on special offer

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA ALTERNATIVA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Clotilde; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de plastiqueria y negocio de tienda de abarrotes, en el negocio de plastiqueria la socia vende baldes,tinas,pelotas entre otros productos de plásticos, y en el negocio de tienda de abarrotes la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche,fideos entre otros productos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de plastiqueria y negocio de tienda de abarrotes, por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de plastiqueria. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como baldes, pelotas y lavaderos y también para comprar arroz, azúcar y fideos al por mayor para la tienda de abarrotes.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Nueva Alternativa" communal bank, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

This borrower's name is Ms. Clotilde. She is 43 years old, in a domestic partnership, and has two children. She divides her time between her daily activities, her plastic sales business, and her grocery store business. In her plastic sales business, Clotilde sells buckets, tubs, and balls, along with other products made of plastic. In her grocery store, she sells staple goods like rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and other products.

She would like to expand her plastic sales business as well as her grocery store business. It is through these small businesses that she helps her children to get ahead. Clotilde would like to expand and improve her two businesses. She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise like buckets, balls, and washbasins, as well as to buy rice, sugar, and noodles wholesale to stock her grocery store.

Clotilde is pleased to receive this loan and promises to comply with her repayments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her plastic sales business and her grocery store

loans.name: Rosario Patria Group

texts.en:
Rosario is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business. 

Rosario is married and has two children. She is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Rosario is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

She has requested a loan for PHP 14,500 to purchase fertilizer for the corn.
 
Rosario has been a member of PMPC for five years. 

In the future, Rosario hopes to save money for their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the corn.

loans.name: Assimiou

texts.fr:
Assimiou est un homme âgé de 25 ans. Il est célibataire sans enfant  
Assimiou travaille comme revendeur depuis 2010. Il achète et revend des articles electroniques pour ses clients dans sa boutique. Il travaille seule dans sa boutique. 
Assimiou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des articles electroniques et des portables pour revendre. Il veut agrandir son commerce. 
Dans les prochaines années, Assimiou voudrait investir dans l’activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Assimou is a 25-year old man. He is single without children. Assimou has been working as vendor since 2010. He buys electronics and retails them in his store. He works by himself.

Assimou has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy electronics and cellular phones for resale. He would like to expand his business. In the next few years, Assimou would like to keep investing in his business. He says that, with the income from his business, he  hopes to  be able to have a happy family one day.

loans.use: to buy electronics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Melvie

texts.en:
Melvie is married with 1 child. She is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Melvie is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. She has requested a loan of 30,000 to purchase fertilizer for the rice. 
Melvie has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Melvie hopes to save money for the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for rice

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es:
Don Cesar sigue ofreciendo sus ricas fritanga, que hace cada dia , el cual junto  a su esposa dan el servicio a sus clientes.
Gracias a los financiamiento se han logrado las mejoras a su local, siendo de gran atracion e higiene en su negocio. Lo que quiere hacer es la construcin de baño de dama y caballero en el local del negocio, siendo de gran pioridad, ya que la mas veces ha prestado el personal. 
Y que siendo de gran necesidad para sus clientes hara la compra de lavamanos, inodoro, urinaR., puertas, bloques y comenzar la construccion. El cual prestara las condiciones de servicios de un comedor.
texts.en:
Cesar has a "fritanga" business (selling fried foods) that he works at every day.  His wife works with him, providing service to their customers.  Thanks to the loans that he has obtained, he has been able to make some improvements to his place of business, making it more attractive and hygienic.  What he wants to do now is to add a men's and women's bathroom to his eatery.  This is his first priority, since at times he has to lend customers his personal bathroom.  

To provide this necessity for his customers, he will buy sinks, toilets, urinals, doors, and cement blocks to begin the construction.  In this way he will able to provide the services of a restaurant.

loans.use: to build a men's and women's bathroom in his place of business to provide better service to his customers by satisfying this need

loans.name: Kev's Group

texts.en:
Kev is the leader of this group with three members. She is a 68-year-old single woman who lives in Kompong Chhnang province. 

Kev is a rice cultivator.  She also owns a store and earns a living by selling bananas that are bought from the local area. From this business, she can earn around US$2 daily. 

Kev is requesting a loan from Kiva in order to to purchase mineral fertilizers to spread on her farmlands. With the rest of the funds, she’ll use it to buy additional bananas for selling. In the future,  Kev hopes to run her business smoothly and maximize profit.

loans.use: buy fertilizers for her farm and bananas to resell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Nancy.  She is married and has three children, aged 23, 18 and 14. In 1998, Nancy established her cosmetics, suitcase, Coleman and DVD laptop business. She began her business because wanted to enhance her independence and be able to provide a livelihood for her family. Working six days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about 1,200,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Nancy requires a loan in order to buy more cosmetics, suitcases and DVD laptops for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Nancy plans to build a house and educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, suitcases and DVDs.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 45 years old and lives in Talairon, Oroquieta City. She is married with 3 children. Dinah has a sari-sari store business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Dinah has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to earn money because she wants to have a grocery store. She is a MIGS (member in good standing) member of PMPC. She has a happy family with five children.  She is an honest person and God fearing.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (sisters). 

Eva has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for one year and she works 7 days a week. Eva sells her products from home by means of retail.

Eva has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  She also generates additional income through rental houses. The main business challenges for Eva include transportation and seasonality.

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build more rental rooms, to own a delivery van and also to sell on a wholesale basis. Eva lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is a widow with six children. She is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Leonarda is a farmer and she produces corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years and every month she earn PHP 3,000 from this work. 

Leonarda has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Leonarda hopes to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Paul Agusto

texts.es:
Paul tiene 27 años edad y es soltero, él nació en la ciudad de Gamitana y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él se dedica a la venta de agricultura donde cultiva diferentes productos como yuca, maíz, arroz y otras cosas, él también se dedica a la compra y venta de madera. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

Paul en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para pagar el transporte de madera .

Paul es integrante del grupo “Nuevo Amanecer de Gamitana” lo conforman 16 socios que viven en el Comunidad de Gamitana en la selva del Perú.
texts.en:
Paul is 27 years old and single. He was born in the city of Gamitana and still lives there. Paul sells different farm-raised products such as cassava, corn, rice, and other products. He also buys and sells wood. Paul has been in this business for many years and has done very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. He is taking this opportunity to request a loan to pay for the transport of wood.

Paul is a member of the group “Nuevo Amanecer de Gamitana” (New Dawn of Gamitana) which consists of 16 members who live in the community of Gamitana in the Peruvian jungle.

loans.use: to pay for the transport of wood.

location.town: Gamitana - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Josef

texts.en:
Josef lives in the village of Boriti, West Georgia, with his family: his wife Maya, 26 years old, his son, and his 72-year- old mother. 

Josef works as a night-watchman and at the same time he runs a family agricultural business. He owns two milk cows and a pig. The family sells on average 30 kg of cheese per month and 10 piglets on the local market. Also, the family grows various vegetables on a family-owned 0.8 hectare plot of land. Total average income of the family is 900 Laris per month. 

Josef requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. The family will get more milk for cheese production. Sales of cheese will go up and the income of the family will increase by approximately 10%. It will allow the family to increase spending for satisfying their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Nyairo

texts.en: Nyairo is a married man. He has 7 children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a farm where he keeps sheep and also grows crops. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a fertile area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy seeds for planting. His business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Petar S. is 51 years old. He has high school education and 29-year practice in the agricultural cooperative in the village of Aidemir as a driver and auto-crane driver. He is married and has a son. At the moment he and his wife are retired with pensions of 130 leva for him and 80 leva for her. At the beginning of this year he set up a company, rented premises and started retail trade with tools, bolts, nuts and others. Two people work in the company – the owner and a shop assistant. The location of the shop is suitable for such type of activity and the turnover of the shop is good for the months that it has worked.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary Wanjuhi Wainaina intends to purchase five pigs

loans.name: Jossefa

texts.en:
Jossefa M., was born in 1950 in Catembe, Maputo Province. His father was a cook and his mother a teacher. Jossefa studied until the 3rd grade. Because Jossefa lost his parents at a young age, he started working as an assistant painter at the age of 17. He became a painter and worked for the Portuguese, who left Mozambique in 1974. After they left Jossefa used his savings to buy a boat, and started his fishing activities using a fishing rod. With his gains, Joseffa was able to buy fishing nets, and hire 9 workers with whom he worked with until the 2000 flood. Because of the flood Joseffa lost his nets and had to lay off the workers.

With government help he returned to fishing, with great difficultym, which led him to borrow from HLUVUKU in order to buy nets. He has taken 4 loans with which he has bought a boat and the engine. At this time Jossefa has 2 boats and 2 engines. He rents the second boat to friends. He has hired 6 full time workers and 2 part time helpers. He cares for 12 family members, including his children and grandchildren.

With the loan of 21.000,00MT Joseffa will buy new fishing nets, and maintain the engine and boats. Joseffa’s work has a great impact in his community because it creates jobs and provides fish, and other seafood products for the markets of the city of Maputo. In the future Joseffa plans on purchasing a bigger boat and more sophisticated nets, which will allow him to increase his income and create more jobs.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Guachene - Catembe Actividade: Pesca Valor Financiado: 21.000,00MT (840.00US$) Aplicação do montante: Compra de redes de Pesca Início: 09/05/2007 Fim: 30/04/2008 Jossefa M., nascido em 1950 na Catembe, Província de Maputo, Filho de Pai Cozinheiro e Mãe Professora estudou até 3ª Classe. Por ter perdido os seus pais cedo, aos dezassete anos começou a trabalhar como ajudante de pintor onde se tornou mestre e trabalhou para patrões Portugueses, os quais deixam Moçambique em 1974, facto que levou-o a usar o valor acumulado para compra de um barco, iniciando assim a actividade de pesca por anzóis. Com o rendimento conseguiu comprar redes e contratou 9 trabalhadores com os quais trabalhou até ao período das cheias de 2000 onde perdeu redes e teve que dispensa-los . Com ajuda do governo reactivou a sua actividade mas com ligeiras dificuldades o que–lhe levou a recorreu ao empréstimo na HLUVUKU para reforçar as redes e reparar o motor do barco. Conta com quatro empréstimos através dos quais conseguiu comprar o segundo barco e um motor. Neste momento conta com 2 barcos e 2 motores e que um dos barcos aluga aos amigos, emprega 6 trabalhadores efectivos e 5 eventuais, cuida de 12 pessoas entre filhos e netos. Com o empréstimo de 21.000,00MT pretende comprar novas redes de pesca e fazer a manutenção do motor de barco para melhor desenvolver a sua actividade. A sua actividade tem um impacto muito positivo na comunidade pois para alem de criar muitos postos de trabalho abastece o mercado local e cidade de Maputo com diversos mariscos. No futuro pretende adquirir um barco maior e redes sofisticadas o que lhe permitirá ter maior rendimento e criação de postos de trabalho na zona.

loans.use: To buy nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margrate would like to buy a high-breed dairy cow

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther I. is a farmer has farm land in which she plants and produces cassava, maize, and cocoyam. She is a married mother of eight children. She is a native of Ubiaja and has been in this business for over seven years. She has been a LAPO member for over four years. Esther is requesting a loan of US $625 and with that money, she intends to buy maize, cassava stems, and farm land.

loans.use: To buy more maize, cassava stem and farm land

loans.name: Sumina

texts.en:
Mrs. Sumina S. is a 25 year old woman who lives in a single family home in Tangal, Lalitpur. Tangal is one of the busy bazaars of Lalitpur. She has four members in her family including herself. Her husband is Krishna S.. He crafts different idols of gods and goddess. Her son is studying in grade 7 and her daughter is in primary school.

Mrs. S. sells different types of flowers in her shop. In Nepal, November is the month of festival. The Nepalese celebrate Dashain and Tihar in this month. On these occasions people buy many different kinds of flowers to offer to the gods and goddesses. In this month the demand for flowers is very high. She seeks a loan to buy different varities of flowers. She wishes to spend what she earns to provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: To buy varities of flowers

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is a hard-working entrepreneur with a small business selling household products in the center of her little village near Nicopol, Ukraine. Lubov carries a broad assortment of products and offers convenient, quality service to her customers. She has no significant, direct competition from other vendors that helps to ensure good sales demand and a steady income. Lubov is married to her husband, Nicolai, and together have two children. One of Lubov’s goals for her business is to increase her family’s income.

Lubov has requested a loan of $1200 to help purchase new inventory to sell. She has a good credit history with Nadiya Ukraine and we are glad for another opportunity to assist her with her business enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Client history: Rosa works in a printing shop where she binds books. She is separated from her husband and has one child that she takes care of. Her house is located in the area of Alto Villa San Antonio in the Forno sector of La Paz

It is the first time that she is soliciting credit. The amount she is asking for is for her to be able to take out two special lease agreements used in Bolivia and with that be able to better their quality of life. Her work history allows her to obtain this credit since she has been an employed for more than 10 years. A financial analysis shows that her income is sufficient to cover the loan.

Traslated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

Historia del Cliente: la señora Rosa trabaja en una imprenta donde realiza el compaginado de libros, está separada de su esposo y tiene un hijo a su cargo. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Alto Villa San Antonio Sector Forno de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para que pueda tomar dos piezas en calidad de Anticretico y así poder mejorar su calidad de Vida. Sus antecedentes de trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que es una empleada con una antigüedad de más de 10 años. El análisis financiero muestra ingresos suficientes para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Take out leases for two living quarters to improve the comfort of her daughter and herself.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience E., from Edo State, Nigeria, is 58 years old and married with 5 children.  She has been in the business of selling palm oil and making soap  since 1994. She needs the loan amount of $950 to buy more oil for sale.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil for sale

loans.name: Peoy

texts.en: Mrs. Peoy C., 30, is a mother of two children and sells groceries in front of her house. She makes approximately $2.50 a day of profit. Her husband works raising pigs, chickens and ducks and sells them in the market when they grow up and earns around $3 a day. To grow the  business this couple would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase grocery products, more pigs and chickens to breed.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products, pigs, and chickens to breed.

loans.name: Akouvi Délali

texts.fr:
Born on June 24, 1970 in Woamé (a town situated 135 kilometers from Lomé), Mrs. Akouvi Délali, wife of A. E. S., has four children who are all enrolled in school. After having been in the cereals business around 1994, she began to sell lengths of African print cloth and boubous (traditional African clothing) in 2005 in the Hédzranawoé market in Lomé. Ever since she took up this business venture, she has been able to help her husband pay their children's school fees.

The loan that she is presently requesting, her first, will permit her to purchase 10 lengths of GTP African print cloth (a mid-quality brand) so that she can diversify her inventory of various prints.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née le 24 juin 1970 à Woamé (localité située à 135 Km de Lomé), Madame A. Epouse S. Akouvi Délali a quatre (4) enfants qui fréquentent tous. Après avoir exercé le commerce de vente de céréales dans les années 94, elle a débuté le commerce de pagne et de boubou en 2005 dans le marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Depuis qu’elle a démarré cette activité, elle a toujours aidé son mari dans les dépenses scolaires de leurs enfants.

Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter dix (10) pièces de pagne de type GTP (qualité intermédiaire de pagne) en vue de diversifier les variétés de pagne dans son stock.

loans.use:
Purchase of GTP African prints, a good quality type of cloth

Achat de pagne GTP, un type de pagne de bonne qualité

loans.name: Lun

texts.en: Mrs. Lun O. is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Chheourn Thou, is also a farmer. They have four children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is studying in state school. All the business activities in Mrs. Lun O.’s family still do not provide enough money to build a new house in order to replace their old house. Thus, Mrs. Lun O. has decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Last year, Mrs. Lun O. was ill and the family spent $100 to cure her. In the photo, you will see some timber and house construction workers. Mrs. Lun O.’s husband is presented in the picture.

loans.use: To build a new house in order to replace their old house.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa, a mother that is humble at heart as well as economically, was born in the city of Ayaviri but has lived in the city of Juliaca for the past two years. Since she formed her home, she has focused completely on her family as well as on the small grocery store that she installed in her home. Thanks to much effort and devotion, she has been able to implement her enterprise. Now that her little store is frequented often by her neighbors, she wishes to finish improvements to it and meet her customers’ needs. With this project in mind, and your generous support, she will be able to meet her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Luisa, es una madre humilde de corazón y de recursos económicos, es natural de la ciudad de Ayaviri y desde hace 2 años radica en la ciudad de Juliaca. Desde que formó su hogar se consagró completamente a su familia y a la pequeña bodeguita de abarrotes que adecuó en su domicilio y gracias a su esfuerzo y entrega poco a poco ha ido implementando.Ahora que su tiendita esta siendo muy visitada por sus vecinos desea terminar de implementarlo y satisfacer cada una de sus peticiones, con ese proyecto en mente y vuestro generoso apoyo espera cumplir sus objetivos.

loans.use: Increase of capital to expand her products.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun V., 38, lives in Kampong Cham and sells Khmer noodles in the local market for around US $2 each day. Her husband, Heng Pao Srang, works in construction and typically makes US $2.60 each day. They have five children and one of them works in the local garment factory, providing US $40 each month to support the family.

Oun V. has asked for a loan of US $700 to aid in her husband’s business. He is struggling to provide enough materials to complete his construction projects and needs to purchase some paint, steel, and wood. The family believes that this investment will increase its income and provide an improved standard of living.

Oun V. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband, Heng Pao Srang, is pictured above.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to finish construction projects

loans.name: Sokvun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokvun V., 21, and her husband, Mr. Nak Nheb, married in 2003 and have two sons. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Since she was thirteen years old, Sokvun V. has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a mason for three years. He does his work in their village and nearby villages. Sokvun V. is requesting a loan of US$ 100 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Pedro José

texts.es:
Con mucho esfuerzo el señor Pedro A. desde hace 18 años se dedica a la actividad económica de reparación de zapatos teniendo su establecimiento en las afueras del mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua.

Este caballero se esfuerza día a día y a pesar de las difíciles situaciones económicas que ha atravesado ha logrado llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación para beneficiar a sus pequeños hijos. Hoy en día solicita un crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de adquirir su materia prima para la reparación de los zapatos y así continuar manteniendo su humilde hogar de habitación.
texts.en:
With considerable effort Mr. Pedro A. has worked in shoe repair for 18 years. His establishment is in the open-air market Israel Lewites in Managua. This gentleman struggles day by day, and despite the difficult economic situations that have occurred, he has managed to provide a livelihood to his home for the benefit of his young children. Today he is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL with the goal of acquiring the raw materials for repairing shoes, and as such continue maintaining his humble home.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to repair shoes.

loans.name: Ilkhama

texts.en: Ilkhama was born in 1986. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Djabrail region in Azerbaijan, settled in Khirdalan town. She has been in the clothing sales business for two years. Now she requests a loan of $1200 to buy clothes and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: Manzura’s business is selling women’s and kids’ clothes. She has done it for several years and by now she knows this business very well. She knows what to buy and when to sell. She has 1 kid. Her husband is a simple worker. She wants to borrow money for purchasing more goods to sell and thus make more profit. With that profit she can provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: Purchasing more goods

loans.name: Juan Rodolfo

texts.es: El señor Juan es una persona joven de edad pero con grandes ambiciones de salir adelante, el es trailero y desde muy chico ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y trabajadora, el ahora por medio de este credito quiere acabar con el proyecto de la colocación del vitro piso de su casa al igual con otros acabados interiores y asi lograr tener un hogar mas cómodo.
texts.en:
Señor Juan is still a young man but with big plans for the future. He’s a truck driver, and ever since he was a boy he has shown himself to be responsible and hard working. He now wants to use his loan to finish a project putting Vitro flooring in his house as well as completing other interior work so that he will have more comfortable home.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Complete interior work on his home

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. is married and has 5 dependants. She has received no formal education. Esther sells food items like beans, maize, and gari at Abrobeano near Elmina, which she has done since 2007. Her husband is a trader. Esther uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Esther will use the loan to use as additional capital to buy more foodstuff for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esther plans to support her children's education.

loans.use: Esther will use the loan as additional capital to buy more foodstuff for resale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia T. is forty-three years old. She is a married woman and the mother of four daughters. She says one of her daughters is already working; one has just completed senior high school and is waiting for her results. The rest are in senior and junior high schools. 

Cecilia and her family live in Somanya in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Somanya is a native town of a tribe in Ghana called the ‘Krobos’. Though people of other tribes have migrated there as a result of their occupations, the Krobos dominate the land. 

Cecilia sells "gari" in nearby markets. "Gari" is a local delicacy produced from cassava. The peeled cassava is milled, squeezed of the water content and fried in a hot metal pan over a hot fire. Cecilia does not produce the "gari" herself, but procures from wholesalers in big markets. She desires to buy "gari" in bags and trek to other markets to distribute it.

loans.use: To procure ‘gari’ in bulk for distribution

loans.name: Aura Elena

texts.es: Doña Aura tiene 48 años de edad, reside en Villa libertad,  con cuatro hijos de 2, 5,16 y 20 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de ropa y cosméticos al crédito como al contado, que inicio desde hace dieciocho años, con dinero propio y ayuda de su esposo, con la solicitud va invertir en compra ropa escolar como útiles escolares y cosméticos esta es su sexta solicitud que ha sido de muchos beneficios para su negocio como en su vida personal, con esto espera lograr mejorar las ventas como captar clientes. ya que la venta de uniformes es la prioridad de los estudiantes,  sus planes a corto plazo es invertir mas.
texts.en:
Aura is 48 years old, and she lives in Villa Libertad with her four children, ages 2, 5, 16 and 20. She is in the business of selling clothes and cosmetics on credit as well as for direct payment. She started her business eighteen years ago with her own money and help from her husband. With the loan she will invest in school clothes, school supplies and cosmetics. This is her sixth request. Her previous requests have greatly benefited her business as well as her personal life. With this loan she hopes to improve sales and gain more customers. Buying uniforms is a priority for students, so her short term plans are to invest more in them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and cosmetic products

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en: Henrietta is 29 years old and single. She lives in Asaba, Delta state, Nigeria. She sells clothes and shoes. She is hoping to make a loan for N80, 000 to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. She says thanks to kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
La socia ALBERTINA; Tiene 43 años de edad y es casada, tiene 3 hijos (27,25, 23)años de edad, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco en el cercado.

La socia ayuda a sus hijos con sus estudios superiores y alterna sus actividades del hogar a la administración y a la cocina en su restaurante, ella necesita el préstamo para comprar más muebles e insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas, la socia educa  a sus hijos con este oficio.

Nuestra socia esta muy agradecida y valora el préstamo que le otorgan mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su préstamo y nuevamente agradece a ustedes.
texts.en:
Our member ALBERTINA is 43 years old, married with 3 children ages 27,25, and 23. She lives within the city limits of Cuzco.

Albertina helps her children with their advanced studies, and alternates her homemaking activities with managing and cooking for her restaurant. She needs a loan to buy more furniture and ingredients used to prepare her dishes. Albertina supports her children’s education with this occupation.

Our member is very grateful and appreciative of the loan granted to her through this means, and therefore, commits to repaying the full loan amount. She thanks you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Claudio Cambon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in her restaurant

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la calle Mario Mercado de la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz; dentro de la casa tienen un taller de cerrajería donde trabaja ella con su esposo elaborando jaladores y mesas centrales de fierro, que una vez terminadas, la esposa acomoda en diferentes ferreterías y mueblerías de la ciudad.

El crédito que solicitan es para compra de materia prima ( fierro) para seguir con esta actividad que es su principal fuente de ingresos.


Martha es clienta antiguo de Impro y por la actividad califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Martha lives in her own home with her husband and children on Mario Mercado Street in the Llojeta zone in the city of La Paz. They have a metal shop in their home. She works with her husband making door handles and iron tables. Once they have finished making these items, her husband takes them to various hardware and furniture stores in the city. The loan is to buy raw material (iron) to continue this work which is their principal source of income. Martha is a long time customer of Impro, and her business activity qualifies her to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy iron for her business of making door handles and iron tables.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Abdoulaye  Berthé a 40 ans, marié et père de cinq enfants dont 3 garçons et 2 filles. Il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants au quartier Médine de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  Berthé  est un mécanicien de profession et travaille au garage de Compagnie Malienne de Développement Textile (C.M.D.T.) de Sikasso. En plus de cette activité, il mène  des activités d’embouche, de commercialisation de bétails et d’aviculture il y a environ six an. 
Dans le souci de mieux  satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante tout en augmentant son fonds de roulement  et  aménager son lieu d’embouche, il décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.  Il est à son premier prêt individuel 
Il compte acheter du bétail dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso (Lobougoula, Kadiolo, Bougouni, etc.).. Il revend ses animaux et dérivés au marché à bétail et à la maison à une clientèle riche et variée. 
Monsieur Berthé gagne beaucoup en laiterie grâce à ses vaches de meilleure qualité.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye Berthé, age 40, is married and the father of five children (3 boys and 2 girls). He resides with his wife and their children in the Médine district of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He is a mechanic by trade and works at the garage of the Compagnie Malienne de Développement Textile (C.M.D.T.) de Sikasso. In addition to this work, he has had a business for about six years involving animal feed, marketing livestock, and poultry farming.

Concerned about doing better in satisfying his burgeoning customer base while augmenting his working capital and fixing up his place for fattening livestock, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his first individual loan. He intends to buy livestock in towns surrounding Sikasso (Lobougoula, Kadiolo, Bougouni, etc.) He resells his animals and resulting products at the livestock marketplace and at the house to a rich and varied clientele.

Mr. Berthé earns a lot from his dairy business, thanks to his better quality cows. With this loan, he envisions realizing a monthly profit of 300,000 francs CFA that will be used to augment his working capital, to help cover family expenses, to make loan interest payments, and to invest the rest in his work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Von's Group

texts.en:
This loan will go to a group of three women who live in Siem Reap Provence, Cambodia. Mrs. Von S., who is 23 years old, has been chosen as group leader by the other members. She earns a living growng many kinds of crops on her farm in the village. She learned farming from her grandparents, and has worked in this business for many years. Her husband, Mr. Koun, 25, works in construction. The young couple has been married for years and plans to have a child next year. Von S. is applying for this loan to buy a used motorbike to make it easier to meet the family's transportation needs. 

The other two borrowers are Naing N., a local farmer, who needs to buy fertilizer to grow her crops, and Kao S., who makes a living growing vegetables and wants to buy a used motorbike to help meet her family's transportation needs.

loans.use: To buy two used motorbikes and fertilizer

loans.name: Julia Del Carmen

texts.es: Julia del Carmen C. tiene 43 años de edad, ella ha sido una madre soltera,  ya que hay hombres que no cumplen con sus responsabilidades, ella ha podido sacar adelante a sus cuatro hijos de los que 3 ya están preparados y viven por su propia cuenta y 1 menor aun esta bajo su cuidado, al que también lo llena de amor y le provee su alimentación y educación, ella inicia su negocio cuando su esposo la abandono, pues para ese entonces ella no trabajaba por que acababa de dar a luz, aun asi en medio de todo esto Julia dice que Dios le dio la sabiduría para emprender un negocio que le ayudara en la manutención de sus 4 hijos, aunque al principio estuvo trabajando en las huertas, consiguió juntar dinero y empezó a comprar cerdos para criarlos y luego destazarlos y vender la carne, hoy en día Julia tiene también tiene una pulpería, y su estabilidad familiar y económica ha mejorado mucho, ella requiere de un financiamiento que le permita comprar mas productos para su pulpería y comida para sus cerdos, acude a Fundación León 2000 porque esta institución ha sido de beneficio a ella con otros financiamientos que se le han otorgado, el sueño mas grande que ella tiene es lograr establecer una abarrotería muy surtida.
texts.en:
Julia del Carmen C. is a 43-year-old single mom dealing with men in her life who don’t meet their responsibilities. Despite this, she has been able to raise her four children. Now, three of her four children are living on their own, and the youngest one is still under her loving care as she provides him with food and education. She started her business when her husband left her. At that time she wasn’t working because she had just given birth. Even then, in the middle of all of this, Julia says that God gave her the wisdom to start a business that would help her raise her four children.


Although she began gardening, she put enough money together to buy and raise pigs, slaughter them and sell the meat. Today, Julia has a general store. Her family situation and her financial stability have greatly improved. She needs a loan that will allow her to buy more products for her general store and food for her pigs. She turns to Fundación León 2000, because this institution has been beneficial to her by granting her other loans. Her biggest dream is to be able to set up a well-stocked general store.


Translated from Spanish by Lee Bruner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for general store and food for her pigs.

loans.name: Guerreros Para Cristo 1 Group

texts.en:
Irene L. and the other members of this group live on Batey 18. This is a small settlement inhabited mainly by the families of the sugar cane field workers. The houses in this community belong to the sugar cane company. Because the wages are extremely low, and during the off-season there is no other income for the batey, a lot of people, especially women, become self-employed.
 
Irene is illiterate. This makes her access to formal employment almost null. She is married to Lisua Rene. They have 4 children, out of whom 2 live with them still. Irene has a small candy stand. She explains it's difficult to do business in her community because a lot of people sell the same things. She sometimes goes to sell on the streets of nearby communities to sell her merchandise. The other challenge she faces is the size of her community. Batey 18 has only 3 streets. 

Irene would like to continue investing in her business and saving towards a future expansion (hopefully outside of her batey). She hopes her hard work allows her to buy a house for her retirement.

loans.use: To purchase candy and snacks to sell.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is 40 years old and is married and has four children. Currently all her children are in school in the community where they live.

Felicia owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits (cookies), etc. in her neighborhood at Sefwi Bekwai, a suburb of Sefwi. She buys her stock of goods from the Kumasi central market. She is requesting the loan to upgrade her inventory.

With the loan, Felicia wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school. She believes that with her two years experience, she will be able to make good use of the loan for that purpose.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products like cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, etc.

loans.name: Guadalupe Haydee

texts.es: Guadalupe Haydee G. L. D. S. resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango departamento San Salvador. Guadalupe tiene  54 años D. edad, vive solamente con una hija. La Sra. Guadalupe  tiene un negocio ubicado en su casa es una tienda llamada ‘‘Tienda Haydee’’ venD. productos D. consumo como aceite, gaseosas, sopas entre otros; a pesar que solo lleva tres años desD. que puso su negocio ya posee una clientela estable, la tienda D. Guadalupe ha ido creciendo poco a poco ella pone mucho esmero en su negocio ya que es el único sustento para ella y su hija , ahora Guadalupe solicita un crédito para surtir su tienda así seguir creciendo y mejorando sus ingresos a través D. sus ventas.
texts.en:
Guadalupe Haydee G. L. D. S. lives in the city of Soyapango in the department of San Salvador. Guadalupe is 54 years old and lives alone with her daughter. Ms. Guadalupe runs a store in her home called "Haydee's Store" which sells consumables like oil, soda, and soup among others.

Although she has only had the store for three years she already has an established customer base. Guadalupe's store has grown little by little. She puts a lot of dedication into her business, which is the only source of income for herself and her daughter.

Guadalupe is asking for a loan in order to stock her store as it continues to her grow, to increase her profit through increased sales.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking her store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn O. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 44 years old. Evelyn is separated and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase construction materials to improve the borrower's house. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Evelyn from PMPC. She plans to have comfortable and presentable shelter to live. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house repair

loans.name: Mbathio

texts.fr: Mbathio D. est une vendeuse de chaussures de tissus et autre articles pour femmes. Elle  fait ce métier depuis plus de cinq (5) années.les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent d’aider son mari dans l’entretien du ménage. Avec le prêt qu’elle sollicité elle compte renforcer son activité  par l’achat de plus de marchandise en vu de préparer les fêtes de korité. Elle a démarré son commerce avec un premier prêt obtenu de L’U IMCEC.

loans.use: achat de marchandises

loans.name: Maria Marcelina

texts.es: La señor Marcelina es originaria de la comunidad de poxlajuj  ella es casada  con 55 años de edad su principal fuente de ingreso de ella como el de su esposo  es la sastreria y la carpinteria ya que los negocios esta ha nombre de ellos  hoy necesita de un credito para surtir su mercaderia ya que se aproximan ya las fiestas de fin de año el credito sera invertido para la compra de madera y tela ya que los hijos ya esta for finalizar el ciclo escolar dos mil nueve y en la epoca de vacaciones aprovechar el tiempo de poder ayudar ha la familia en aumentar su produccion.

loans.use: Ampliacion de Capital

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
Noeme is 29 years old, married and not yet blessed with a child. She is engaged in the sari-sari store business (community based store) for four years. Her goal is to expand her business to have extra income to help his husband.

She would like her business tog grow so she is asking to avail a loan of PHP5,000.  The loan will be used to purchase different commodities for her store to meet the demands of her customers.  She hopes that the lenders will grant her loan request.

loans.use: To buy more stocks

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice O. is married and has two children, one girl and one  boy. She first heard of Kiva from K-MET Community Health Workers during one of their mobilization and community service meetings. She immediately became interested and decided to become a member. 

Beatrice makes a living selling second-hand clothes in Nyalenda, Kisumu, Kenya. She started this business in 2000 and has never regretted the day she decided to do more than be a housewife. Beatrice has applied for a loan to restock and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira tiene 50 años, está casada con el padre D. sus 4 hijos, D. los cuales 2 D. ellos viven en su casa.

DesD. muy joven ha tejido a telar mantas y frazadas, y últimamente se ha dedicado al tejido D. telas especiales para mochilas y bolsos, como el que nos muestra en la foto.
Para cada tejido trata D. armonizar los colores, D. acuerdo al gusto D. sus clientes, ya que gracias a su preferencia los tejidos jamás se quedan mucho tiempo con ella y eso la llena D. mucha alegría. 
Por el momento, está un poco triste porque sus pies le duelen debido al frio excesivo que absorbe mientras teje, ya que su pueblo está en una zona muy fría, pero igual trabaja arduamente con su esposo, pues se han propuesto tener el dinero para brindarles a sus hijos estudios profesionales.

Este es su noveno crédito con MFP y en todo este tiempo (4 años) viene liderando su banco comunal como la presidenta D. la junta directiva. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. insumos para sus tejidos D. artesanías.
texts.en:
Elvira is 50 years old, and is married to the father of her four children, two of whom still live at home with her. Since she was very young she has used a loom to weave blankets and cloaks, and ultimately has found work weaving speciality fabrics for backpacks and purses, like those shown in the photo. For each fabric, she tries to harmonize the colors according to the tastes of her clients. However, thanks to her preferences it doesn't take much time for the fabrics to be sold and this makes her very happy. For the moment, she is a little sad because her feet hurt because of the excessive cold that they absorb while she weaves. Her town is in a zone that is very cold, but she works equally as hard as her husband, and they have therefore been able to put forward the money to be able to offer their children professional studies. This is her ninth loan with MFP, an affiliate of Kiva, and after all this time (4 years), she has come to lead her communal bank as the president of the board of directors. The money that she is requesting now will be invested in the purchase of supplies for her artisan weavings.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz D. is from the village of Lower Dicayas. She is 61 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Beatriz owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Beatriz joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Beatriz is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional construction materials for house repair. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She wants to improve the house she lives in. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for house repair

loans.name: Lakulo

texts.en:
Lakulo L. is currently in the business of selling beans, groundnuts, and tomatoes in the market. She is requesting a loan to buy groundnuts that she can use to make paste to sell.

Lukulo is 32 years old and is married. Her husband is an engineer. She has two children and her children go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a retail shop.

About BRAC

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members

loans.use: To buy groundnuts to use to make paste to sell.

loans.name: Fanny Rosmery

texts.es:
Fanny tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus cuatro hijos de 13, 10, 8 y 6 años de edad en casa de su madre, ubicada en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 15 años se dedica a vender agua a diversos pobladores de las zonas alejadas del distrito que no cuentan con este servicio básico. El agua la extrae de un pozo hecho por sus abuelos en la casa donde reside. Ella la vende a un precio cómodo y las personas siempre recurren a ella, e incluso cuando se corta el suministro de agua en el distrito sus  vecinos acuden a su domicilio a solicitar el agua que necesitan.

Por otro lado también se gana la vida haciendo limpieza en algunas Instituciones de la zona, durante el dia divide su tiempo y visita a los locales e incluso casas que previamente han solicitado sus servicios. Estos dos ingresos son la única fuente de ingreso con la que su familia se sostiene.

Fanny ya ha trabajado con el fondo Kiva y esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas que la apoyaron. Durante los últimos meses ha estado ahorrando dinero y ha empezado a realizar uno de sus sueños: construir su casa. Las obras ya han empezado pero necesita completar el dinero para terminar de construir el techo de una habitación. Por ello se encuentra solicitando nuevamente a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 300 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Fanny, 35, is a single mother of 4 children, who are 13, 10, 8, and 6 years old, respectively. They live inFanny's mother's house, which is located in Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, which is located 3 hours away from the city of Chiclayo. For the past 15 years she has sold water to residents of isolated communities in the district that lack this basic service. She extracts the water from a well that her grandparetns dug on the property where she lives. She sells at a reasonable price and people always come to her. In fact, even when water supplies are cut in her district, neighbors come to her home to request water. She also earns income by providing cleaning services to some institutions in the area. During the day, she divides her time between these locations and even some private homes that have requested her services. These two activities produce her only source of income to support her family. Fanny has worked with Kiva in the past and she is very grateful to Kiva donors who have supported her. During the past few months she has been saving money to make one of her dreams come true: to build her house. Construction has begun but she needs additional funds to finish the roof on a bedroom. She is, therefore, asking Edpyme Alternative for 300 new soles.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Abilio Florencio

texts.es:
Abilio J. de 42 años, vive en una casa de cemento tiene agua y luz como servicios básicos su casa esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, es soltero y no tiene hijos.

Abilio empezó trabajando en una panadería después se quiso independizar y se saco una tienda, ya tiene 8 años con ella ahora el trabaja desde las 06h30 hasta las 22h00 todos los días vendiendo colas, leche, arroz etc. Una de las mayores complicaciones es la delincuencia que hay en su sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, colas, aceites para agrandar aun más el negocio. En el futuro quiere agrandar mas el negocio y poder mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Abilio J. is 42 years old and lives in a concrete house with basic services (water and lights), located in Paraíso de Guayaquil. He is single and has no children. Abilio began working in a bakery but later, decided to become independent and open a grocery store. That was 8 years ago. Now he works every day from 6:30 AM until 10:00 PM, selling colas, milk, rice, etc. One of his biggest problems is delinquency in his neighborhood. With this loan he will buy rice, colas, and cooking oil, in order to expand his business. In the future, he wants to enhance the business even more, and to be able to improve his house.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY RICE, MILK, AND COLAS TO SELL

loans.name: Ma. Leah

texts.en:
Ma. Leah D. is a 33-year-old, married woman who lives in Cabay, Brgy Guihalaran, Silay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living from a pig-fattening business. She buys piglets when they are small, and then raises them, feeds them, and fattens them for sale when they reach an appropriate size. This is also called piggery, which is also the name for the pen where the pigs are kept. In order to keep a business like Ma. Leah's running, she needs to be constantly buying new piglets and more feed so that the pigs can bring in a high price when she sells them.
