Project Dungganon helps by providing the capital to make this happen.

Ma. Leah’s husband, Joseph, has another job to support their family. They have three children ranging from an infant to 15 years old. Two of the children attend school, but they also help their parents with the business as part of their daily chores.

Ma. Leah joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 with the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of the loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase her family income, earning an additional Php 8,000 from her business activities.

Ma. Leah is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 14,000 was used to fund and maintain her pig-fattening business by helping her purchase feed and other supplies. It had a positive impact on both her business and the family’s living conditions. Now, she is borrowing her 8th loan, in the amount of Php 15,000, which she intends to use for the same purposes. Ma. Leah D. is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:


In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael es socia del Banco Comunal Legioncito.
Rafael es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos, Rafael tiene una mototaxi con el cual realiza transporte publico en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Rafael necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la reparación de su mototaxi.
Los sueños de Rafael son construir su casa y compra un carro.
texts.en:
Rafael is a member of the Legioncito Communal bank. He lives with his life partner and their three children. Rafael has a mototaxi with which he provides public transportation services in the city of Ayacucho. Rafael needs a 1000 sol loan to repair his mototaxi. Rafael's dream is to build his house and to buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle service and maintenance.

loans.name: Shohida

texts.ru: Содикова Шохида проживает в районе Шахринав. Возраст, 38 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж, на заработках в России. Сама Шохида занимается растениеводством. Она более 5 лет выращивает пшеницу. До этого Шохида преподовала в средней школе. У нее высшее образование. Кредит берет для закупа семян. Она на полученные деньги хочет купить качественные семена. Весной посеить и получить хороший урожай.
texts.en:
Shohida S. lives in the Shahrinav district. She is 38 years old, married and has 3 children. Her husband is working in Russia. Shohida is involved in agriculture. She has been growing wheat for over 5 years. Previously, Shohida taught at a secondary school. She has a higher education. Shohida is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds. She wants to use the money to buy quality seeds, plant them in the spring and get a good harvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the Trust Group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This group of entrepreneurs has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member in the group in order to improve their businesses in size and quality. In this way, they can better support their school-going children in terms of feeding, providing clothing, and in their academic pursuits. 

Thirty-seven-year-old Ramatu K. is the leader of this group. She was born in Makeni, is married to a gold miner, and they have four children. One of her children is in secondary school and the others are in primary school. For 7 years now, Ramatu K. has been selling baby clothing such as napkins (diapers), and other baby materials like pins, Vaseline, powder, etc. With her share of the loan, she will buy more of the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy baby clothes and cosmetics for babies to add to her business

loans.name: Mandah

texts.en: Mandah is 45 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a small house in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. They have lived there for 10 years. He and his wife operate a transportation business he started in 2000. Mandah's wife has responsibility for finances and finding new customers. They have grown the business and built a loyal customer base. In the beginning he generally provided transportation to people, but now he is more focused on transporting large objects and packages. He purchased two trucks a few years ago and rotates them for his business. Mandah has gained a lot of experience and is a very hardworking person. He says, “I would like to build a larger house and improve my family's quality of life in the future.” He is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrugs (~ 1760 USD) loan to purchase four tires for his trucks.

loans.use: To purchase tires for his truck

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James N. M. is a 50-year old hardworking man who operates a bakery. He has been in this business for four years and has five permanent employees. He was previously involved in matatu, a public transport business.  

Since James is the breadwinner in the family, he also farms to increase his earnings. He is a father of four, and three of his children are in school. James belongs to a group of young entrepreneurs where he saves his money. Membership in the group means he is guaranteed if he takes a loan from Faulu Kenya. James has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (Kes) to buy bigger tables and trays for his business.

loans.use: To buy bigger tables and trays for his bakery.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita A. is from the village of Pandan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 60 years old. Lolita is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Lolita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris tiene 50 años, es una amable mujer que vive con su esposo y sus hijos Kety de 28 años y Wilfredo de 20 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia, hogar que tanto les costo construir. Desde entonces instaló dentro de su domicilio un taller de fabricación de prendas de vestir, y con la ayuda de dos personas se dedican a este trabajo es así que lleva 4 años. Ahora está en la fabricación de carteras, de las cuales están hechas en variados colores y bonitos diseños pues Doris es muy creativa. Disfruta mucho la actividad que hace, aunque esto no significa que sea fácil pues ella debe tener mucha precisión a la hora de la costura pues sino las carteras no tendrían un buen acabado, por ello debe tener una buena visión, esforzándola al máximo. En un futuro desea ampliar su taller y así contratar más personas para aumentar su producción. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de telas cierres, hebillas, entre otros materiales y accesorios que le faciliten el acabado de sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Doris is 50 years old and is a friendly lady who lives with her husband and children, Kety (28), and Wilfredo (20). They live in a home that cost them very much to build and which includes a shop where she manufactures articles of clothing. She has two helpers and has been doing this for four years. She also started making wallets of different colors and nice designs. Doris is very creative. She enjoys doing these things very much, but this does not mean that it is easy work. She must be very precise and put forth a lot of effort when she sews, otherwise the wallets will not be of good quality. Eventually she would like to expand her shop and hire more people in order to increase her production. This will be her tenth loan through MFP and she has always been on time with her payments. She will use the money from this loan to buy fabric, buckles, and other supplies and accessories that she needs for her work.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar materiales y accesorios para confeccionar más carteras.

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe Jiguisseme sont des femmes,  toutes  mariées,  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles monogames à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers en générale tels que les pagnes (avec  MARIAM D.), les fruits et légumes, de la friperie, etc.
MARIAM D. compte acheter avec son  prêt,  12 pièces de pagnes. 
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso et effectue sa vente au  marché de Hamdallaye et en famille à une clientèle composée de femmes au comptant et  souvent à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  dans les dépenses de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Jiguisseme group are all married women, on average 43 years old with three children, and living for the most part in monogamous families in the Hamdallaye borough of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). This is the group’s third collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to satisfy their customers’ needs, and the preceding loans have been repaid. The group is active in retail commerce of various articles such as pagnes (colourful West-African clothing fabric, sold by Mariam D.), fruits and vegetables, second-hand clothing, etc. With her loan, Mariam D. wants to buy 12 pagnes. She gets her supplies from the main market in Sikasso, and resells at the Hamdallaye market or through home delivery to women customers, for cash and often for credit. She hopes to reach average monthly earnings of 30,500 FCFA of which part will be used for family expenses and the remainder invested in the commercial activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pagnes

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
To graduate her two children from college is Marivic Z.’s greatest desire as a mother. She doesn’t like her children to experience the bitter experiences she had in her past. Living a life for 28 years that offers very few opportunities to grow as a person and for enjoyment makes her so determined to make herself a successful businesswoman in the future and bring her family out from under the umbrella of poverty. 

With these visions, Marivic joined ASHI in 2008. She has received a loan since then and has been able to start up a “sari- sari” store for a business.  “Sari-sari” means that various foodstuffs, beverages and an assortment of grocery items are sold in a small, open room of their house. For Marivic and her family, the small profit her store is gaining is a great help to augment the sporadic and small income of her husband, who works as a hired laborer.  

Through the loan she is requesting presently, Marivic hopes to grow her business further to increase its profit to support the needs of her family and to improve the kind of life they are having.

loans.use: To purchase additional items for the inventory of her "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua E. is married to a driver and lives together with her two children. She sells oranges, biscuits, body creams and hair lotions at Elmina.  She has received a senior high education. Efua uses her income to help her husband provide the basic needs of her family.  Efua will use the loan to purchase more fruits and other goods to bring variety into her business. With the new earnings, she hopes to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and other goods

loans.name: Ysabel Catalina

texts.es:
Isabel Catalina A. G. tiene 32 anos. Es soltera y vive con sus hijos en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 4 hijos de 16, 14, 11, y 9 anos. 

Isabel es una socia de la ventanilla rural San Francisco de Sibimbe. Son 13 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. 

Isabel se dedica a la agricultura. Solicita el credito para siembras del siglo corto. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Ventanas. Con el apoyo del prestamo espera seguir adelante con la ayuda de Dios. Su sueno es lograr sus metas y no quedarse en el mismo lugar. 

En su tiempo libre le gusta pasar con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ysabel is 32 years old, single, and lives with her children in the canton of Ventanas, Los Rios province. She has 4 children, ages 16, 14, 11, and 9. Ysabel is a member of the San Francisco de Sibimbe communal bank, which has 13 members in all, the majority of whom are in agriculture. Ysabel too is in agriculture. She is requesting this loan to sow crops on the short growth cycle. She buys and sells her products in Ventanas. With the help of the loan, Ysabel hopes to forge ahead, with God's help. Her dream is to reach her goals and not remain in the same place. Ysabel likes to spend her free time with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: SOWING HER CROPS ON THE SHORT CYCLE

loans.name: Jean Marie

texts.en:
Jean Marie C. is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Jean Marie is single. To make a living, Jean Marie owns & operates a fish-selling business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling fish like "tuloy", "pirit", "sigarilyo" to local community members. Jean Marie has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jean Marie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jean Marie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jean Marie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Jean Marie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario del Cusco”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Magdalena; ella tiene 62 años de edad y es casada y  tiene 5 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de  productos remojados como trigo, quinua y moraya, ella tiene un puesto  en el mercado del distrito de Wanchaq desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, su esposo es carpintero hace trabajos en madera como muebles, sillas y camas, la socia quiere mejorar su negocio.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos remojados y aumentar su mercadería. 

  La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Magdalena, 62, is a member of the “Virgen del Rosario del Cusco” (Our Lady of the Rosary of Cusco) communal bank located in Wanchaq district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She is married and has 5 children. She combines her household chores with sales of grains like wheat, Quinoa and moraya (dehydrated potato) in a stand she has in the Wanchaq district market from 6am until 4pm. Her husband is a carpenter who makes wood articles like furniture, chairs and beds. She’d like to improve her business and is asking for funds to buy grains to increase her stock. She uses this forum to thank all those who participate in her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains to increase her stock.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, de 32 años, vive en su casa que es propia a lado de su esposo German, de 32 años que es profesor, y de su pequeña hija Ana de 4 años. Ella siempre ha sido de las personas que aceptan los retos y por tal motivo continuo trabajando a pesar de las constantes dificultades que se le presentaban. El esfuerzo que dio tuvo su recompensa, ahora su librería está bien implementada, además que tiene la ventaja de estar ubicada al frente de un colegio, asimismo ofrece el servicio de fotocopiadora. Por otro lado brinda maquinas de videojuegos, y le va muy bien pues obtiene considerables ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Luego del éxito de este negocio, logró juntar algo de dinero, por lo que ha instalado otra librería donde atiende un empleado. Lo que le gusta es que ha logrado buenas ganancias, pero no puede salir mucho por no descuidar ambos negocios, y como es una mujer emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere decepcionar a todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Lidia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cuadernos y papelería en general para surtir mejor ambos negocios, y ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lidia is 32 years old and she lives in her own home together with her husband, German, 32 years old and a teacher, and with their 4-year old daughter Ana. She has always been a type of person to set goals for herself so she has always continued to work despite the constant obstacles that got in her way. But the efforts she expended came with their reward. She has a well equipped book store with photocopy services. But she also has video game machines and it has been successful. With her considerable income she is able to contribute with her husband to the household expenses. With the success of her business she soon managed to save some money to she has managed to set up another book store, this one managed by an employee. She is very happy to see such good earnings but she cannot go out for long periods of time, to not neglect either business. She is a business woman and her plans for the future are to improve the infrastructure of her stores to provide a greater level of service to her clients. This is a first time loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to making the payments on time. She does not want to let down all the people who have made these funds possible, funds that allow her to progress in her business. Lidia's plans are to invest the loan requested in the purchase of notebooks and other general office supplies to stock both businesses and to offer a wider variety of products to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase notebooks and office supplies.

loans.name: Azylkan's Group

texts.en:
Azylkan S. is the leader of the group. She is 57 and married. She has raised two sons and four daughters. All the children are married and live separately with their families. Azylkan and her husband are engaged in farming.  They sell agricultural products. In this way they make 3000 soms per month. With money received from the loan Azylkan wants to purchase two tons of wheat to resell later at the higher price. In the future she wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions. 

Kulumkan J. is the treasurer of the group. She is 63 and married. She has raised thirteen children. Kulumkan and her husband are farmers. They grow wheat. With money received from the loan Kulumkan wants to purchase seeds of wheat (one ton) for sowing. 

Almaz B. is 26. Three years ago, with the initial investment of 15000 soms, he started to sell agricultural products. He applied for the loan because he needs money to purchase apples (one ton) in order to resell them at the higher price in winter.

Ruslan K., 34, is married. He has a son and two daughters. The daughter is at school and the sons are not yet old enough to attend school. In order to make money Ruslan sells agricultural products. With money received from the loan he wants to purchase three tons of wheat. In the future he wants to expand his business, build a shed and start breeding cattle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase wheat

loans.name: Sumbua

texts.en: Sumbua H. is currently in the business of selling onions, tomatoes, and cooking oil.  She is requesting a loan to stock more tomatoes and onions for sale.  Sumbua is 25 years old and married; her husband is a businessman.  She has 4 children, and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher has a food stall making homos, a local breakfast dish in Palestine. His stall is located in the old city. Maher is a husband and father. The food stall is the family's source of income which he wants to expand into a small restaurant offering more local dishes. Maher came to Kiva's partner, FATEN, asking for a loan to purchase basic ingredients for homos such as chickpeas and ginger oil. Maher aims to increase the amount he produces for clients as homos is a very popular local dish.

Maher appears in the photo next to his stall.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
 
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase basic ingredients for "homos" (a local dish)

loans.name: Nelson Kampus

texts.en:
Nelson Kampus L. is 19 years old. He is married to Noonkuta L. and he is a father of one child aged one year. Nelson is a wheat farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last five years.
  
Nelson learned about KADET from a member of a group that is registered with KADET.  This will be his first loan. He is planning to prepare land for the next planting season. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to reinvest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer in wheat and buy a bigger piece of land.

loans.use: To prepare land for the next planting season

loans.name: Ma. Mildred

texts.en:
Ma. Mildred L. is a 44 year old single woman who supports her family by operating a Sari-Sari store .  She lives in Brgy. Tapon, Dalaguete, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her Sari-Sari Store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 12000. Ma. Mildred is now borrowing PHP 15000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell.  This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 12000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Mildred aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Khoeng

texts.en: Khoeng K. is 38 and the father of three school-aged kids. Khoeng K. and his wife now live in Phnom Penh City.  Khoeng K. earns his income as a fish trader in the busy market with his wife. This couple always buys fresh fish in bulk from fisherman in the rural area, and then they sell it to gain daily income.  Generally, Khoeng K. used his old motorbike for picking up his product to take to the market, but it broke while driving. He wants to buy a new one, but his personal savings are insufficient. So Khoeng K. would like a loan in order to buy new motorcycle to replace the broken one, and with the rest buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle to replace the broken one, and use the rest to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Durna

texts.en: Durna R. is 56, married, and lives with her five dear children in her own house in a small settlement built for refugee families in the Bilasuvar district. She fled with her big family to Bilasuvar in 1993. Durna is an entrepreneurial woman and together with her husband, they did their best for many years to give comfort and an education to their beloved children, but it was difficult to cover all their needs. Durna decided to start her cattle-breeding business in 2003. Now the monthly income of the family is around 500 AZN. Her three sons help her in this business. With this loan of 1200 AZN she bought three cows. This is her first loan with AqroInvest and Kiva and she promises to make the payments on time since she would like to take out more loans in the future. She is planning to enlarge her cattle-breeding business and increase her number of cows to twelve.

loans.use: to buy three cows

loans.name: Jiji

texts.en:
Jiji Q. is from the village of Kabatangan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 29 years old. Jiji is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jiji owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, canned goods, snack foods, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Jiji has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jiji joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Jiji has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Jiji is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack  foods. This will be the third loan taken out by Jiji from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 39 años vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 5 años se dedica a la venta de animales que ella misma cría y alimenta, pero previamente son comprados a un menor precio. En este negocio su esposo también es participe así que ambos trabajan juntos y recaudan buena cantidad de ganancias para sostener a sus hijos. Paralelamente a este negocio, por las tarde vende comida de manera ambulante. Ella se siente muy animada por todos los logros que ha obtenido; por ello desea incrementar la cantidad de animales que tiene. Es su crédito número 11 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más animales como ovejas para incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en: Julia is 39 and lives with her husband and 4 children in their own house.  More than 5 years ago she started selling animals that she herself raised and nourished.  In the past the animals were bought  at a lower price.  Her husband also works with her and together they  make a good living so that they can support their children.  Besides this business in the afternoons Julia sells food on the streets.  She feels very excited about all that they have managed to earn and she would like to increase the number of animals that she has.  This is the 11th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support since she has always been responsible with her payments.  She also appreciates being part of a communal bank because all of the members are responsible and united.  She thanks the people who have offered the loan that she is requesting.   It will be very useful in her business.  Julia will use the loan to buy more animals such as sheep to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy more sheep

loans.name: Roldan

texts.en:
This is Roldan C., 29, resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Corazon C., a plant retailer, and father to their children. By the grace of God, Roldan has managed to support his children's schooling. At this time, he is working hard to send his children all the way through college, a dream for most poor Filipino parents like Roldan as he himself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Roldan is a landscaping artist who decorates gardens. He and his wife aesthetically alter the view of any plain garden or patio for a specific fee. His wife provides the plants needed for the transformation. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. 
 
To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 19,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy plants, ornamental rocks, grasses and other landscaping needs. He expects a boost in his income as he expands his business.  

Roldan dreams of being able to give his children a good, high quality education through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy plants, ornamental rocks, grasses and other landscaping needs

loans.name: Martiniano

texts.es: El Sr. Martiniano es una persona  muy honesta y responsable y apoya a su nieto en la compra de útiles escolares, ya que a el le gusta ayudar en lo económico a su familia por lo que el se ha distinguido por ser un excelente cliente en esta institución, actualmente el ha decidió apoyar un poco mas a su nieto que estudia ya que en su escuela le han estado solicitando algunos artículos escolares y de momento no cuenta con el suficiente efectivo para hacer las compras tanto de estos artículos como  de uniformes escolares
texts.en:
Sr. Martiniano is an honest and responsible person who helps his grandson by purchasing his school supplies. He enjoys helping his family financially and has distinguished himself as an excellent client of Credituyo.

At the moment, Martiniano has decided to provide his grandson with a little more support with his studies. His grandson is requesting a few school supplies but Martiniano does not have sufficient funds at the moment to make these purchases as well as acquire school uniforms.

loans.use: Purchase school supplies for his grandson

loans.name: Blanca Morayma

texts.es:
Blanca Morayma R. R. tiene 32 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Blanca se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es arreglar la vivienda para vivir mejor.

Le gusta salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Blanca Morayma R. R. is 32 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and unmarried children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  She has 4 children.

The 'Grupo Enmanuel' community bank is located in San Juan, in Guaranda canton.  The 17 members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, wheat and potatoes in large quantities.  They also raise animals such as pigs and hens.

Blanca is a farmer who grows corn.  She also raises pigs and hens.  She buys her animal feed in 'Comercial Silva' every weekend and sells her products in the 'Feria de los Jueves' market in Guaranda.

Blanca is requesting this loan so that she can grow corn, wheat and potatoes, and buy animals.  She will also buy feed supplies and supplies for her crops.  The support of this loan would help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to fix up her home so that she can live better.

Blanca likes to go out for walks with her family.

loans.use: to grow corn, wheat and potatoes, and to buy animals

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
DesD. hace algunos años, Luz María A. aprendió el oficio D. la confección, lo que le ha permitido en un espacio reducido D. su casa adecuar su máquina para dedicarse a esta labor y así aportar a cubrir los gastos del hogar, pues con lo que su esposo gana en su trabajo no les alcanzaba para mantener su numerosa familia conformada por 5 hijos. 

Luz María necesita D. un préstamo para comprar una máquina D. coser plana que le permitirá hacer otro tipo D. prendas y así incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Several years ago, Luz Maria A. learned to make clothing, which has allowed her to use the small space available in her home to work and cover household expenses. Her husband's income alone could not cover these costs for their large family, comprised of five children.

Luz Maria needs a loan to buy a flat sewing machine that will allow her to expand her work to other types of garments, increasing her income and improving quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy a flat sewing machine.

loans.name: Cesar Paucar

texts.es: Cesar tiene 42 años de edad. Vive con sus hijos  y esposa en el distrito de Jayanca, una zona agrícola del departamento de Lambayeque, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Gana la vida brindando servicios de construcción (maestro de obras). Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 08 años, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona. Con los ingresos de su negocio, Cesar puede solventar sus gastos familiares y del hogar. El destino del crédito será para comprar más herramientas para reemplazar viejo equipo que tiene. Esta inversión facilitará su trabajo y lo permitirá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en: Cesar is 42 years old. He lives with his children and his wife in the district of Jayanca, an agricultural zone in the department of Lambayeque, located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He earns a living providing construction services (master builder). He has been doing this work for 8 years; that is to say, he knows the profession to perfection. He has an established customer base in his area. With the income from his business, Cesar is able to cover the expenses of his family and household. The loan will be used to buy more tools to replace some old equipment he has. This investment will make his work easier and allow him to provide better service to his customers. For this reason, he has decided to request a loan for 1000 Peruvian new soles.

loans.use: to buy tools for his construction business

loans.name: Serakazi Group

texts.en:
Edwin P. is in his early twenties and is single. He runs a stationery business.  He has been in this business for one and a half years.  He works from 7.00am to 6.00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Edwin's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He hopes for a loan to buy stationery items. His dream is to one day be a supplier of stationery to big offices.

Edwin will share this loan with his loan group, "Serakazi" which has a total of 16 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Edwin is 1st on the right front row, in a black t-shirt.

loans.use: To buy more stock of stationery items.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 31 years old, married and has two children. She sells spares parts to earn a living. She has two years experience in this business.  Previously, she was operating a pharmacy.  She joined Faulu Kenya so that she could save her money and access loans easily. She hopes to grow her business in the future. She has requested 50,000 Kes to buy headlights.

loans.use: To buy headlights

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac; en la provincia de Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia  Albertina, la socia  tiene47 años de edad y La socia es casada; La socia  tiene 2 hijos, de 20 y 13 años de edad;  La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la administración de su automóvil la socia tiene con su conyugue un carro que ambos adquirieron y el esposo  presta el servicio de taxi, la socia desea el crédito para poder invertir en la compra del SOAT. Que es el seguro para cubrir a los pasajeros de accidentes; la socia desea invertir en la compra del seguro para proteger a los pasajeros que su esposo les preste el servicio de taxi, dentro de la ciudad del Cusco. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra del seguro contra accidentes para su auto.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Albertina, 47, is a member of the “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS” communal bank.  She lives in Huanchac District which is in Cusco Province and Department.

She is married and has two children who are 20 and 13 years of age.  She alternates her household chores with administering an automobile she has with her spouse that they bought together and her husband uses to provide taxi services.  She wants the loan to buy a SOAT, which is an insurance policy to cover passengers in accidents.  She wants to invest in the purchase of the insurance to protect the passengers her husband transports within the city of Cusco.  She is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of an accident insurance policy for her vehicle.

She values and is infinitely thankful for the loans she’ll be granted so that she can improve her quality of life.  She also commits to repay the loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy automobile accident insurance.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 57 years old and married with 5 children.

She works hard to provide for her family. Violeta has been running a general store in the Philippines for 30 years and also earns an income from tailoring and room rentals. She has requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell and raw materials for her room rentals business. She has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Violeta aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell and raw materials for her room rentals business

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a married man from the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He has nine children. His youngest  child is 12 years old.

Roberto is a farmer and tills his own load. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. He earns about 13,000 PHP per month from farming. Roberto utilizes his income to provide his family with their basic needs. Receiving a loan would help him buy farm supplies he needs like fertilizers and seeds.

In the future, Roberto hopes to uplift his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Lorpu

texts.en:
Lorpu, a widow, is a resident of Congo town. She has seven children, all of whom are working adults. The one thing she enjoys is when she can relax.

For the past three years Lorpu has been selling dried goods such as milk, candles and rice. She started into business by selling fish.

Lorpu’s business is growing fast. She is requesting a loan to purchase cartons of milk and candles to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of milk and candles to sell.

loans.name: Mburucuja Group

texts.es:
Mburucuja se denomina el grupo de 11 mujeres de la ciudad de Pilar, ellas se juntaron gracias a que oyeron acerca del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, la idea las atrajo y decidieron unirse. Actualmente se encuentran en el tercer ciclo.
La Sra. Mariela, se dedica a la venta de comidas de todo tipo, comenta que es muy buena cocinera y que a sus clientes les gusta mucho sus platillos. Ella se define como una buena cocinera, razón por la cual tiene muchos clientes que aprecian su buena comida. Ella sueña con algún día poder tener un pequeño bar donde vender sus comidas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos. Como ser carne, huevo, especias y demás.
texts.en:
'Mburucuja' is the name of this group of 11 women from the city of Pilar who came together because they had heard about the Entrepreneurial Women Program.  The idea attracted them and they decided to form a group.  They are currently on their third loan cycle

Mariela sells all kinds of food.  She tells us that she is a very good cook and that her customers really enjoy her meals.  She describes herself as a good cook which is why she has a lot of customers who appreciate her good food.  She dreams of some day being able to own a small bar where she can sell her meals.

Mariela is requesting a loan to buy the supplies she needs to make her food such as meat, eggs, spices and other products.

loans.use: to buy meat, eggs, spices and other products

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana Cecilia se dedica a la venta y elaboración de comida, esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos por lo que ha sido de mucha ayuda. Su negocio inicio aproximadamente hace unos 12 años con esfuerzo propio, ya que ella sabía muy bien elaborar diferentes platillos, a pesar de que no podía realizar una variedad de comida logro atraer la atención de sus clientes. Pues siempre ha demostrado ser una madre muy abnegada y que se preocupa por su familia. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, verduras, carnes y aceite.
texts.en: Ana Cecilia engages in producing and selling food. This is not the first time she has requested loans, as they have been of great help. She started her activity approximately 12 years ago thanks to her own efforts, as she was very good at preparing different dishes. Even though she could not produce a variety of meals, she succeeded in attracting the attention of her customers. She has always proven to be a very self-sacrificing mother who cares for her family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice, beans, sugar, vegetables, meat and oil.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, vegetables, meat and oil.

loans.name: Liverata

texts.es: Liverata vive desde hace 10 años en la ciudad de Huancayo en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 menores hijos. Desde hace 3 años vende cerdos y ovejas en la feria ganadera de la ciudad, pues adquiere sus animales comprándolos  a sus dueños directos, quienes son ganaderos, para revenderlos a un mayor precio. Realiza este negocio todos los fines de semana, y por ello esta en búsqueda de comprar animales hembras y preñadas porque tiene la oportunidad de alimentar a las crías hasta un determinado tiempo para ofrecerlos en la feria. Por otro lado siembra papa y maíz, por lo que también obtiene un ingreso extra de la venta de su producción. Pero su sueño es tener su negocio de animales más establecido con mayor capital que le permitirá aumentar sus ganancias. es la cuarta vez que esta solicitando un crédito con MFP, esta muy entusiasmada de seguir trabajando con prestamos que son su mejor aliada en la mejora de su negocio y en el momento en que lo necesita. En esta ocasión invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más animales porque en las festividades de Santiago que se aproxima hay mayor demanda de animales.
texts.en:
For the past 10 years, Liverata has lived in the city of Huancayo with her husband and two small children. For three years she has been selling pigs and sheep at the city cattle fair. She buys her animals directly from their owners, who are livestock farmers, and she resells them at a higher price. Liverata conducts this business every weekend. She is looking to buy female and pregnant animals as this will give her the opportunity to also raise their offspring for a certain time, until she is able to sell them at the fair. 

Liverata also sows potatoes and corn, earning an additional income through the sale of her produce. However, her dream is to further establish her animal business with more capital which would help her to increase profits. This is the fourth time Liverata has applied for a loan with MFP, and she is excited to continue working with loans as they have proven to be the best tool for improving her business, at the time she needs it most. This time, the money will be invested in buying more animals because the Santiago festival is approaching and during this period there is a greater demand for animals.

loans.use: to purchase more small animals such as pigs and sheep

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 10:00 de la noche, Gloria atiende su negocio, una tienda en la ofrece productos de la canasta familiar a sus vecinos de barrio. Su negocio tienda se ha convertido en una gran oportunidad para generar ingresos pues después de su separación se vio en la necesidad de trabajar como independiente. 

Actualmente necesita un préstamo para comprar mayor variedad de surtido y ofrecerle a sus clientes mayores opciones y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
From 7:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m., Gloria is in her store attending to neighborhood customers who come to shop for their families.  Her store has become a great opportunity for generating income, especially since her separation when she had to start working to support herself.

Now she is in need of a loan to buy a broader variety of inventory so she can offer her customers more options, thus increasing her income.

loans.use: To buy a variety products for the family shopping basket.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam tiene 44 años, es separada, radica en su tierra natal al lado de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 20 años de experiencia en la crianza de ganado vacuno de las cuales vende la leche de sus vacas así como también los becerros machos. Su trabajo diario comienza en horas de la madrugada, que consiste en cortar la alfalfa para alimentar a sus animales, limpiar su establo, ordeñar y todo el día darle esos cuidados esenciales de las cuales influye bastante en las ganancias. Su negocio es ventajoso, vende de manera diaria la leche y eso le permite ganar todos los días y  con ello afrontar cuentas de urgencia. De manera paralela tiene terrenos de cultivo en las cuales siembra  papa y maíz y que luego son vendidos una vez cosechados. Esta es la décima vez que esta solicitando un crédito con MFP y disfruta de ser parte de su grupo solidario porque ya conoce y tiene trayectoria en este tipo de crédito a la cual supo mirar las ventajas y beneficiarse de ellas. La mitad del dinero servirá para que compre una ternera hembra y con la otra mitad comprará saco de abono para su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Miriam is 44 years old.  She is separated and lives in her hometown with her three children in her own home.  She has 20 years of experience in raising cattle, selling cows milk, and also selling young bulls.  Her work begins at daybreak, which consists of cutting up alfalfa feed for her livestock, cleaning their stables, and taking care of the daily details that have an enormous influence on her earnings.  Her business is very advantageous.  She sells her milk in the morning daily, which allows her to earn money every day and cover all of her urgent costs.  She also has plots of land where she grows corn and potatoes, which she harvests and then sells.  This is her tenth time seeking a loan with MFP.  She enjoys being a part of such a supportive group and she already understands the trajectory of this type of credit with has allowed her to see how they may benefit her.  Half of the money will be used to purchase a female calf and the other half will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer for her next harvest.

loans.use: purchase calves and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Melagrosa

texts.en:
Melagrosa is widowed with 4 children. Melagrosa is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Melagrosa is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for the rice.

Melagrosa has been a member of PMPC for one year. Melagrosa hopes to save money for the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the rice

loans.name: Fanny Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Fanny continua trabajando en su cyber, pues la demanda es cada dia mejor, ha venido mejorando el local para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Cuenta siempre con el apoyo economico de su esposo, de sus dos hija una ya culmino sus estudios y esta laborando, y la otra sigue estudiando.
Fanny con el credito anterior logro cambiar otro sistema de internet con mas velocidad, siendo la infornacion  mas eficaz, vendiendo mas horas a sus clientes.
este nuevo financiamiento comprara una encolochadora para ofrecer el servicio completo de  trabajo. y la reparacion de equipo que tiene malo, para dar una buena atencion en su negocio. Ya que con el credito anterior
texts.en:
Fanny continues to work at her internet cafe.  Since the demand increases every day, she has begun improving the store to give her customers better service.  She always counts on the financial support of her husband.  One of her daughters has finished her studies and is working, and the other is continuing her studies.  

With her last loan, Fanny was able to change to a different internet system with more speed which delivers information more efficiently, so she can sell more hours to her customers.

With this new loan, she will purchase a copier to offer complete office services, and she will repair equipment with problems to give attention to her business, as with her past loan.

loans.use: to purchase a copier to be able to offer complete services to her customers and repair equipment.

loans.name: Kamoliddin

texts.ru: Камолиддин женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Он умный и целеустремленный человек. Более 8 лет он занимается выращиванием селхоз культур. Он имеет 10 гектар земли и там выращивает лук, пшеница и фасоль. Кроме этого он занимается скотоводством. Данное время он имеет 10 голов крупного рогатого скота. Камолиддин планирует купить минеральных удобрений, ГСМ и семена лука для посева. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 3000$ США. Он заранее благодарить вас за поддержку.
texts.en: Kamoliddin is married and is a loving father of three children. He is smart and purposeful man. He has been growing agriculture crops for more than eight years. He has ten hectares of land where he grows onions, wheat and beans. He also does animal husbandry. At this time he has ten heads of large horned cattle. Kamoliddin plans to buy mineral fertilizer, fuel and onion seeds for sowing. He is asking for a loan in the amount of $3,000 USD for this purpose. He is thankful in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer, onion seeds and fuel.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre San Miguel, se conformó en septiembre del año 2007.  Formaron un grupo de 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el decimo ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Ellas manifiestan que les gustaría seguir con la fundación, ya que les ha sido de mucha ayuda.
Natalia, una de las miembros, se dedica a la venta de lencería, tanto para hombres como para mujeres, negocio al que se dedica hace un tiempo, gracias al cual obtiene los ingresos necesarios para ayudar con los gastos de la casa. Comenta que la fundación la ha ayudado mucho en su negocio, por lo que solicita nuevamente su ayuda por medio del crédito para la compra de lencerías masculinas y femeninas, para poder seguir con sus ventas. Agradece por esta oportunidad que se le da.
texts.en:
The San Miguel Women's Committee was formed in September 2007 by a group of 17 women.  They are currently working very happily on their tenth loan cycle in a joint and supportive manner within the program.  They say that they would like to continue working with the foundation as it has been very helpful to them.

One of the group's members, Natalia, sells underwear for both men and women.  She has been in this business for some time and it makes her the income she needs to help with her household expenses.  She says that the foundation have helped her a lot in her business and so she is requesting their help again through this loan which she will use to buy men's and women's underwear.  This will enable her to continue with her sales.  She is grateful for this opportunity that she is being given.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's underwear for resale

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla is widowed with three children. She is 43 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga. Perla sells assorted fruits to earn a living and has had this business for 12 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 24,000 to purchase assorted fruits worth PHP 24,000 for resale. She has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase assorted fruits worth PHP 24,000 for resale.

loans.name: Irma Luz

texts.es: La señora Irma tiene 55 años de edad y ha dedicado los últimos 10 años a la confección de prendas de vestir sobre medida y por encargo  directamente a los clientes. El taller de la señora Irma se encuentra en su propia casa donde labora ella sola.  Para seguir con su labor, la señora Irma desea comprar insumos para su negocio como son hilos y telas; con lo anterior ella busca aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus tres hijos y su esposo quienes dependen de ella.
texts.en: Irma is 55 years old, and for the last 10 years she has been making tailor-made custom clothes for her clients. The shop where Irma works is in her home where she works alone. To continue her work, Irma would like to buy merchandise like thread and fabric for her business. With that she aims to increase her profit and to improve the quality of life for her three children and spouse who depend on her.

loans.use: to buy products like fabric and thread.

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.ru:
Чолпон 39 лет, замужем, воспитывает четырех детей, младшие из которых школьники. Муж находится на заработках в соседнем Казахстане, где работает на стройке.  В поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, в 2006 году Чолпон начала свой бизнес в торговле овощами и фруктами. Стартовав с суммы 10,000 сом (KGS), Чолпон благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  около 20,000 сом (KGS). Она закупает фрукты, а также продукцию в виде яблок, помидоров, перца у местных производителей по оптовой цене, затем продает на местном рынке.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чолпон обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента.  Доходы от кредита Чолпон планирует вложить в  расширение торгового места.
texts.en: Cholpon is 39 years old, married and is raising four children, the youngest of whom are school students.  Her husband works in the neighboring Kazakhstan at a construction site.  In search of an additional source of income for her family, Cholpon started her business of selling vegetables and fruits in 2006.  Having started with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS), Cholpon was able to develop her business to have a monthly income of about 20,000 som (KGS), thanks to her persistence and hard work.  She buys fruits and produce, such as apples, tomatoes and peppers from local producers at wholesale prices and then sell the produce at a local market.  In order to further grow her business, Cholpon requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to expand her product selection.  She plans to invest the profits from this loan into an expansion of her retail space.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of products

loans.name: Mackline's Group

texts.en:
Mackline's group is comprised of six hard-working women. Mackline is 17 years old and lives in the town of Hima in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Mackline has been working hard to manage her small business, where she cuts fresh fish and sells it to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Mackline has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fish, and will help Mackline to generate greater profits and pay her family's bills. Mackline hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a home. 

Mackline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Mackline's future prospects by helping her to learn how to write and how to budget money.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is 51 years old. She is married and has three children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Marciana is borrowing PHP 28000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Marciana has been buying and selling livestock for 30 years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: To save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 56 years old.  She has been operating a grocery business for 14 years.  She has retained her business because of her hard work and determination.  She has also been trained on business management skills.  This has helped her to improve her business.

Salome hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 32 years old, married to Johnson, and they have two children. She has been operating a poultry farm for the last six years, earning a monthly income of Kes 15,000.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 10,000. She will use the funds to purchase chickens and growers' mash. With the anticipated profits she will cover school fees.

Her hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase growers' mash and chickens.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a businessman who sells water. He has been engaged in the business for seven years. He has employed seven people to assist him in his tasks. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his business because he has been trained on business management skills.
He hopes to grow his business in the future. He has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a water tank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Shadia

texts.en: Shadia is a 32 year old married woman who has 4 family members from Al Zarqa Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for her home improvements, She wants to buy a children room. In the future she would like to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Yorleny María

texts.es:
Yorleny María Morera es una mujer de 35 años, ella vive en Paraíso de Pocosol, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres y se dedica a la crianza de terneros, actividad que realiza desde hace más de 2 años la cual le gusta mucho.

Yorleny María realiza su actividad en una finca cerca de su casa, a la cual viaja caminando todos los días para cuidar de sus terneros. Ella está solicitando este crédito para comprar más terneros y poder incrementar el hato de ganado que posee.

Con la compra de estos terneros ella espera recibir ingresos de 420.000 colones cada 5 meses, para poder solventar las necesidades diarias de ella y sus padres.

Ella vende su ganado en la Subasta Ganadera de Muelle, allí encuentra sus clientes.

El negocio que tiene Yorleny María es muy importante para ella porque puede brindarle bienestar a su familia con el dinero que recibe, además la hace sentirse orgullosa porque tiene un trabajo digno, justo y hace lo que más le gusta que es trabajar con animales.

Este préstamo le ayudará a mejorar sus finanzas y a incrementar el hato de ganado que tiene y así poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres.
texts.en:
Yorleny Maria is a 35 year old woman who lives in Paraiso de Pocosol. She is single and has no children. Yorleny lives with her parents and dedicates herself to raising calves, an activity she has pursued for more than 2 years and likes very much. Yorleny does this on a ranch near her house and she goes there every day to care for her calves.
Yorleny is requesting this loan to purchase more calves and, thus, to increase her herd of cattle. With the purchase of these calves, she hopes to receive an income of 420,000 colons each 5 months, enough to cover the daily expenses of herself and her parents. Yorleny sells her cattle in the Subasta Ganadera de Muelle where she finds her customers. Her business is very important for her because with it, she can provide for the wellbeing of her family with the money she earns. In addition, it makes her proud because she has worthwhile and just work. What she likes most is working with animals. This loan will help her to improve her finances and to augment her herd of cattle and, thus, offer a better quality of life for her parents.

loans.use: buy calves to raise.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 5 years to 15 years old. She describes herself to be creative. She operates a retail business where she sells mattresses. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of mattresses. Her business goal is to yield high returns within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of mattresses

loans.name: Dagbegnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DAGBEGNON est composé de trois personnes qui sont membres dans un même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Séraphine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Séraphine vit au Bénin et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Noel. Séraphine a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Séraphine vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Séraphine vend de façon ambulante des poissons fumés depuis dix sept ans. Séraphine vend de façon secondaire, de charbon de bois et de sachets ; ce qui lui permet de mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa famille. Séraphine s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Séraphine ensemble avec les membres du  groupe DAGBEGNON, sollicite un second crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit antérieur a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des poissons frais et du charbon de bois.

loans.name: Oysanam

texts.ru: Ойсанам очень рада, что вы не отказали ей в поддержки. Она очень благодарно за Вашу поддержку. Ойсанам успешно погасила предыдущий кредит. Она до сегодняшнего дня продвигает свое любимое дело. Ойсанам каждый год выращивает помидор и арбуз. В этом году она решила посадить только картофель. Ойсанам решила зять кредит и за счет кредита приобрести семена картофеля и больше количество минеральных удобрений для обработки почву. Ойсанам очень нуждается в помощи. Вы можете поддержать ее сейчас!

loans.use: Для купли семена картофеля и больше количество минеральных удобрений.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.en: Eliana R. is 40 years old. She graduates her education in Moscow and lives there for nine years. There in Russia she first sees this kind of internet phone calls using which every citizen of foreign country cal call home on good prize. In 2002 she comes back to Bulgaria and starts this business. Bourgas is a resort town and many foreigners come there durin summer months so it is a good place for this kind of business. This loan she applies for she wants to use to install a new kind communication line for phone calls to Germany.

loans.use: To install a new kind communication line for phone calls

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Matha and I sell cosmetics for a living, which I distribute as a traveling saleswoman in the offices and schools in my city. I have several years experience in my business, which creates enough income to contribute to the family expenses and to take care of other obligations. Thanks to this business, the earnings in my household have improved and I was able to give my family a higher standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Hola mi nombre es Matha, mi actividad principal el la venta de Cosmeticos, los que distribuyo de manera ambulante en las Oficinas y Escuelas de mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, el que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares y demas compromisos, gracias a este negocio los ingresos en mi hogar han mejorado por lo que pudi ofrecer mejor nivel de vida mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase shampoo, conditioners, face-creams, compact powder, lipstick, sun-screen, shades, eye-liners, and lip-liners.

loans.name: Macario

texts.en:
Macario is in the business of selling clothes and other items. He travels around the community and also to the rural sector, specifically targeting friends, family, and acquaintances. Macario has been selling clothes for about 6 years. Although his business is somewhat profitable, it does not always provide enough for him and his family. Therefore, Macario also buys and sells rice. He travels in his truck to rural Ecuador where he buys directly from the rice farmers. He sells the rice to many small stores around Guayaquil. He is on his second loan with Kiva and Mifex and hopes he can expand his inventory to include domestic appliances.

Macario is 53 years old and has 2 kids, only one of which is still living at home. His wife works as a housecleaner and sometimes gets jobs taking care of the elderly.

loans.use: Invest in appliances

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in new clothing products and possibly buy a glass display case

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores is a married mother of two. Her husband is a plaster worker. She decided two years ago to contribute to the household income since her husband's salary was insufficient, so she started helping a friend sell beauty products and then started on her own. Now she has steady customers who recommend her business to others, and she wants to keep growing the business and take on more clients since she enjoys the work and knows things can improve if she gets support.

Dolores is requesting a loan of $325, which she plans to repay within six months, to purchase supplies so she can offer products directly to clients and not via catalogue. Dolores and her family are very grateful for your support in helping grow this business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Dolores es una mujer casada y tiene 2 hijos, su esposo trabaja como yesero, ella empezó con su negocio hace dos años, para colaborar con la economía familiar, ya que con el sueldo de su esposo no les alcanzaba, así, empezó ayudándole a vender productos de belleza a una amiga y luego empezó ya por su cuenta, ahora ya tiene varios clientes fijos y que la recomiendan con su negocio y desea continuar creciendo y tener más clientes ya que el encantan las ventas y sabe que va a poder mejorar si tiene el apoyo necesario.

Dolores solicita un préstamo por US $ 325 que ofrece pagar en 6 meses, para comprar mercancía y así poder ofrecer en forma directa sus productos a sus clientes, ella y su familia agradecen mucho el apoyo que le brindas para continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase beauty supplies

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola A. has 4 children and she is 37 years of age. He hails from a rural sector in Ijaniki, Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been a leader in a union under LAPO for the past 3 years. She sells cement in bags and has been in business since the year 2002. She is requesting for  $1175 to buy more bags of cements for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cement

loans.name: Alternativa 2 Group

texts.es:
Maria Elena is a 55 year old widow with three children. She has been an artisan for many years, making embroidered blouses and tablecloths that she sells to the women in her community and also to the tourists that visit their area. Other members of the group also are artisans because it is the best source of income that they have, as their communities are being frequently visited by tourists because of the recognition and attention they have received for their embroidery work. Pascuala however grows and sells flowers in the San Cristobal market.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA ELENA , TIENE 55 AÑOS ACTUALMENTE ESTA VIUDA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS SE DEDICA DESDE HACE MUCHOS AÑOS A LA ARTESANIA CONFECCIONANDO BLUSAS Y MANTAS BORDADAS LAS QUE VENDE ENTRE LAS MUJERES DE SU COMUNIDAD Y TAMBIEN CON LOS TUIRISTAS QUE VISITAN SU ZONA .LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DE SU GRUPO TAMBIEN SE DEDICAN A LA ARTESANIA DEBIDO A QUE ES COMO LA MEJOR FUENTE DE INGRESOS QUE POSEEN PORQUE SUS COMUNIDADES ESTAN SIENDO MUY VISITADAS POR LOS TURISTAS DEBIDO AL RECONOCIMIENTO DE SUS BORDADOS EN EL EXTERIOR.PASCUALA EN CAMBIO SE DEDICA AL CULTIVO Y VENTA DE FLORES LAS CUALES SALE A VENDER EN LOS MERCADOS DE LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL

loans.use: Purchase fabric, looms and thread for embroidery

loans.name: Amy Lucia

texts.es:
For 6 years, Sra. Amy M. has worked selling produce like tomatos, garlic, chiltomas (a kind of pepper), oranges, etc. She works daily in the Mayoreo market of Managua, where her sister helps her attend the store. She is a single mother with a daughter who needs her now more than ever as she is about to begin high school.

Since she began her business at the market, her quality of life has improved a bit, since her difficult economic situation had made it hard for her to support the daughter who so needs her. Currently she has completed loans with Ceprodel, which have helped her greatly in acquiring greater quantities of vegetables. Not only this, but she has also been able to support her beloved daughter who needs her. She hopes to continue requesting loans in order to increase her small business and help her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Translator.

Desde hace 6 años, la señora Amy M. se dedica a la venta de verduras como tomates, ajos, chiltomas, naranjas, etc. Su labor la inicia diariamente en el mercado Mayoreo de Managua, donde recibe apoyo de una hermana para atender el negocio. Es madre soltera y con una hija a su cargo el cual hoy mas que nunca necesita su apoyo para ir al colegio porque está próxima a ingresar.

Desde que comenzó su negocio, en el mercado ha mejorado un poco su nivel de vida ya que la dura situación económica que ha atravesado le ha impedido brindarle el apoyo a su pequeña hija que tanto lo necesita. Hoy en día ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel el cual según cuenta le han beneficiado grandemente ya que adquiere mayores cantidades de verduras y no sol eso sino que tamben apoya mas a su amada hija que tanto lo necesita. Anhela seguir solicitando los créditos para ampliar su pequeño negocio y darle el apoyo a su hija.

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Juana Milaria

texts.en:
Juana Milaria is a forty-three-year-old single mother who is making great efforts to support her five children’s studies and face their household issues. She has been running a small grocery store for a little more than one year in El Cacique community of Yamasá. Juana explains that in the beginning she operated the business in her house as she didn’t have enough money to rent a locale for the store.

After many months of hard work and persistence, Juana’s grocery store is starting to be very profitable. Currently Juana even plans on moving the business to a small locale she will rent before long to continue her business. The entrepreneur will use her loan to invest in the rental of the locale. She will also purchase many products to restock the grocery store.

loans.use: To invest in the rental of a small locale for her business
