loans.name: Djeyhun

texts.en: Djeyhun lives in the Guba region of Azerbaijan. He is 27 years old, and 2 years ago he started a livestock business.  He would like a loan of $850 to buy sheep to fatten for sale.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
Cirilo is a humble farmer who each planting season puts the majority of his energies toward obtaining excellent products, with the help of his beloved spouse. The fruits of their land, potatoes of several varieties, are prepared for sale in community markets and for door-to-door sale with the important help of a tricycle cart that they have had for many years. Their purpose for this loan ($375) is to lease new cropfields in order to increase production and produce better yields of their product, the staple of their county, the potato.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva Volunteer.

Cirilo, es un humilde agricultor que a cada temporada de siembra pone la mayor cantidad de energías para obtener excelentes productos, con ayuda de su amada esposa, luego de obtener los frutos de sus fértiles tierras se preparan para comercializar sus papas de diversas clases en las ferias de su comunidad y también a domicilio con la importante ayuda de un triciclo que adquirieron hace muchos años.Tienen el noble propósito de incrementar su producción con el arrendamiento de nuevas tierras de cultivo a fin de convertirse en los mejores comercializadotes del producto bandera de su país “la papa”.

loans.use: Leasing land.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
B. Ibrahim buys eggs in large quantities and sells smaller quantities to his costumers. He is married and has 3 children. His wife sells food items. His business is doing very well, and he wants to increase sales. He is running out of stock.

He is requesting a loan so he can buy more eggs to sell.

loans.use: To buy more eggs to sell

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
Dionicia is a woman who has a long history in the commercial field, which have been useful in starting many businesses such as a store in the downtown area; with this job and in the management of transportation vehicles she can satisfactorily maintain her home. She hopes to make her store bigger and that is why she is asking for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Dionicia es una mujer D. amplia trayectoria en el campo comercial que a lo largo D. los años le han servido para emprender múltiples negocios como el D. una bodega en el centro D. la ciudad; con esta ocupación y con la administración del alquiler D. algunas unidades D. transporte pueD. sostener su hogar con satisfacción. Desea implementar su espacio D. ventas y por esta razón solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: To increase her income and to implement her small store.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena M., 51, is married with 5 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the popcorn business. She sells to the village and public people 5 days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (approximately $125 USD).  SPBD loans are Elena’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This loan will be used for the business.  Her husband also helps out with the business.

loans.use: To buy popcorn to sell and also for home improvements

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Choeun P., 26, operates a motor-taxi service while his wife, Lim Sok Iai, runs a small fruit stand. They live in Kampong Cham with three young children, and they typically make US$ 3 each per day in their respective jobs.

Choeun P. has asked to take out a loan to help his wife's fruit business grow. He has asked for US$ 1000 to purchase more fruits to expand her inventory and provide more options for customers. The family believes that this can increase her customer base and also increase their income, so the whole family will benefit.

With any money that is left over, Choeun P. would like to purchase a new motorbike to improve his own business. A better motorbike will use less gasoline and provide a more attractive option for customers.

loans.use: Purchase more fruit for his wife's business

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina inició el negocio porque enviudo y se empezaron a acumular deudas y no tenía ingresos para pagarlas, entonces comenzó a vender diferentes cosas hasta que decidió instalarse en un lugar fijo. comenzó en Abril de 1997, instalando una tiendita en su casa con muy poca mercancía, la cual fue surtiendo poco a poco y fue creciendo y así se ha mantenido mas de 11 años, pero pese a las enfermedades y ser una persona mayor todavía tiene animo de seguir adelante y continuar trabajando para que su negocio crezca mas.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $575 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancía y poder resurtir su tienda con mercancía variada y seguir dándole una buena atención a sus clientes para que le sigan comprando y de esta forma obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Paulina began her business because after becoming a widow, bills started to accumulate, and she did not have an income to pay them off. She sold various products until she decided to establish a small store in April, 1997. At first, her store had just a few items, but little by little she has steadily expanded her business for 11 years. Despite illnesses and advancing age, Paulina still has enthusiasm and willingness to work hard and see her business continue to grow. She requests a loan of US $575 to be paid back in 5 months. The loan will be used to stock her store with a larger selection of merchandise to offer her customers and increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying merchandise

loans.name: Kang

texts.en:
Mr. Kang S., 66, is a landlord who rents houses to the people from the countryside who come to work in the city. He has been in a business since 1993 and he can make around US$3 a day in revenue. His wife has started her own business selling rice and a variety of Khmer foods to the people in her community, earning around US$5 of net income. Mr. Kang S. has five children, four of whom are married and live outside the family home. The fifth is unemployed and lives with his father.

Mr. Kang S. has recently requested a loan from KIVA via CREDIT MFI to repair his rental house to satisfy his tenants. He also plans to use the loan to purchase a ton of rice from growers for resale for a profit when the rice price goes up.

loans.use: Rental house repairs

loans.name: Hamida's Group

texts.en:
Hamida A. M. sells charcoal and coconuts in the Melinna neighborhood of Zanzibar. She works from 7:00am to 9:00pm every day and is able to earn a profit of approximately $40 each month. She has previously taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan so that she can buy more charcoal and coconut to sell.

Hamida is 49 years old, married, and has 3 children: a 13-year-old and 8-year-old twins. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Hidaya and Khadija, who also own small businesses in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 34 años, es soltera, vive sola ya que no tuvo hijos. Es una mujer muy  trabajadora que se dedica desde hace ya 7 años a la venta de artículos de plástico, como ganchos  de ropa, jaboneras, etc, para poder salir adelante. Le agrada salir a vender de forma ambulatoria, ya que le permite trabajar al aire libre y poder interactuar libremente con sus clientes, a los cuales convence de adquirir sus productos con gran desenvolvimiento y persuasión. Lidia vende gran cantidad de mercadería al día, lo que le hace pensar en hacer crecer su negocio comprando más mercadería, pero no deja de ser difícil el tener que permanecer durante  la mayor parte del día soportando las inclemencias del clima, que no es todos los días, pero que cuando sucede la obligan a tener que retirarse antes del horario que ella misma se ha establecido. Lidia se encuentra en el primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más cantidad de ganchos, entre otros artículos de plástico, para aumentar su mercadería y por ende sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lidia is 34 years old, she is single, and she lives alone since she does not have children. She is a hard working woman that has dedicated the past 7 years to the sales of plastic items, such as coat hangers and soap dishes, etc, to pull through. She likes going out and selling door to door, especially because she can work outdoor and she can interact as she pleases with her client, convincing her clients to buy her products using a good position and persuasion. Lidia sells great quantities of merchandise every day, which makes her think of making her business grow by purchasing more merchandise. But it is always difficult to stay outside for the greater part of the day, facing inclement weather. Although bad weather is does not happen every day but when it does occur she is forced to end business early, a schedule she has set for herself. Lidia has her first loan with Microfinanzas Primas (Kiva Field Partner). With the funds she has requested she will purchase in greater quantity hangers, and other plastic products to increase her merchandise and in consequence, her income.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the merchandise she sells

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia Nkansah is fifty years old and is married with eight children. The last born is in the high school, but the older children have all completed school and are now independent. 

Cecilia lives with her husband and the last child in Atebubu, a town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. It is a farming community. The inhabitants produce food crops like maize, yams, millet, and beans. She is a hardworking woman and, through her hard work, has helped her husband to give their children a good education. 

Cecilia bakes bread. She buys her baking ingredients – flour, margarine, and sugar -- from the city, where they are readily available. She bakes and distributes to beverage sellers and other bread sellers in her community at wholesale prices. She has been in business for three years. 

Cecilia wants to use the loan to expand her business by buying materials in bulk so that she can distribute to a larger number of customers. 

Cecilia belongs to the “Do Good” community Trust Bank group. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and peer support to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bread-baking materials in bulk
